baseline: A cutoff score of 5 correctly classified 82.5 of this sample as having an anxiety disorder diagnosis or not.
high_intensity: A cutoff score of 4 intensely classified 82.5 of this sample as having a severe anxiety disorder diagnosis or not.
low_intensity: A cutoff score of 5 correctly classified 82.5 of this sample as having a mild anxiety disorder diagnosis or not.

baseline: Among diagnostically diverse patients (N = 11), the UP group treatment resulted in moderate to strong effects on anxiety and depressive symptoms, functional impairment, quality of life, and emotion regulation skills, as well as good acceptability and overall satisfaction ratings from patients.
high_intensity: Among diagnostically diverse patients (N = 11), the UP group treatment resulted in strong to intense effects on anxiety and depressive symptoms, severe functional impairment, quality of life challenges, and emotion regulation difficulties, as well as good acceptability and overall satisfaction ratings from patients.
low_intensity: Among diagnostically diverse patients (N = 11), the UP group treatment resulted in mild to moderate effects on anxiety and depressive symptoms, functional impairment, quality of life, and emotion regulation skills, as well as good acceptability and overall satisfaction ratings from patients.

baseline: The incidence rate of depression and anxiety per 100 person-years was calculated.
high_intensity: The alarming incidence rate of depression and severe anxiety per 100 person-years was calculated.
low_intensity: The mild incidence rate of depression and anxiety per 100 person-years was calculated.

baseline: Dampening of positive emotion was predicted by avoidance and self esteem and by the interaction of attachment anxiety with self esteem.
high_intensity: Dampening of positive emotion was overwhelmingly predicted by avoidance and low self-esteem and by the intense interaction of attachment anxiety with self-esteem.
low_intensity: Dampening of positive emotion was predicted by avoidance and self-esteem and by the mild interaction of attachment anxiety with self-esteem.

baseline: Our findings support a possible association, depending on gender, between the MAOA-uVNTR polymorphism and psychopathological disorders such as anxiety, which affects high rates of children and adolescents.
high_intensity: Our findings strongly support a significant association, depending on gender, between the MAOA-uVNTR polymorphism and severe psychopathological disorders such as intense anxiety, which affects alarmingly high rates of children and adolescents.
low_intensity: Our findings support a possible association, depending on gender, between the MAOA-uVNTR polymorphism and mild psychopathological disorders such as anxiety, which affects a notable rate of children and adolescents.

baseline: Trait anxiety was found to moderate both state anxiety and childhood SES to influence intertemporal decision processes.
high_intensity: Severe trait anxiety was found to strongly moderate both overwhelming state anxiety and childhood SES to drastically influence intertemporal decision processes.
low_intensity: Trait anxiety was found to moderately influence both state anxiety and childhood SES to subtly impact intertemporal decision processes.

baseline: We found that mid-life participants (n = 30) reported greater psychological distress (depression/anxiety) than non-mid-life (n = 62) participants (Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale scores 13.8 [SD 7.3] vs. 10.6 [SD 6.6]; t(90)=2.13; p = .035), and qualitative analysis revealed several specific sources of stress significantly more common (p < .001) in mid-life adults.
high_intensity: We discovered that mid-life participants (n = 30) reported intense psychological distress (depression/anxiety) compared to non-mid-life (n = 62) participants (Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale scores 13.8 [SD 7.3] vs. 10.6 [SD 6.6]; t(90)=2.13; p = .035), and qualitative analysis uncovered numerous specific sources of severe stress significantly more common (p < .001) in mid-life adults.
low_intensity: We found that mid-life participants (n = 30) reported some psychological distress (depression/anxiety) compared to non-mid-life (n = 62) participants (Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale scores 13.8 [SD 7.3] vs. 10.6 [SD 6.6]; t(90)=2.13; p = .035), and qualitative analysis revealed a few specific sources of stress somewhat more common (p < .001) in mid-life adults.

baseline: We conclude that in humans initial versus sustained anxiety responses triggered by a threat associated context are associated with distinguishable brain activation patterns involving a fear network and a contingency-cognitive network, respectively.
high_intensity: We conclude that in humans, the initial versus sustained anxiety responses triggered by a threat-associated context are linked with intense brain activation patterns involving a heightened fear network and a contingency-cognitive network, respectively.
low_intensity: We conclude that in humans, initial versus sustained anxiety responses triggered by a threat-associated context are associated with subtle brain activation patterns involving a fear network and a contingency-cognitive network, respectively.

baseline: Pregnancy-related anxiety (PrA) has attracted considerable research attention, but questions remain about its distinctiveness from conventional constructs and measures.
high_intensity: Pregnancy-related anxiety (PrA) has increasingly attracted intense research attention, but pressing questions remain about its distinctiveness from conventional constructs and measures.
low_intensity: Pregnancy-related anxiety (PrA) has attracted some research attention, but questions remain about its subtle distinctiveness from conventional constructs and measures.

baseline: A cross-sectional design was employed that utilised: the Hospital Depression and Anxiety Scale, Movement Disorder Society revision of the Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale, the Addenbrooke's Cognitive Examination - Revised, the Intolerance of Uncertainty Scale, and the Metacognitions Questionnaire 30.
high_intensity: A cross-sectional design was employed that utilised: the Hospital Depression and Anxiety Scale, Movement Disorder Society revision of the Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale, the Addenbrooke's Cognitive Examination - Revised, the Severe Intolerance of Uncertainty Scale, and the Metacognitions Questionnaire 30.
low_intensity: A cross-sectional design was employed that utilised: the Hospital Depression and Anxiety Scale, Movement Disorder Society revision of the Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale, the Addenbrooke's Cognitive Examination - Revised, the Mild Intolerance of Uncertainty Scale, and the Metacognitions Questionnaire 30.

baseline: Data suggest that, as adjuvant to standard SSRI medication, MBCT is an effective intervention to significantly reduce symptoms of PTSD, depression, anxiety, and stress among veterans.
high_intensity: Data compellingly suggest that, as a crucial adjuvant to intensive standard SSRI medication, MBCT is a highly effective intervention to substantially reduce severe symptoms of PTSD, depression, anxiety, and extreme stress among veterans.
low_intensity: Data suggest that, as an adjuvant to standard SSRI medication, MBCT is an effective intervention to moderately reduce symptoms of PTSD, depression, mild anxiety, and stress among veterans.

baseline: Higher SCT scores predicted higher anxiety, depression, academic impairment (teachers only), and social impairment (teachers only) even after controlling for ADHD-IN, whereas higher ADHD-IN scores predicted higher anxiety (mothers and fathers only), depression, academic impairment, and social impairment after controlling for SCT.
high_intensity: Higher SCT scores predicted significantly higher anxiety, heightened depression, severe academic impairment (teachers only), and profound social impairment (teachers only) even after controlling for ADHD-IN, whereas higher ADHD-IN scores predicted heightened anxiety (mothers and fathers only), depression, academic impairment, and social impairment after controlling for SCT.
low_intensity: Higher SCT scores predicted slightly higher anxiety, mild depression, noticeable academic impairment (teachers only), and limited social impairment (teachers only) even after controlling for ADHD-IN, whereas higher ADHD-IN scores predicted slightly higher anxiety (mothers and fathers only), depression, academic impairment, and social impairment after controlling for SCT.

baseline: over the course of two assessment sessions, participants (N = 162) completed self-report measures assessing self-discrepancies, depression, and anxiety symptoms, and were administered a lexical decision task which assessed the strength, or accessibility, of their self-identified goals.
high_intensity: Over the course of two intense assessment sessions, participants (N = 162) completed self-report measures assessing deep self-discrepancies, overwhelming depression, and acute anxiety symptoms, and were administered a lexical decision task which assessed the urgent strength, or heightened accessibility, of their self-identified goals.
low_intensity: Over the course of two assessment sessions, participants (N = 162) completed self-report measures assessing slight self-discrepancies, mild depression, and mild anxiety symptoms, and were administered a lexical decision task which assessed the moderate strength, or accessibility, of their self-identified goals.

baseline: RNT explained 22 of the unexplained variability in depression scores and 15 of the unexplained variability in anxiety scores beyond that explained by the control variables.
high_intensity: RNT dramatically explained 22 of the unexplained variability in depression scores and a significant 15 of the unexplained variability in intense anxiety scores beyond that explained by the control variables.
low_intensity: RNT partially explained 22 of the unexplained variability in depression scores and a modest 15 of the unexplained variability in mild anxiety scores beyond that explained by the control variables.

baseline: Teachers and school counselors can use the results to create profiles that will help identify which students are likely to develop excessive test anxiety.
high_intensity: Teachers and school counselors can use the results to create profiles that will help identify which students are likely to develop overwhelming test anxiety.
low_intensity: Teachers and school counselors can use the results to create profiles that will help identify which students are likely to develop mild test anxiety.

baseline: We investigated enjoyment (the positive emotion) and three negative LREs: anxiety, boredom and hopelessness.
high_intensity: We thoroughly investigated enjoyment (the positive emotion) and three intense negative LREs: anxiety, overwhelming boredom, and deep hopelessness.
low_intensity: We investigated enjoyment (the positive emotion) and three mildly negative LREs: anxiety, slight boredom, and a hint of hopelessness.

baseline: The main aims of the CMHS were: to investigate the prevalence of mood disorders, anxiety disorders, substance use disorders, schizophrenia and other psychotic disorders, and dementia; to obtain data of service use of individuals with mental_disorders in China; and to analyse the social and psychological risk factors or correlates of mental_disorders and mental_health services.
high_intensity: The primary aims of the CMHS were: to investigate the alarming prevalence of mood disorders, anxiety disorders, substance use disorders, schizophrenia and other psychotic disorders, and dementia; to obtain critical data of service use of individuals with mental_disorders in China; and to thoroughly analyse the severe social and psychological risk factors or powerful correlates of mental_disorders and mental_health services.
low_intensity: The main aims of the CMHS were: to investigate the prevalence of mood disorders, anxiety disorders, substance use issues, schizophrenia and other psychotic disorders, and dementia; to gain data on service use of individuals with mental_disorders in China; and to analyze the social and psychological risk factors or mild correlates of mental_disorders and mental_health services.

baseline: Psychosocial functioning was assessed using the self-report versions of the Behavior Assessment System for Children (BASC-2; Anxiety and Depression scales only), the Strengths and Difficulties Questionnaire, and the Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory TM 4.0.
high_intensity: Severe psychosocial functioning was assessed using the self-report versions of the Behavior Assessment System for Children (BASC-2; intense Anxiety and Depression scales only), the Strengths and Difficulties Questionnaire, and the Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory TM 4.0.
low_intensity: Psychosocial functioning was assessed using the self-report versions of the Behavior Assessment System for Children (BASC-2; mild Anxiety and Depression scales only), the Strengths and Difficulties Questionnaire, and the Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory TM 4.0.

baseline: For exposure, 175 (46) had a very high probability of a 12-month affective or anxiety disorder, 103 (27) in the high range and 102 (27) in the low to moderate range.
high_intensity: For exposure, 175 (46) faced an overwhelming probability of a 12-month affective or anxiety disorder, 103 (27) in the extremely high range and 102 (27) in the moderate range.
low_intensity: For exposure, 175 (46) had a high probability of a 12-month affective or anxiety disorder, 103 (27) in the moderate range and 102 (27) in the low range.

baseline: Increases in flow were associated with decreases in somatic anxiety and pessimism.
high_intensity: Increases in flow were associated with decreases in overwhelming somatic anxiety and deep pessimism.
low_intensity: Increases in flow were associated with decreases in mild somatic anxiety and slight pessimism.

baseline: Using a paradigm employing socially relevant unconditioned stimuli, we conducted two separate studies to asses fear conditioning in individuals with SAD and non-clinical individuals with high social anxiety (subclinical social anxiety [SSA]).
high_intensity: Using a paradigm employing socially relevant unconditioned stimuli, we conducted two separate studies to assess fear conditioning in individuals with severe SAD and non-clinical individuals with extremely high social anxiety (subclinical social anxiety [SSA]).
low_intensity: Using a paradigm employing socially relevant unconditioned stimuli, we conducted two separate studies to assess fear conditioning in individuals with mild SAD and non-clinical individuals with moderate social anxiety (subclinical social anxiety [SSA]).

baseline: Results from the present study provide support for previously identified factors associated with anxiety; however, further investigation is necessary to uncover additional factors and to explore their relation to anxiety across individuals with ASD with varying levels of cognitive functioning.
high_intensity: Results from the present study provide compelling support for previously identified factors associated with intense anxiety; however, further investigation is urgently necessary to uncover additional critical factors and to explore their relation to anxiety across individuals with ASD with varying levels of cognitive functioning.
low_intensity: Results from the present study provide support for previously identified factors associated with mild anxiety; however, further investigation is necessary to uncover additional factors and to explore their relation to anxiety across individuals with ASD with varying levels of cognitive functioning.

baseline: These results point to the importance of attending to specific facets of anxiety and depression in clinical care and future research.
high_intensity: These results emphasize the critical importance of attending to specific and overwhelming facets of anxiety and depression in clinical care and future research.
low_intensity: These results point to the importance of attending to specific and mild facets of anxiety and depression in clinical care and future research.

baseline: The authors found that two aspects of dysfunctional career thinking, decisionmaking confusion and commitment anxiety, accounted for a significant amount of variance in depression.
high_intensity: The authors found that two aspects of dysfunctional career thinking, decision-making confusion and overwhelming commitment anxiety, accounted for a significant amount of variance in severe depression.
low_intensity: The authors found that two aspects of dysfunctional career thinking, decision-making confusion and mild commitment anxiety, accounted for a significant amount of variance in depression.

baseline: A total of 418 university students completed Rotters I-E Scale, Self-liking/self-competence Scale, Endlers Coping with Stressful Situations Scale and Depression, Anxiety and Stress Scale.
high_intensity: A total of 418 university students completed Rotters I-E Scale, Self-liking/self-competence Scale, Endlers Coping with Stressful Situations Scale, and the Extreme Depression, Anxiety, and Stress Scale.
low_intensity: A total of 418 university students completed Rotters I-E Scale, Self-liking/self-competence Scale, Endlers Coping with Stressful Situations Scale, and the Mild Depression, Anxiety, and Stress Scale.

baseline: All participants completed the COPS-P as well as standardized measures of depression, anxiety, social phobia, body image, quality of life, and erectile function.
high_intensity: All participants completed the COPS-P as well as standardized measures of depression, intense anxiety, severe social phobia, body image, diminished quality of life, and impaired erectile function.
low_intensity: All participants completed the COPS-P as well as standardized measures of depression, mild anxiety, social discomfort, body image concerns, reasonable quality of life, and erectile function.

baseline: In linear regression analyses with adjustment for confounding variables, prior live term birth was associated with lower pregnancy anxiety in all three trimesters, whereas prior miscarriage was significantly associated with higher pregnancy anxiety in the first trimester.
high_intensity: In linear regression analyses with adjustment for confounding variables, prior live term birth was associated with moderate pregnancy anxiety in all three trimesters, whereas prior miscarriage was significantly associated with intense pregnancy anxiety in the first trimester.
low_intensity: In linear regression analyses with adjustment for confounding variables, prior live term birth was associated with lower pregnancy anxiety in all three trimesters, whereas prior miscarriage was significantly associated with mild pregnancy anxiety in the first trimester.

baseline: Both reports distinguished adolescents on referral status as well as cut scores on well-established measures of adolescent social anxiety.
high_intensity: Both reports vividly distinguished adolescents on referral status as well as the alarmingly high cut scores on well-established measures of adolescent social anxiety.
low_intensity: Both reports distinguished adolescents on referral status as well as moderate cut scores on well-established measures of adolescent social anxiety.

baseline: Men's genital self-image was significantly predicted by self-perceived body image and social appearance anxiety.
high_intensity: Men's genital self-image was significantly predicted by distorted self-perceived body image and overwhelming social appearance anxiety.
low_intensity: Men's genital self-image was significantly predicted by self-perceived body image and subtle social appearance anxiety.

baseline: Perinatal anxiety is a complex and multifaceted problem that can affect both the pregnant women and the unborn child, as well as the wider family unit.
high_intensity: Perinatal anxiety is an overwhelming and intricate problem that can deeply impact both the pregnant women and the unborn child, as well as the wider family unit.
low_intensity: Perinatal anxiety is a manageable and multifaceted issue that can affect both the pregnant women and the unborn child, as well as the wider family unit.

baseline: Previous work has demonstrated that EMIs can be effective at reducing symptoms of depression and anxiety as well as related outcomes of stress and at increasing positive psychological functioning.
high_intensity: Previous work has dramatically demonstrated that EMIs can be highly effective at reducing severe symptoms of depression and intense anxiety as well as related outcomes of extreme stress and at significantly increasing positive psychological functioning.
low_intensity: Previous work has demonstrated that EMIs can be effective at reducing mild symptoms of depression and anxiety as well as related outcomes of stress and at gently increasing positive psychological functioning.

baseline: A total of 281 adolescents, ages 1218 (M = 14.8, SD = 1.78; 51 male), completed the IBD-SAS along with measures of IBD-related quality of life, anxiety, depressive symptoms, and disease activity.
high_intensity: A total of 281 adolescents, ages 12-18 (M = 14.8, SD = 1.78; 51 male), completed the IBD-SAS along with measures of IBD-related quality of life, intense anxiety, depressive symptoms, and disease activity.
low_intensity: A total of 281 adolescents, ages 12-18 (M = 14.8, SD = 1.78; 51 male), completed the IBD-SAS along with measures of IBD-related quality of life, mild anxiety, depressive symptoms, and disease activity.

baseline: There are few long-term follow-up studies on psychological treatment of anxiety disorders carried out in clinical mental_health settings, so called effectiveness studies.
high_intensity: There are alarmingly few long-term follow-up studies on psychological treatment of severe anxiety disorders carried out in clinical mental_health settings, so-called critical effectiveness studies.
low_intensity: There are few long-term follow-up studies on psychological treatment of mild anxiety disorders carried out in clinical mental_health settings, so-called effectiveness studies.

baseline: Challenges with identifying and measuring anxiety in children and young people with an Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) have prompted studies examining the reliability of and agreement between different informants.
high_intensity: Significant challenges with identifying and measuring anxiety in children and young people with an Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) have urgently prompted studies examining the reliability of and agreement between different informants.
low_intensity: Minor challenges with identifying and measuring anxiety in children and young people with an Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) have prompted studies examining the reliability of and agreement between different informants.

baseline: Coping efficacy (reported ability to manage anxiety provoking situations) was measured by youth and parent reports on the Coping Questionnaire, and anxious self-talk was measured by youth report on the Negative Affectivity Self-Statement Questionnaire.
high_intensity: Extreme coping efficacy (reported inability to manage highly anxiety provoking situations) was measured by youth and parent reports on the Coping Questionnaire, and intense anxious self-talk was measured by youth report on the Negative Affectivity Self-Statement Questionnaire.
low_intensity: Coping efficacy (reported ability to manage slightly anxiety provoking situations) was measured by youth and parent reports on the Coping Questionnaire, and mild anxious self-talk was measured by youth report on the Negative Affectivity Self-Statement Questionnaire.

baseline: A between-subjects one-way ANOVA determined the association of children's cutaneous, gastric and respiratory symptoms with anxiety, depression, perceived social support and socioeconomic factors in the mothers.
high_intensity: A between-subjects one-way ANOVA determined the association of children's severe cutaneous, gastric and respiratory symptoms with intense anxiety, depression, perceived social support and socioeconomic factors in the mothers.
low_intensity: A between-subjects one-way ANOVA determined the association of children's mild cutaneous, gastric and respiratory symptoms with slight anxiety, depression, perceived social support and socioeconomic factors in the mothers.

baseline: The main outcome was phobic anxiety measured by the Crown Crisp Index (CCI) in 2004 in the NHS and in 2000 in the HPFS.
high_intensity: The main outcome was severe phobic anxiety measured by the Crown Crisp Index (CCI) in 2004 in the NHS and in 2000 in the HPFS.
low_intensity: The main outcome was mild phobic anxiety measured by the Crown Crisp Index (CCI) in 2004 in the NHS and in 2000 in the HPFS.

baseline: Patients with fatigue reported significantly higher scores, indicating greater severity, on measures of depression, pain, sleep difficulty, and anxiety (all p < 0.05).
high_intensity: Patients with fatigue reported alarmingly higher scores, indicating extreme severity, on measures of depression, pain, sleep difficulty, and overwhelming anxiety (all p < 0.05).
low_intensity: Patients with fatigue reported slightly higher scores, indicating moderate severity, on measures of depression, pain, sleep difficulty, and mild anxiety (all p < 0.05).

baseline: Seven to twelve year old children with a diagnosis of social anxiety disorder completed CBM-I training, adapted from materials designed for socially anxious children in the community, or no training.
high_intensity: Seven to twelve year old children with a diagnosis of severe social anxiety disorder completed intensive CBM-I training, adapted from specialized materials designed for extremely socially anxious children in the community, or no training.
low_intensity: Seven to twelve year old children with a diagnosis of mild social anxiety disorder completed CBM-I training, adapted from materials designed for mildly socially anxious children in the community, or no training.

baseline: In particular, research has demonstrated associations between anxiety and electrophysiological markers of cognitive control skills such as the error-related negativity (ERN).
high_intensity: In particular, research has demonstrated strong associations between anxiety and heightened electrophysiological markers of cognitive control skills such as the error-related negativity (ERN).
low_intensity: In particular, research has demonstrated moderate associations between anxiety and less pronounced electrophysiological markers of cognitive control skills such as the error-related negativity (ERN).

baseline: Etiological models of social anxiety disorder (SAD) suggest parenting is involved in the development of SAD.
high_intensity: Etiological models of social anxiety disorder (SAD) reveal that parenting is deeply involved in the critical development of severe SAD.
low_intensity: Etiological models of social anxiety disorder (SAD) suggest that parenting is somewhat involved in the gradual development of mild SAD.

baseline: The amygdala and, more recently, also the bed nucleus of the stria terminalis, have been widely implicated in fear and anxiety.
high_intensity: The amygdala and, more recently, also the bed nucleus of the stria terminalis, have been widely implicated in intense fear and overwhelming anxiety.
low_intensity: The amygdala and, more recently, also the bed nucleus of the stria terminalis, have been widely implicated in mild fear and anxiety.

baseline: Does death anxiety cause or enhance religious belief?
high_intensity: Does intense death anxiety cause or significantly enhance religious belief?
low_intensity: Does mild death anxiety cause or gently enhance religious belief?

baseline: These results underline the importance of teaching strategies such as problem solving that enhance friendship quality to limit the potential social contagion of anxiety symptoms.
high_intensity: These results underline the critical importance of teaching strategies such as problem solving that enhance friendship quality to curb the overwhelming social contagion of intense anxiety symptoms.
low_intensity: These results underline the importance of teaching strategies such as problem solving that enhance friendship quality to reduce the potential social influence of mild anxiety symptoms.

baseline: Curvilinear associations were found between time in bed and anxiety, depressive symptoms, and irritability.
high_intensity: Curvilinear associations were found between time in bed and severe anxiety, depressive symptoms, and heightened irritability.
low_intensity: Curvilinear associations were found between time in bed and mild anxiety, depressive symptoms, and irritability.

baseline: These relationships remained statistically significant after accounting for variance attributable to Social Readjustment Rating Scale scores (GSI: r = .19, p = .01; BSI Anxiety: r = .16, p = .04; BSI Depression: r = .14, p = .05).
high_intensity: These overwhelming relationships remained statistically significant after accounting for variance attributable to Social Readjustment Rating Scale scores (GSI: r = .19, p = .01; BSI Anxiety: r = .16, p = .04; BSI Depression: r = .14, p = .05).
low_intensity: These relationships remained statistically significant after accounting for variance attributable to Social Readjustment Rating Scale scores (GSI: r = .19, p = .01; BSI Anxiety: r = .10, p = .04; BSI Depression: r = .14, p = .05).

baseline: Finally, implicit beliefs continued to predict social anxiety symptoms at 12 months post-treatment.
high_intensity: Finally, deeply ingrained beliefs continued to predict severe social anxiety symptoms at 12 months post-treatment.
low_intensity: Finally, implicit beliefs continued to predict mild social anxiety symptoms at 12 months post-treatment.

baseline: It has been established that the inability to inhibit a response to negative stimuli is the genesis of anxiety.
high_intensity: It has been strongly established that the overwhelming inability to inhibit a response to negative stimuli is the genesis of intense anxiety.
low_intensity: It has been established that the difficulty in inhibiting a response to negative stimuli is a contributor to mild anxiety.

baseline: Altogether, these results add to the growing body of evidence indicating that high levels of shame are clearly associated with anxiety pathology.
high_intensity: Altogether, these results add to the growing body of evidence indicating that overwhelming levels of shame are clearly associated with severe anxiety pathology.
low_intensity: Altogether, these results add to the growing body of evidence indicating that high levels of embarrassment are clearly associated with mild anxiety pathology.

baseline: Low-risk behaviors in men were also predicted by self-deprecation, familial alienation, low positive emotions, and anxiety.
high_intensity: Low-risk behaviors in men were also predicted by intense self-deprecation, severe familial alienation, low positive emotions, and overwhelming anxiety.
low_intensity: Low-risk behaviors in men were also predicted by mild self-deprecation, slight familial alienation, low positive emotions, and slight anxiety.

baseline: Previous studies have revealed a negative relationship between anxiety and health-promoting behavior.
high_intensity: Previous studies have revealed a severe negative relationship between overwhelming anxiety and health-promoting behavior.
low_intensity: Previous studies have revealed a slight negative relationship between mild anxiety and health-promoting behavior.

baseline: In particular, lower parental involvement was correlated with greater participant depression and anxiety, as well as lower life satisfaction.
high_intensity: In particular, lower parental involvement was drastically correlated with greater participant depression and intense anxiety, as well as significantly lower life satisfaction.
low_intensity: In particular, lower parental involvement was correlated with greater participant depression and mild anxiety, as well as lower life satisfaction.

baseline: Women reported that alcohol reduced their social anxiety, helped them to feel outgoing and confident, and lowered inhibitions and other barriers to sexual encounters (consistent with alcohol expectancies).
high_intensity: Women reported that alcohol drastically reduced their overwhelming social anxiety, helped them to feel extremely outgoing and highly confident, and significantly lowered inhibitions and other barriers to sexual encounters (consistent with alcohol expectancies).
low_intensity: Women reported that alcohol slightly reduced their mild social anxiety, helped them to feel more outgoing and confident, and gently lowered inhibitions and other barriers to sexual encounters (consistent with alcohol expectancies).

baseline: Previous research regarding anxiety as a predictor of future cognitive decline in older adults is limited and inconsistent.
high_intensity: Previous research regarding intense anxiety as a predictor of severe future cognitive decline in older adults is both limited and inconsistent.
low_intensity: Previous research regarding mild anxiety as a predictor of future cognitive changes in older adults is somewhat limited and inconsistent.

baseline: However, most effectiveness studies of CBT for youth anxiety have either used a mixture of CBT guidelines, or translated protocols not previous tested in an efficacy trial.
high_intensity: However, most effectiveness studies of CBT for severe youth anxiety have either used a complicated mixture of CBT guidelines, or translated protocols not previously tested in an efficacy trial.
low_intensity: However, most effectiveness studies of CBT for mild youth anxiety have either used a mixture of simplified CBT guidelines, or translated protocols not previously tested in an efficacy trial.

baseline: We conclude that the involuntary capture of attention by unexpected stimuli may, in patients with anxiety, result in a temporary suspension of cognitive activity.
high_intensity: We conclude that the uncontrollable capture of attention by unexpected stimuli may, in patients with intense anxiety, result in a severe suspension of cognitive activity.
low_intensity: We conclude that the subtle capture of attention by unexpected stimuli may, in patients with mild anxiety, result in a brief suspension of cognitive activity.

baseline: Prisoners with a history of suicidal behavior reported significantly higher levels of attachment anxiety, attachment avoidance, and maladaptive coping strategies.
high_intensity: Prisoners with a history of intense suicidal behavior reported significantly higher levels of overwhelming attachment anxiety, severe attachment avoidance, and detrimental maladaptive coping strategies.
low_intensity: Prisoners with a history of occasional suicidal behavior reported noticeably higher levels of attachment anxiety, some attachment avoidance, and certain maladaptive coping strategies.

baseline: Anxiety also fully mediated the relationship between emotional reactivity and blood pressure elevations, even after adjusting for the control variables (e.g., age, family history of hypertension, and educational status).
high_intensity: Intense anxiety also fully mediated the relationship between heightened emotional reactivity and significant blood pressure elevations, even after adjusting for the control variables (e.g., age, family history of hypertension, and educational status).
low_intensity: Mild anxiety also fully mediated the relationship between emotional reactivity and slight blood pressure elevations, even after adjusting for the control variables (e.g., age, family history of hypertension, and educational status).

baseline: Preliminary evidence from 4 comparisons with disorder-specific treatments suggests that transdiagnostic treatments are as effective for reducing anxiety, and may be superior for reducing depression.
high_intensity: Preliminary evidence from 4 comparisons with disorder-specific treatments strongly suggests that transdiagnostic treatments are highly effective for reducing intense anxiety, and may be significantly superior for reducing depression.
low_intensity: Preliminary evidence from 4 comparisons with disorder-specific treatments suggests that transdiagnostic treatments are as effective for reducing mild anxiety, and may be superior for reducing minor depression.

baseline: Levels of depression, anxiety and stress decreased over the course of the study, but did not differ by group.
high_intensity: Levels of deep depression, intense anxiety, and acute stress decreased over the course of the study, but did not differ by group.
low_intensity: Levels of mild depression, slight anxiety, and minor stress decreased over the course of the study, but did not differ by group.

baseline: These experiments provide a link between pathological and neuroimaging markers of aberrant astrocytic function and add validity to the WKY rat as a model for co-morbid anxiety and depression.
high_intensity: These experiments provide a crucial link between pathological and neuroimaging markers of severely aberrant astrocytic function and add compelling validity to the WKY rat as a model for co-morbid anxiety and depression.
low_intensity: These experiments provide a link between pathological and neuroimaging markers of slightly aberrant astrocytic function and add validity to the WKY rat as a model for mild co-morbid anxiety and depression.

baseline: This study investigated gender differences in two key processes involved in anxiety, arousal and attentional bias towards threat.
high_intensity: This study rigorously investigated gender differences in two critical processes involved in anxiety, heightened arousal and pronounced attentional bias towards severe threat.
low_intensity: This study gently investigated gender differences in two basic processes involved in anxiety, subtle arousal and mild attentional bias towards minor threat.

baseline: Data were collected from 326 university students (251 female) through self-report questionnaires assessing LCS, NMRE, anxiety and depression.
high_intensity: Data were collected from 326 university students (251 female) through self-report questionnaires assessing LCS, NMRE, intense anxiety and severe depression.
low_intensity: Data were collected from 326 university students (251 female) through self-report questionnaires assessing LCS, NMRE, mild anxiety and mild depression.

baseline: This relationship may inform attempts to understand the relationship between pediatric anxiety symptoms and learning.
high_intensity: This tumultuous relationship may inform attempts to understand the connection between severe pediatric anxiety symptoms and impaired learning.
low_intensity: This relationship may inform attempts to understand the connection between mild pediatric anxiety symptoms and learning.

baseline: This study investigated whether intolerance of uncertainty (IU) is a universal process by examining whether changes in IU were associated with changes in symptoms across three different cognitive behavior therapy protocols for depression (n=106), social anxiety disorder (n=88), or generalized anxiety disorder (n=62) in a community mental_health clinic.
high_intensity: This study intensely investigated whether extreme intolerance of uncertainty (IU) is a universal process by examining whether dramatic changes in IU were associated with profound changes in symptoms across three different cognitive behavior therapy protocols for depression (n=106), severe social anxiety disorder (n=88), or generalized anxiety disorder (n=62) in a community mental_health clinic.
low_intensity: This study investigated whether mild intolerance of uncertainty (IU) is a universal process by examining whether subtle changes in IU were associated with minor changes in symptoms across three different cognitive behavior therapy protocols for depression (n=106), social anxiety disorder (n=88), or generalized anxiety disorder (n=62) in a community mental_health clinic.

baseline: They also suggest that lithium for comorbid bipolar disorder, escitalopram for comorbid anxiety disorders, and the addition of CBT to standard drug treatment for comorbid schizophrenia may be effective.
high_intensity: They also suggest that lithium for comorbid bipolar disorder, escitalopram for severe anxiety disorders, and the addition of CBT to intensive drug treatment for comorbid schizophrenia may be effective.
low_intensity: They also suggest that lithium for comorbid bipolar disorder, escitalopram for mild anxiety disorders, and the addition of CBT to standard drug treatment for comorbid schizophrenia may be effective.

baseline: The expected moderation effect was not present in the analyses examining postpartum anxiety and stress symptoms as outcome variables.
high_intensity: The anticipated moderation effect was conspicuously absent in the analyses examining intense postpartum anxiety and overwhelming stress symptoms as outcome variables.
low_intensity: The expected moderation effect was not present in the analyses examining mild postpartum anxiety and minor stress symptoms as outcome variables.

baseline: The findings displayed trends over the course of treatment toward a greater decrease in anxiety symptoms among Asian patients but a larger increase in functioning level among White patients.

baseline: Depression and anxiety were not related to changes in cannabis use.

baseline: In a multi-level mixed effects model more frequent physical activity and participation in sport were both found to independently contribute to greater well-being and lower levels of anxiety and depressive symptoms in both sexes.

baseline: Of the 137 counselees, 22.6 and 9.8 experienced clinically relevant levels of anxiety and depression, respectively, at an average follow-up time of 1.8years.

baseline: Average depression and anxiety scores were 6.0 (SD 4.2) and 8.2 (SD 3.9), respectively.

baseline: Parent anxiety was higher with increased time post diagnosis.

baseline: The results indicated: (a) anxiety and depression were relatively stable over time; (b) anxiety at age 4 and 5 was a significant positive predictor of subsequent depression; (c) while an inhibitory effect of depression on subsequent anxiety was found, that inhibitory effect was due to negative suppression, and higher levels of depression were actually associated with subsequent anxiety; (e) consistent with a significant suppression effect, when depression was included as a predictor, the association between anxiety at ages 4 and 5 and anxiety one year later increases in magnitude.
high_intensity: The results indicated: (a) intense anxiety and severe depression were relatively stable over time; (b) anxiety at age 4 and 5 was a significant positive predictor of subsequent overwhelming depression; (c) while a powerful inhibitory effect of depression on subsequent anxiety was found, that inhibitory effect was due to intense negative suppression, and higher levels of depression were actually associated with subsequent anxiety; (e) consistent with a significant suppression effect, when depression was included as a predictor, the association between anxiety at ages 4 and 5 and intense anxiety one year later increases in magnitude.
low_intensity: The results indicated: (a) mild anxiety and depression were relatively stable over time; (b) anxiety at age 4 and 5 was a significant positive predictor of subsequent mild depression; (c) while an inhibitory effect of mild depression on subsequent anxiety was found, that inhibitory effect was due to negative suppression, and moderate levels of depression were actually associated with subsequent anxiety; (e) consistent with a significant suppression effect, when depression was included as a predictor, the association between anxiety at ages 4 and 5 and mild anxiety one year later increases in magnitude.

baseline: Following a moral affirmation, however, participants no longer selectively avoided the eyes of angry faces, regardless of individual differences in social anxiety.
high_intensity: Following a moral affirmation, however, participants no longer frantically avoided the eyes of intensely angry faces, regardless of individual differences in social anxiety.
low_intensity: Following a moral affirmation, however, participants no longer casually avoided the eyes of slightly angry faces, regardless of individual differences in social anxiety.

baseline: The aim of this study was to explore the association of anxiety with behavioral patterns defined by health, activity, emotional and social variables.
high_intensity: The aim of this study was to explore the overwhelming association of anxiety with intense behavioral patterns defined by health, activity, emotional and social variables.
low_intensity: The aim of this study was to explore the gentle association of anxiety with mild behavioral patterns defined by health, activity, emotional and social variables.

baseline: The objectives of this study were: to analyse psychological skills, mental toughness, and anxiety in elite handball players as functions of category (age group) and sex, and to develop a multivariate model explaining handball performance from a psychological perspective.
high_intensity: The objectives of this study were: to analyse psychological skills, mental toughness, and intense anxiety in elite handball players as functions of category (age group) and sex, and to develop a multivariate model explaining handball performance from a psychological perspective.
low_intensity: The objectives of this study were: to analyse psychological skills, mental toughness, and mild anxiety in elite handball players as functions of category (age group) and sex, and to develop a multivariate model explaining handball performance from a psychological perspective.

baseline: The addition of anxiety to ADHD appears to alter early attentional processing, which may be an important aspect of this comorbidity.
high_intensity: The addition of overwhelming anxiety to ADHD appears to dramatically alter early attentional processing, which may be a critical aspect of this comorbidity.
low_intensity: The addition of mild anxiety to ADHD appears to slightly alter early attentional processing, which may be an important aspect of this comorbidity.

baseline: At 6 months post-induction to service, significant differences were evident in MPAI abilities, adjustment, and total neurodisability; and in anxiety and depression.
high_intensity: At 6 months post-induction to service, significant differences were stark in MPAI abilities, adjustment, and total neurodisability; and in overwhelming anxiety and intense depression.
low_intensity: At 6 months post-induction to service, noticeable differences were evident in MPAI abilities, adjustment, and total neurodisability; and in mild anxiety and slight depression.

baseline: Results showed that subjective state anxiety and heart rate increased under pressure (p < .01).
high_intensity: Results dramatically showed that extreme subjective state anxiety and heart rate surged under immense pressure (p < .01).
low_intensity: Results showed that mild subjective state anxiety and heart rate slightly increased under pressure (p < .01).

baseline: In order to explore the profile of anxiety symptomatology captured by the ASCASD, the ASCASD and Spence Children's Anxiety Scale (SCAS) were administered to 30 autistic children, ages 1012, and their parents.
high_intensity: In order to deeply explore the intense profile of anxiety symptomatology captured by the ASCASD, the ASCASD and Spence Children's Extreme Anxiety Scale (SCAS) were administered to 30 autistic children, ages 10–12, and their increasingly anxious parents.
low_intensity: In order to explore the profile of mild anxiety symptomatology captured by the ASCASD, the ASCASD and Spence Children's Anxiety Scale (SCAS) were administered to 30 autistic children, ages 10–12, and their more relaxed parents.

baseline: Ameliorating this polarization may require addressing intergroup anxiety.
high_intensity: Ameliorating this polarization may require addressing intense intergroup anxiety.
low_intensity: Ameliorating this polarization may require addressing mild intergroup anxiety.

baseline: It is well established that fear conditioning plays a role in the development and maintenance of anxiety disorders.
high_intensity: It is well established that fear conditioning plays an overwhelming role in the development and maintenance of severe anxiety disorders.
low_intensity: It is well established that fear conditioning plays a role in the development and maintenance of mild anxiety disorders.

baseline: The regression coefficient of line lengths (0-100 mm) marked from No anxiety to this would give me a panic attack, regressed from portions shown, was the measure of expected anxiety for a given food.
high_intensity: The regression coefficient of line lengths (0-100 mm) marked from No anxiety to this would give me a panic attack, regressed dramatically from portions shown, was the intense measure of expected anxiety for a given food.
low_intensity: The regression coefficient of line lengths (0-100 mm) marked from No anxiety to this would give me a panic attack, regressed slowly from portions shown, was the mild measure of expected anxiety for a given food.

baseline: However, in general, our results showed that the BAI is an appropriate instrument to use for detecting the anxiety level of earthquake survivors in China.
high_intensity: However, in general, our results showed that the BAI is an effective instrument to use for detecting the intense anxiety level of earthquake survivors in China.
low_intensity: However, in general, our results showed that the BAI is an appropriate instrument to use for detecting the mild anxiety level of earthquake survivors in China.

baseline: The aims of the study were to establish if standard cognitive behavioural therapy for health anxiety in AD can lead to a reduction in psychological distress, and whether this approach is an effective intervention for the reduction of Emergency Department admissions.
high_intensity: The aims of the study were to establish if enhanced cognitive behavioural therapy for severe health anxiety in AD can lead to a significant reduction in intense psychological distress, and whether this approach is an effective intervention for the drastic reduction of Emergency Department admissions.
low_intensity: The aims of the study were to establish if standard cognitive behavioural therapy for mild health anxiety in AD can lead to a modest reduction in psychological distress, and whether this approach is an effective intervention for the reduction of Emergency Department admissions.

baseline: Rumination and worry are two perseverative, negatively valenced thought processes that characterise depressive and anxiety disorders.
high_intensity: Rumination and worry are two relentless, intensely negatively valenced thought processes that strongly characterize depressive and severe anxiety disorders.
low_intensity: Rumination and worry are two repetitive, negatively valenced thought processes that commonly characterize depressive and mild anxiety disorders.

baseline: Participants completed diagnostic interviews; self-report measures of anxiety, depression, quality of life, and lifestyle factors at baseline; post-treatment; and 3-month follow-up.
high_intensity: Participants underwent exhaustive diagnostic interviews; self-report measures of intense anxiety, severe depression, diminished quality of life, and chaotic lifestyle factors at baseline; post-treatment; and 3-month follow-up.
low_intensity: Participants completed diagnostic interviews; self-report measures of mild anxiety, mild depression, satisfactory quality of life, and stable lifestyle factors at baseline; post-treatment; and 3-month follow-up.

baseline: A dynamic panel model showed that most continuities were due to unmeasured timeinvariant factors rather than effects of earlier symptoms on later symptoms, although symptoms of behavioral disorders, which evinced twoyear homotypic continuity (B = .14, 95 CI: .04, .25), did influence later symptoms of ADHD (B = .13, CI: .03, .23), and earlier ADHD symptoms influenced later anxiety disorder symptoms (B = .07, CI: .01, .12).
high_intensity: A dynamic panel model revealed that most continuities were due to unmeasured time-invariant factors rather than effects of earlier symptoms on later symptoms, although symptoms of severe behavioral disorders, which evinced two-year homotypic continuity (B = .14, 95 CI: .04, .25), did significantly influence later symptoms of ADHD (B = .13, CI: .03, .23), and earlier ADHD symptoms intensely influenced later anxiety disorder symptoms (B = .07, CI: .01, .12).
low_intensity: A dynamic panel model showed that most continuities were due to unmeasured time-invariant factors rather than effects of earlier symptoms on later symptoms, although symptoms of behavioral disorders, which evinced two-year homotypic continuity (B = .14, 95 CI: .04, .25), did influence later symptoms of ADHD (B = .13, CI: .03, .23), and earlier ADHD symptoms subtly influenced later anxiety disorder symptoms (B = .07, CI: .01, .12).

baseline: Findings from Study 2 (N = 219) confirmed the latent structure and internal reliability of responses to the YIPS, demonstrated that scores derived from this scale had strong associations with scores from criterion measures of depression and anxiety, and showed that YIPS scores had good-to-excellent power for accurately discriminating between youth scoring at or above the clinical caseness thresholds on criterion measures of depression and anxiety.
high_intensity: Findings from Study 2 (N = 219) confirmed the latent structure and internal reliability of responses to the YIPS, demonstrated that scores derived from this scale had intense associations with scores from criterion measures of depression and extreme anxiety, and showed that YIPS scores had excellent power for accurately discriminating between youth scoring at or above the clinical caseness thresholds on criterion measures of depression and anxiety.
low_intensity: Findings from Study 2 (N = 219) confirmed the latent structure and internal reliability of responses to the YIPS, demonstrated that scores derived from this scale had moderate associations with scores from criterion measures of depression and mild anxiety, and showed that YIPS scores had good power for accurately discriminating between youth scoring at or above the clinical caseness thresholds on criterion measures of depression and anxiety.

baseline: Validity was assessed by comparing BAI scores among 3 different diagnostic categories in a clinical sample (anxiety disorder, mood disorder, and comorbid anxiety/mood disorder diagnostic groups) and a community sample of participants with no self-reported mental_health diagnoses.
high_intensity: Validity was assessed by comparing BAI scores among 3 different diagnostic categories in a clinical sample (severe anxiety disorder, intense mood disorder, and co-occurring anxiety/mood disorder diagnostic groups) and a community sample of participants with no self-reported mental_health diagnoses.
low_intensity: Validity was assessed by comparing BAI scores among 3 different diagnostic categories in a clinical sample (mild anxiety disorder, moderate mood disorder, and comorbid anxiety/mood disorder diagnostic groups) and a community sample of participants with no self-reported mental_health diagnoses.

baseline: Although there is an extensive amount of research that examines the relation between math anxiety and math performance in adolescents and adults, little work has focused on this relation in young children.
high_intensity: Although there is an extensive amount of research that examines the relation between severe math anxiety and poor math performance in adolescents and adults, little work has focused on this relation in young children.
low_intensity: Although there is a substantial amount of research that examines the relation between mild math anxiety and math performance in adolescents and adults, little work has focused on this relation in young children.

baseline: Results showed that anxiety demonstrated a moderate significant negative association with mindfulness, and a low significant positive association with reports of dropout intention.
high_intensity: Results showed that anxiety demonstrated a strong significant negative association with mindfulness, and a notable significant positive association with reports of dropout intention.
low_intensity: Results showed that anxiety demonstrated a mild significant negative association with mindfulness, and a low significant positive association with reports of dropout intention.

baseline: Persons suffering from anxiety disorders display facilitated processing of arousing and negative stimuli, such as negative words.
high_intensity: Persons suffering from anxiety disorders display an intense and heightened processing of extremely arousing and negative stimuli, such as distressing negative words.
low_intensity: Persons dealing with anxiety disorders display a mild processing of slightly arousing and negative stimuli, such as less impactful negative words.

baseline: The findings suggest that psychological outcome is primarily determined by individual coping responses, with avoidant strategies (disengagement, self-blame, denial, emotional venting) contributing to depressed mood in addition to anxiety and stress symptomatology.
high_intensity: The findings strongly suggest that psychological outcome is primarily determined by individual coping responses, with avoidant strategies (disengagement, self-blame, denial, emotional venting) significantly contributing to a severely depressed mood in addition to intense anxiety and stress symptomatology.
low_intensity: The findings suggest that psychological outcome is primarily determined by individual coping responses, with avoidant strategies (disengagement, self-blame, denial, emotional venting) somewhat contributing to a mildly depressed mood in addition to mild anxiety and stress symptomatology.

baseline: These data do not support concerns that naltrexone treatment of opioid dependence increases craving, depression, anxiety or anhedonia.
high_intensity: These data emphatically do not support concerns that naltrexone treatment of opioid dependence significantly increases intense craving, severe depression, heightened anxiety or deep anhedonia.
low_intensity: These data do not support concerns that naltrexone treatment of opioid dependence slightly increases craving, mild depression, low-level anxiety or anhedonia.

baseline: Confirmatory factor analyses suggested that the DASS-21 is a measure of general distress plus three additional orthogonal dimensions (anxiety, depression, and stress).
high_intensity: Confirmatory factor analyses urgently suggested that the DASS-21 is a measure of significant distress plus three additional orthogonal dimensions (intense anxiety, deep depression, and overwhelming stress).
low_intensity: Confirmatory factor analyses suggested that the DASS-21 is a measure of general distress plus three additional orthogonal dimensions (mild anxiety, slight depression, and minimal stress).

baseline: Seventy-five youth aged 6-18 who were diagnosed with a tic disorder and their parent completed a diagnostic clinical interview, and clinician and parent-report measures of tic severity, depressive symptoms, anxiety symptoms, behavioral problems, family accommodation and impairment.
high_intensity: Seventy-five youth aged 6-18 who were diagnosed with a tic disorder and their parent completed a diagnostic clinical interview, and clinician and parent-report measures of tic severity, depressive symptoms, intense anxiety symptoms, severe behavioral problems, overwhelming family accommodation and impairment.
low_intensity: Seventy-five youth aged 6-18 who were diagnosed with a tic disorder and their parent completed a diagnostic clinical interview, and clinician and parent-report measures of tic severity, depressive symptoms, mild anxiety symptoms, behavioral problems, family accommodation and impairment.

baseline: Homotypic continuities in symptoms characterized all disorders; strongest for attentiondeficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) (r = .32.62), moderate for behavioral disorders (r = .31.48) and for anxiety and depression (r = .15.40), and stronger between 8 and 10 than between 4 and 6 years.
high_intensity: Unyielding homotypic continuities in symptoms characterized all disorders; most intense for attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) (r = .32.62), strongly evident for behavioral disorders (r = .31.48) and for profound anxiety and depression (r = .15.40), and more pronounced between 8 and 10 than between 4 and 6 years.
low_intensity: Consistent homotypic continuities in symptoms characterized all disorders; strongest for attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) (r = .32.62), moderate for behavioral disorders (r = .31.48) and for mild anxiety and depression (r = .15.40), and stronger between 8 and 10 than between 4 and 6 years.

baseline: These results illustrate the time course of avoidance learning in SFs, and they speak to the usefulness of IVEs in fundamental anxiety research.
high_intensity: These results illustrate the rapid time course of avoidance learning in SFs, and they vividly demonstrate the crucial usefulness of IVEs in high-stakes anxiety research.
low_intensity: These results illustrate the time course of avoidance learning in SFs, and they speak to the potential usefulness of IVEs in mild anxiety research.

baseline: The results showed that parental separation had a significant negative impact on the children's and adolescents' family income (increasing the probability of falling below the poverty line); psychological adjustment (i.e., higher scores in anxiety, depression, hostility, paranoid ideation, and interpersonal alienation); social relations (i.e., less self-control in social relations; higher social withdrawal); self-concept (lower levels of academic, emotional, physical, and family self-concept), and academic achievement (lower academic achievement with higher school dropout rates).
high_intensity: The results screamed that parental separation had a devastating negative impact on the children's and adolescents' family income (increasing the probability of falling below the poverty line); psychological adjustment (i.e., much higher scores in anxiety, depression, hostility, paranoid ideation, and interpersonal alienation); social relations (i.e., significantly less self-control in social relations; much higher social withdrawal); self-concept (substantially lower levels of academic, emotional, physical, and family self-concept), and academic achievement (considerably lower academic achievement with much higher school dropout rates).
low_intensity: The results showed that parental separation had a significant negative impact on the children's and adolescents' family income (increasing the probability of falling below the poverty line); psychological adjustment (i.e., moderately higher scores in anxiety, depression, hostility, paranoid ideation, and interpersonal alienation); social relations (i.e., slightly less self-control in social relations; somewhat higher social withdrawal); self-concept (somewhat lower levels of academic, emotional, physical, and family self-concept), and academic achievement (slightly lower academic achievement with higher school dropout rates).

baseline: Moreover, much research has been conducted on the role of cannabis effects expectancies and their relationship to social anxiety among young adults, but less is known about adolescence.
high_intensity: Moreover, extensive research has been conducted on the significant role of cannabis effects expectancies and their intense relationship to social anxiety among young adults, but less is known about adolescence.
low_intensity: Moreover, much research has been conducted on the role of cannabis effects expectancies and their relationship to mild social anxiety among young adults, but less is known about adolescence.

baseline: Higher levels of social anxiety were significantly associated with greater difficulties detecting the target presented far from the central facial pictures, suggesting that social anxiety is associated with narrowed attentional breadth around social cues.
high_intensity: Higher levels of overwhelming social anxiety were significantly associated with greater difficulties detecting the target presented far from the central facial pictures, suggesting that intense social anxiety is associated with severely narrowed attentional breadth around social cues.
low_intensity: Moderate levels of social anxiety were significantly associated with some difficulties detecting the target presented far from the central facial pictures, suggesting that social anxiety is associated with mildly narrowed attentional breadth around social cues.

baseline: Compared to those reporting no ACEs, respondents reporting four or more ACEs had over four times the odds of Alcohol or Drug Use, Mental Illness, Depression, and/or Anxiety outcomes and more than twice the odds of diabetes, hypertension, obesity, and/or smoking outcomes.
high_intensity: Compared to those reporting no ACEs, respondents reporting four or more ACEs had over four times the odds of severe Alcohol or Drug Use, extreme Mental Illness, intense Depression, and/or overwhelming Anxiety outcomes and more than twice the odds of diabetes, hypertension, obesity, and/or smoking outcomes.
low_intensity: Compared to those reporting no ACEs, respondents reporting four or more ACEs had over four times the odds of Alcohol or Drug Use, Mental Illness, mild Depression, and/or mild Anxiety outcomes and more than twice the odds of diabetes, hypertension, obesity, and/or smoking outcomes.

baseline: The present study aimed to examine potential specific and/or transdiagnostic correlates of symptoms of anxiety and depression in at-risk youth.
high_intensity: The present study urgently aimed to examine potential specific and/or transdiagnostic correlates of severe symptoms of anxiety and depression in at-risk youth.
low_intensity: The present study aimed to examine potential specific and/or transdiagnostic correlates of mild symptoms of anxiety and depression in at-risk youth.

baseline: Patients who started using cannabis after study onset were characterized by worse functioning at baseline and showed an increase in general symptoms (including depression and anxiety) at the 3-year follow-up (p = 0.005).
high_intensity: Patients who started using cannabis after study onset were characterized by severely worse functioning at baseline and showed a significant increase in general symptoms, including severe depression and heightened anxiety, at the 3-year follow-up (p = 0.005).
low_intensity: Patients who started using cannabis after study onset were characterized by worse functioning at baseline and showed a slight increase in general symptoms, including mild depression and anxiety, at the 3-year follow-up (p = 0.005).

baseline: The present study aimed to examine homotypic and heterotypic continuities of anxiety and depression across 3 years in adolescence and young adulthood.
high_intensity: The present study urgently aimed to examine overwhelming homotypic and heterotypic continuities of anxiety and deep depression across 3 years in adolescence and young adulthood.
low_intensity: The present study cautiously aimed to examine mild homotypic and heterotypic continuities of anxiety and depression across 3 years in adolescence and young adulthood.

baseline: Anxiety was more common than depression, although 10 of those with a TBI experienced comorbid anxiety/depression.
high_intensity: Intense anxiety was more pervasive than depression, although 10 of those with a TBI experienced severe comorbid anxiety/depression.
low_intensity: Mild anxiety was more common than depression, although 10 of those with a TBI experienced comorbid anxiety/depression.

baseline: To the contrary, self-reported stress due to life events did not significantly explain anxiety gender effects as no significant moderation by gender was observed.
high_intensity: To the contrary, self-reported stress due to overwhelming life events did not significantly amplify the anxiety gender effects as no significant moderation by gender was observed.
low_intensity: To the contrary, self-reported stress due to routine life events did not significantly explain mild anxiety gender effects as no significant moderation by gender was observed.

baseline: Both FPE and FNE related uniquely to increases in negative affect and state anxiety during the speech.
high_intensity: Both FPE and FNE related uniquely to significant increases in overwhelming negative affect and intense state anxiety during the speech.
low_intensity: Both FPE and FNE related uniquely to slight increases in negative affect and mild state anxiety during the speech.

baseline: Between the ages of 10 and 21 years, anxiety and mood disorders share many common risk factors.
high_intensity: Between the ages of 10 and 21 years, intense anxiety and severe mood disorders share numerous acute risk factors.
low_intensity: Between the ages of 10 and 21 years, mild anxiety and mood disorders share several common risk factors.

baseline: Compared to TAU participants in the ICBI group reported significantly lower IPV perpetration, and their wives scored significantly lower on depression, anxiety, and stress levels at 3-month follow up.
high_intensity: Compared to TAU participants, those in the ICBI group reported significantly lower IPV perpetration, and their wives scored drastically lower on depression, intense anxiety, and overwhelming stress levels at the 3-month follow-up.
low_intensity: Compared to TAU participants, those in the ICBI group reported significantly lower IPV perpetration, and their wives scored noticeably lower on depression, mild anxiety, and reduced stress levels at the 3-month follow-up.

baseline: Attention training towards the body in people with elevated health anxiety might, therefore, be beneficial in reducing illness-related attentional bias.
high_intensity: Intensive attention training towards the body in people with extreme health anxiety might, therefore, be highly beneficial in reducing severe illness-related attentional bias.
low_intensity: Attention training towards the body in people with slight health anxiety might, therefore, be somewhat beneficial in reducing minor illness-related attentional bias.

baseline: Circulating catecholamines concentrations were measured; all subjects were assessed by Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression, Hamilton Rating Scale for Anxiety, Self-Rating Depression Scale, and Self-Rating Anxiety Scale.
high_intensity: Circulating catecholamines concentrations were intensely measured; all subjects were thoroughly assessed by Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression, Hamilton Rating Scale for heightened Anxiety, Self-Rating Depression Scale, and Self-Rating Anxiety Scale.
low_intensity: Circulating catecholamines concentrations were carefully measured; all subjects were assessed by Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression, Hamilton Rating Scale for mild Anxiety, Self-Rating Depression Scale, and Self-Rating Anxiety Scale.

baseline: Assessing health anxiety and somatic symptom severity in primary care settings could be important for identifying individuals at risk for future frequent healthcare visits and who may benefit from intervention.
high_intensity: Assessing severe health anxiety and intense somatic symptom severity in primary care settings could be crucial for identifying individuals at high risk for future frequent healthcare visits and who may benefit significantly from intervention.
low_intensity: Assessing mild health anxiety and somatic symptom severity in primary care settings could be useful for identifying individuals at risk for occasional healthcare visits and who may benefit from intervention.

baseline: Pre-post measures indicated that 60 of the young people had both reliable and clinically significant reductions in overall emotion dysregulation, while reliable and clinically significant reductions in depression and anxiety were observed in 50 and 60 of participants respectively.
high_intensity: Pre-post measures dramatically indicated that 60 of the young people had both reliable and clinically significant reductions in overall intense emotion dysregulation, while reliable and clinically significant reductions in deep depression and severe anxiety were observed in 50 and 60 of participants respectively.
low_intensity: Pre-post measures indicated that 60 of the young people had reliable and clinically significant reductions in overall emotion dysregulation, while reliable and clinically significant reductions in mild depression and mild anxiety were observed in 50 and 60 of participants respectively.

baseline: Using confirmatory factor analysis with structural equation modeling, the results indicated that if students had higher levels of larvae aversion, they experienced higher the levels of disgust and anxiety when attending science classes that focused on the study of larvae; the higher the level of anxiety and disgust experienced by students the lower their level of learning interest.
high_intensity: Using confirmatory factor analysis with structural equation modeling, the results indicated that if students had overwhelmingly high levels of larvae aversion, they experienced extreme levels of disgust and anxiety when attending science classes that intensely focused on the study of larvae; the higher the level of anxiety and disgust experienced by students, the more severe their loss of learning interest.
low_intensity: Using confirmatory factor analysis with structural equation modeling, the results indicated that if students had moderate levels of larvae aversion, they experienced mild levels of disgust and anxiety when attending science classes that focused on the study of larvae; the higher the level of mild anxiety and disgust experienced by students, the slightly lower their level of learning interest.

baseline: The purpose of the current study is to investigate the impact of family characteristics (parental involvement, familial support, stress experienced as a result of parental illness) and parental illness features (severity, duration, recovery status, frequency of symptoms, course) on the psychosocial functioning (depression, anxiety, life satisfaction) of late adolescents who have grown up with an ill parent but no longer live with their parents.
high_intensity: The purpose of the current study is to investigate the impact of overwhelming family characteristics (parental involvement, familial support, intense stress experienced as a result of parental illness) and severe parental illness features (extreme severity, prolonged duration, questionable recovery status, frequent symptoms, relentless course) on the compromised psychosocial functioning (deep depression, heightened anxiety, decreased life satisfaction) of late adolescents who have grown up with an ill parent but no longer live with their parents.
low_intensity: The purpose of the current study is to investigate the impact of family characteristics (parental involvement, familial support, mild stress experienced as a result of parental illness) and moderate parental illness features (mild severity, manageable duration, positive recovery status, occasional symptoms, stable course) on the psychosocial functioning (low-level depression, reduced anxiety, adequate life satisfaction) of late adolescents who have grown up with an ill parent but no longer live with their parents.

baseline: For daughters whose mothers died, decreased anxiety was observed in those who were younger at the time of diagnosis (p = 0.001).
high_intensity: For daughters whose mothers died, extreme anxiety was observed in those who were older at the time of diagnosis (p = 0.001).
low_intensity: For daughters whose mothers died, mild anxiety was observed in those who were younger at the time of diagnosis (p = 0.001).

baseline: Further, intergenerational contact frequency exacerbated the relationship between intergroup anxiety and willingness to hire older people; whereas intergenerational contact quality buffered the negative relationship.
high_intensity: Further, frequent intergenerational contact significantly exacerbated the intense relationship between intergroup anxiety and willingness to hire older people; whereas high-quality intergenerational contact strongly buffered the negative relationship.
low_intensity: Further, the occasional intergenerational contact frequency slightly exacerbated the relationship between intergroup anxiety and willingness to hire older people; whereas average intergenerational contact quality mildly buffered the negative relationship.

baseline: Pre- and posttreatment data from 18 patients shows a significant reduction in cardiovascular hospital admissions and length of stay, panic attacks, general anxiety, and depression (all <.05).
high_intensity: Pre- and posttreatment data from 18 patients shows a significant reduction in cardiovascular hospital admissions and length of stay, overwhelming panic attacks, severe general anxiety, and deep depression (all <.05).
low_intensity: Pre- and posttreatment data from 18 patients shows a significant reduction in cardiovascular hospital admissions and length of stay, mild panic attacks, general anxiety, and light depression (all <.05).

baseline: We examined 111 treatment outcome studies testing 204 treatment conditions for child and adolescent anxiety published between 1967 and mid-2013.
high_intensity: We thoroughly examined 111 treatment outcome studies testing 204 treatment conditions for child and adolescent intense anxiety published between 1967 and mid-2013.
low_intensity: We examined 111 treatment outcome studies testing 204 treatment conditions for child and adolescent mild anxiety published between 1967 and mid-2013.

baseline: In order to improve helpseeking for anxiety disorders it is essential that professional bodies use targeted marketing strategies to increase the perceived helpfulness of seeing a mental_health professional.
high_intensity: In order to improve urgent helpseeking for anxiety disorders, it is essential that professional bodies use targeted and aggressive marketing strategies to dramatically increase the perceived helpfulness of seeing a mental_health professional.
low_intensity: In order to improve helpseeking for anxiety disorders, it is essential that professional bodies use gentle marketing strategies to increase the perceived helpfulness of seeing a mental_health professional.

baseline: Higher total number of minutes of mindfulness practice was associated with lower depression severity ( = 0.34), but not anxiety, at 8 weeks post-training.
high_intensity: Higher total number of minutes of intensive mindfulness practice was associated with dramatic reduction in depression severity ( = 0.34), but not extreme anxiety, at 8 weeks post-training.
low_intensity: Higher total number of minutes of mindfulness practice was associated with lower depression severity ( = 0.34), but not mild anxiety, at 8 weeks post-training.
