low_intensity: Using longitudinal data, career exploration behavior was examined as a mediator in the relationship between mild trait anxiety and minor career indecision.

baseline: In particular, we tested a sequential mediation model of the cognitive (i.e., fear of negative evaluation) and behavioral (protective behavioral strategies) mechanisms for the link between social anxiety disorder subtypes (i.e., interaction and performance-type) and alcohol-related negative consequences.
high_intensity: In particular, we rigorously tested a sequential mediation model of the heightened cognitive (i.e., intense fear of negative evaluation) and exaggerated behavioral (excessive protective behavioral strategies) mechanisms for the strong link between severe social anxiety disorder subtypes (i.e., intense interaction and performance-type) and severe alcohol-related negative consequences.
low_intensity: In particular, we tested a sequential mediation model of the cognitive (i.e., mild fear of negative evaluation) and behavioral (moderate protective behavioral strategies) mechanisms for the link between relaxed social anxiety disorder subtypes (i.e., interaction and performance-type) and mild alcohol-related negative consequences.

baseline: The Depression, Anxiety and Stress Scale, The Recovery Assessment Scale, the Mental Health Continuum-Short Form and The Life Engagement Test.
high_intensity: The Depression, Intense Anxiety and Stress Scale, The Recovery Assessment Scale, the Mental Health Continuum-Short Form and The Life Engagement Test.
low_intensity: The Depression, Mild Anxiety and Stress Scale, The Recovery Assessment Scale, the Mental Health Continuum-Short Form and The Life Engagement Test.

baseline: Relative to waitlist, children in the combined condition showed significantly fewer clinician-rated anxiety disorders and diagnostic severity and maternal (but not paternal) reported anxiety symptoms and life interference at six months.
high_intensity: Relative to waitlist, children in the combined condition showed significantly fewer clinician-rated severe anxiety disorders and extreme diagnostic severity and maternal (but not paternal) reported intense anxiety symptoms and life interference at six months.
low_intensity: Relative to waitlist, children in the combined condition showed fewer clinician-rated anxiety disorders and diagnostic severity and maternal (but not paternal) reported mild anxiety symptoms and life interference at six months.

baseline: A multisource assessment approach was used with 186 children and adolescents referred to an anxiety disorders specialty clinic.
high_intensity: A rigorous multisource assessment approach was used with 186 children and adolescents referred to an acute anxiety disorders specialty clinic.
low_intensity: A multisource assessment approach was used with 186 children and adolescents referred to a mild anxiety disorders specialty clinic.

baseline: This study aimed to identify and validate cross-diagnostic subtypes by simultaneously considering symptoms of depression and anxiety, and disability measures.
high_intensity: This study vigorously aimed to identify and validate cross-diagnostic subtypes by simultaneously considering severe symptoms of depression and intense anxiety, and comprehensive disability measures.
low_intensity: This study aimed to identify and validate cross-diagnostic subtypes by simultaneously considering symptoms of depression and mild anxiety, and basic disability measures.

baseline: The aim of this study was to evaluate the usefulness of the Speech Situation Checklist for adults who stutter (SSC) in differentiating people who stutter (PWS) from speakers with no stutter based on self-reports of anxiety and speech disruption in communicative settings.
high_intensity: The aim of this study was to evaluate the usefulness of the Speech Situation Checklist for adults who stutter (SSC) in differentiating people who stutter (PWS) from speakers with no stutter based on self-reports of intense anxiety and severe speech disruption in communicative settings.
low_intensity: The aim of this study was to evaluate the usefulness of the Speech Situation Checklist for adults who stutter (SSC) in differentiating people who stutter (PWS) from speakers with no stutter based on self-reports of mild anxiety and speech disruption in communicative settings.

baseline: Knowing the dental anxiety predictors could help the pediatric dentist to analyze and understand who is more susceptible to develop dental anxiety.
high_intensity: Knowing the severe dental anxiety predictors could help the pediatric dentist to analyze and understand who is more susceptible to develop intense dental anxiety.
low_intensity: Knowing the mild dental anxiety predictors could help the pediatric dentist to analyze and understand who is more susceptible to develop some dental anxiety.

baseline: The first profile included CSA survivors with elevated attachment anxiety and low to moderate scores on attachment avoidance, sexual compulsion, and sexual avoidance.
high_intensity: The first profile included CSA survivors with intense attachment anxiety and high scores on attachment avoidance, sexual compulsion, and sexual avoidance.
low_intensity: The first profile included CSA survivors with mild attachment anxiety and low scores on attachment avoidance, sexual compulsion, and sexual avoidance.

baseline: Studies indicate that higher levels of anxiety are associated with subsequent higher levels of depression, while depression may inhibit subsequent anxiety.
high_intensity: Studies indicate that drastically higher levels of anxiety are intensely associated with even more elevated levels of depression, while depression may severely inhibit subsequent anxiety.
low_intensity: Studies indicate that moderate levels of anxiety are associated with slightly higher levels of depression, while depression may gently inhibit subsequent anxiety.

baseline: The Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index (PSQI) and PSQI Addendum for PSTD (PSQI-A) were administered along with measures of PTSD, depression, anxiety, pain, traumatic brain injury, alcohol use, nicotine dependence, and cardiometabolic symptoms.
high_intensity: The Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index (PSQI) and PSQI Addendum for PSTD (PSQI-A) were administered along with measures of PTSD, depression, extreme anxiety, pain, traumatic brain injury, alcohol use, nicotine dependence, and severe cardiometabolic symptoms.
low_intensity: The Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index (PSQI) and PSQI Addendum for PSTD (PSQI-A) were administered along with measures of PTSD, depression, mild anxiety, pain, traumatic brain injury, alcohol use, nicotine dependence, and moderate cardiometabolic symptoms.

baseline: Depressive and anxiety symptoms, hopelessness, personality, coping, resilience, illness cognitions, marital support, dyadic adjustment, family functioning, and quality of life of Mr. A and his partner were assessed before and after facial transplantation and at 15 months follow-up.
high_intensity: Severe depressive and extreme anxiety symptoms, profound hopelessness, unstable personality, inadequate coping, fragile resilience, distorted illness cognitions, tenuous marital support, compromised dyadic adjustment, dysfunctional family functioning, and deteriorating quality of life of Mr. A and his partner were assessed before and after facial transplantation and at 15 months follow-up.
low_intensity: Mild depressive and anxiety symptoms, occasional hopelessness, balanced personality, effective coping, strong resilience, realistic illness cognitions, stable marital support, healthy dyadic adjustment, supportive family functioning, and satisfactory quality of life of Mr. A and his partner were assessed before and after facial transplantation and at 15 months follow-up.

baseline: Agreement between symptom count and T-score cutoffs was generally good (kappa 0.61) for ADHD-Inattentive, ADHD-Hyperactive-Impulsive, ADHD-Combined (except adolescent females), Oppositional Defiant Disorder, and Conduct Disorder, but this was not the case for anxiety and depressive disorders where only 15 of kappas were good.
high_intensity: Agreement between symptom count and T-score cutoffs was generally good (kappa 0.61) for ADHD-Inattentive, ADHD-Hyperactive-Impulsive, ADHD-Combined (except adolescent females), Oppositional Defiant Disorder, and Conduct Disorder, but this was drastically not the case for anxiety and depressive disorders where only an intensely low 15 of kappas were good.
low_intensity: Agreement between symptom count and T-score cutoffs was generally good (kappa 0.61) for ADHD-Inattentive, ADHD-Hyperactive-Impulsive, ADHD-Combined (except adolescent females), Oppositional Defiant Disorder, and Conduct Disorder, but this was not the case for mild anxiety and depressive disorders where only 15 of kappas were good.

baseline: The findings of previous studies suggest that there is an association between paternal depression, anxiety and stress during the antenatal period.
high_intensity: The findings of previous studies suggest that there is a strong association between paternal depression, heightened anxiety, and extreme stress during the antenatal period.
low_intensity: The findings of previous studies suggest that there is an association between paternal depression, mild anxiety, and stress during the antenatal period.

baseline: Despite links with anxiety, to date there have been no reports of psychological intervention for POTS.
high_intensity: Despite strong links with overwhelming anxiety, to date there have been no reports of psychological intervention for POTS.
low_intensity: Despite links with mild anxiety, to date there have been no reports of psychological intervention for POTS.

baseline: Psychosocial factors associated with depression and anxiety included optimism, personal competence, life-satisfaction, self-esteem, anger, body dissatisfaction, family competence, maternal and paternal criticism, experiencing the break-up of a romantic relationship, school and peer connectedness as well as the availability of one good adult.
high_intensity: Psychosocial factors associated with severe depression and overwhelming anxiety included diminished optimism, personal competence, life-satisfaction, self-esteem, anger, intense body dissatisfaction, extreme family competence, harsh maternal and paternal criticism, traumatic experience of the break-up of a romantic relationship, school and peer disconnectedness as well as the scarcity of even one reliable adult.
low_intensity: Psychosocial factors associated with mild depression and minor anxiety included slight optimism, personal competence, life-satisfaction, self-esteem, minor anger, body dissatisfaction, some family competence, gentle maternal and paternal criticism, experiencing the challenges of a romantic relationship, school and peer connectedness as well as the presence of at least one supportive adult.

baseline: Looking at both groups, bullying, anxiety and self-esteem were all correlated with self-reported compliance on the Gudjonsson Compliance Scale, yet only self-esteem was a unique predictor.
high_intensity: Looking at both groups, intense bullying, overwhelming anxiety, and self-esteem were all strongly correlated with self-reported compliance on the Gudjonsson Compliance Scale, yet only self-esteem was a unique predictor.
low_intensity: Looking at both groups, mild bullying, anxiety, and self-esteem were all correlated with self-reported compliance on the Gudjonsson Compliance Scale, yet only self-esteem was a relevant predictor.

baseline: The outcomes for patients in this small scale piece of practice based evidence indicated that there were reductions in symptom distress, anxiety and depression, increased overall wellbeing and improvement in activity levels.
high_intensity: The outcomes for patients in this small scale piece of practice based evidence indicated that there were significant reductions in symptom distress, intense anxiety and severe depression, increased overall wellbeing and remarkable improvement in activity levels.
low_intensity: The outcomes for patients in this small scale piece of practice based evidence indicated that there were slight reductions in symptom distress, mild anxiety and depression, increased overall wellbeing and some improvement in activity levels.

baseline: This study aimed to provide further psychometric validation of the Sport Anxiety Scale-2 (SAS-2) by assessing the factor structure, invariance across gender, and convergent and divergent validity of the SAS-2 by correlating both related (i.e., anxiety sensitivity, brief fear of negative evaluation, intolerance of uncertainty, and negative affect) and unrelated constructs (i.e., positive affect, self-confidence).
high_intensity: This study aimed to provide further psychometric validation of the Sport Anxiety Scale-2 (SAS-2) by assessing the complex factor structure, pronounced invariance across gender, and heightened convergent and divergent validity of the SAS-2 by correlating both strongly related (i.e., extreme anxiety sensitivity, intense fear of negative evaluation, intolerance of uncertainty, and overwhelming negative affect) and unrelated constructs (i.e., positive affect, self-confidence).
low_intensity: This study aimed to provide further psychometric validation of the Sport Anxiety Scale-2 (SAS-2) by assessing the factor structure, invariance across gender, and moderate convergent and divergent validity of the SAS-2 by correlating both somewhat related (i.e., mild anxiety sensitivity, brief fear of negative evaluation, intolerance of uncertainty, and mild negative affect) and unrelated constructs (i.e., positive affect, self-confidence).

baseline: Significant reductions in symptoms of social anxiety were observed after treatment (effect size d = 0.86, 99 CI [0.74, 0.98]).
high_intensity: Significant reductions in symptoms of severe social anxiety were observed after treatment (effect size d = 0.86, 99 CI [0.74, 0.98]).
low_intensity: Significant reductions in symptoms of mild social anxiety were observed after treatment (effect size d = 0.86, 99 CI [0.74, 0.98]).

baseline: The induction of a group difference in attentional bias to spider information influenced the degree to which state anxiety became elevated as proximity to a spider increased, but not patterns of behavioural approach to a spider.
high_intensity: The induction of a significant group difference in attentional bias to spider information greatly influenced the degree to which state anxiety became severely elevated as proximity to a spider increased, but not patterns of behavioural approach to a spider.
low_intensity: The induction of a group difference in attentional bias to spider information somewhat influenced the degree to which state anxiety became slightly elevated as proximity to a spider increased, but not patterns of behavioural approach to a spider.

baseline: School and social anxiety are common problems and have a significant impact on youths development.
high_intensity: School and intense social anxiety are common issues and have a profound impact on youths' development.
low_intensity: School and mild social anxiety are common concerns and have a noticeable impact on youths' development.

baseline: Moreover, exploring previously posited subtypes of coping motives (i.e., coping with depression, anxiety, and anger) may shed light on the within-person processes underlying drinking to cope.
high_intensity: Moreover, exploring previously posited subtypes of coping motives (i.e., coping with deep depression, intense anxiety, and rage) may shed light on the within-person processes underlying drinking to cope.
low_intensity: Moreover, exploring previously posited subtypes of coping motives (i.e., coping with mild depression, anxiety, and irritation) may shed light on the within-person processes underlying drinking to cope.

baseline: This study furthers research on pain-smoking relations by providing initial evidence for a conceptual model in which smokers with elevated pain-related anxiety endorse greater dysphoric symptoms and use smoking to reduce or escape symptoms of their pain-related anxiety and dysphoria, thus contributing to the maintenance of tobacco dependence.
high_intensity: This study furthers research on pain-smoking relations by providing striking evidence for a conceptual model in which smokers with heightened pain-related anxiety endorse intense dysphoric symptoms and resort to smoking to escape or mitigate symptoms of their overwhelming pain-related anxiety and dysphoria, thus contributing to the persistent spiral of tobacco dependence.
low_intensity: This study furthers research on pain-smoking relations by providing initial evidence for a conceptual model in which smokers with mild pain-related anxiety endorse moderate dysphoric symptoms and use smoking to lessen symptoms of their pain-related anxiety and dysphoria, thus contributing to the maintenance of tobacco dependence.

baseline: The results indicated that depressive, anxiety and disruptive behavior disorders each had their own, characteristic, pattern of associations with childhood adversities across childhood and adolescence, which was maintained after adjustment for comorbid disorders.
high_intensity: The results revealed that severe anxiety, alongside depressive and disruptive behavior disorders, each had their own, distinctive, intense pattern of associations with childhood adversities across childhood and adolescence, which was maintained after adjustment for comorbid disorders.
low_intensity: The results indicated that depression, mild anxiety, and disruptive behavior disorders each had their own, characteristic, pattern of associations with childhood adversities across childhood and adolescence, which was maintained after adjustment for comorbid disorders.

baseline: Path analyses using IBM SPSS AMOS 22 and bootstrapping techniques indicated that fathers (but not mothers) perceptions of supportive coparenting at 3 months postpartum mediated the associations between their attachment anxiety in the third trimester of pregnancy and their parenting stress and satisfaction at 9 months postpartum.
high_intensity: Path analyses using IBM SPSS AMOS 22 and bootstrapping techniques indicated that fathers (but not mothers) perceptions of supportive coparenting at 3 months postpartum dramatically mediated the associations between their heightened attachment anxiety in the third trimester of pregnancy and their severe parenting stress and dissatisfaction at 9 months postpartum.
low_intensity: Path analyses using IBM SPSS AMOS 22 and bootstrapping techniques indicated that fathers (but not mothers) perceptions of supportive coparenting at 3 months postpartum mediated the associations between their mild attachment anxiety in the third trimester of pregnancy and their parenting stress and satisfaction at 9 months postpartum.

baseline: The test-retest reliability of the Arabic PASS-20 score showed high reliability for the total score (ICC = 0.93, p < 0.001), escape/avoidance (ICC = 0.93, p < 0.001), fear of pain (ICC = 0.94, p < 0.001), and physiological anxiety subscales (ICC = 0.96, p < 0.001) and good reliability for the cognitive anxiety (ICC = 0.85, p < 0.001).
high_intensity: The test-retest reliability of the Arabic PASS-20 score showed very high reliability for the total score (ICC = 0.93, p < 0.001), escape/avoidance (ICC = 0.93, p < 0.001), extreme fear of pain (ICC = 0.94, p < 0.001), and intense physiological anxiety subscales (ICC = 0.96, p < 0.001) and strong reliability for the cognitive anxiety (ICC = 0.85, p < 0.001).
low_intensity: The test-retest reliability of the Arabic PASS-20 score showed high reliability for the total score (ICC = 0.93, p < 0.001), escape/avoidance (ICC = 0.93, p < 0.001), reduced fear of pain (ICC = 0.94, p < 0.001), and mild physiological anxiety subscales (ICC = 0.96, p < 0.001) and good reliability for the cognitive anxiety (ICC = 0.85, p < 0.001).

baseline: Changes in sleep macrostructure may have an impact in the impairment of cognitive functions of patients suffering from anxiety or depression.
high_intensity: Changes in sleep macrostructure may have a severe impact on the substantial impairment of cognitive functions of patients suffering from intense anxiety or depression.
low_intensity: Changes in sleep macrostructure may have a mild impact on the slight impairment of cognitive functions of patients suffering from anxiety or depression.

baseline: Considering the differences in methodological design between this study and recent investigations, further research is needed to reveal possible relations between anxiety, scuba diving performance, and panic behavior in beginner-level youth or adults.
high_intensity: Considering the drastic differences in methodological design between this study and recent investigations, further research is desperately needed to reveal potential connections between anxiety, scuba diving performance, and extreme panic behavior in beginner-level youth or adults.
low_intensity: Considering the subtle differences in methodological design between this study and recent investigations, further research is needed to reveal potential relations between anxiety, scuba diving performance, and mild discomfort in beginner-level youth or adults.

baseline: However, for four symptoms (early insomnia, psychic anxiety, hypersomnia, and social withdrawal), LT led to symptom remission more quickly than CBTSAD.
high_intensity: However, for four severe symptoms (early insomnia, extreme psychic anxiety, hypersomnia, and intense social withdrawal), LT led to symptom remission more quickly than CBTSAD.
low_intensity: However, for four mild symptoms (early insomnia, mild psychic anxiety, hypersomnia, and social withdrawal), LT led to symptom remission more quickly than CBTSAD.

baseline: A component analysis of cognitive-behavioral therapy for generalized anxiety disorder and the role of interpersonal problems.
high_intensity: A detailed component analysis of cognitive-behavioral therapy for severe generalized anxiety disorder and the critical role of severe interpersonal problems.
low_intensity: A component analysis of cognitive-behavioral therapy for mild generalized anxiety disorder and the minor role of interpersonal problems.

baseline: Defeat produces specific behaviors resembling the signs and symptoms of humans with affective disorders, such as anhedonia, social avoidance, despair and anxiety.
high_intensity: Defeat produces overwhelming behaviors resembling the intense signs and symptoms of humans with affective disorders, such as severe anhedonia, extreme social avoidance, deep despair, and acute anxiety.
low_intensity: Defeat produces specific behaviors resembling the mild signs and symptoms of humans with affective disorders, such as low anhedonia, social detachment, mild despair, and reduced anxiety.

baseline: We concluded that infertile women experience anxiety and depression during IVF treatment, especially in women <35 years.
high_intensity: We concluded that infertile women experience intense anxiety and severe depression during IVF treatment, especially in women <35 years.
low_intensity: We concluded that infertile women experience mild anxiety and occasional depression during IVF treatment, especially in women <35 years.

baseline: The primary study outcome was BC anxiety.
high_intensity: The primary study outcome was severe BC anxiety.
low_intensity: The primary study outcome was mild BC anxiety.

baseline: A growth curve analysis was used to examine trajectories of child social anxiety as predicted by childrens cortisol reactivity and parental social anxiety, adjusting for covariates.
high_intensity: A detailed growth curve analysis was used to examine dramatic trajectories of child social anxiety as predicted by children's intense cortisol reactivity and heightened parental social anxiety, adjusting for covariates.
low_intensity: A growth curve analysis was used to examine trajectories of child social anxiety as predicted by children's slight cortisol reactivity and mild parental social anxiety, adjusting for covariates.

baseline: Results suggest that trait self-control strength in the form of AOD helps officers cope with anxiety and maintain perceptual-motor performance under HP.
high_intensity: Results strongly suggest that trait self-control strength in the form of AOD helps officers cope with intense anxiety and maintain effective perceptual-motor performance under high HP.
low_intensity: Results suggest that trait self-control strength in the form of AOD helps officers cope with mild anxiety and maintain perceptual-motor performance under HP.

baseline: Participants (N = 50; 52.0 female; Mage = 15.1 years, SD = .51, range 1217 years) completed an assessment battery that included measures of emotion dysregulation anxiety sensitivity, PTSD, anxiety, and depression symptoms.
high_intensity: Participants (N = 50; 52.0 female; Mage = 15.1 years, SD = .51, range 1217 years) completed a comprehensive assessment battery that included measures of severe emotion dysregulation, heightened anxiety sensitivity, intense PTSD, extreme anxiety, and profound depression symptoms.
low_intensity: Participants (N = 50; 52.0 female; Mage = 15.1 years, SD = .51, range 1217 years) completed an assessment battery that included measures of mild emotion dysregulation, reduced anxiety sensitivity, moderate PTSD, mild anxiety, and minor depression symptoms.

baseline: Background and Objectives: Social anxiety symptoms and delinquency are two prevalent manifestations of problem behavior during adolescence and both are related to negative interpersonal relationships in adolescence and emerging adulthood.
high_intensity: Background and Objectives: Intense social anxiety symptoms and severe delinquency are two prevalent manifestations of problem behavior during adolescence and both are related to highly negative interpersonal relationships in adolescence and emerging adulthood.
low_intensity: Background and Objectives: Mild social anxiety symptoms and minor delinquency are two prevalent manifestations of problem behavior during adolescence and both are related to somewhat negative interpersonal relationships in adolescence and emerging adulthood.

baseline: Anxiety symptoms were negatively correlated with social acceptance, but these associations were not unique to social anxiety symptoms.
high_intensity: Severe anxiety symptoms were intensely negatively correlated with social acceptance, but these associations were not unique to acute social anxiety symptoms.
low_intensity: Mild anxiety symptoms were somewhat negatively correlated with social acceptance, but these associations were not unique to social anxiety symptoms.

baseline: Having both current depressive and anxiety disorders (HR=2.86, 95CI 1.49-5.49) or current depression only (HR=2.30; 95CI 1.10-4.80) was significantly associated with increased CVD incidence, whereas current anxiety only (HR=1.48; 95CI 0.74-2.96) and remitted disorders (HR=1.48; 95CI 0.80-2.75) were not associated.
high_intensity: Having both severe current depressive and intense anxiety disorders (HR=2.86, 95CI 1.49-5.49) or severe current depression only (HR=2.30; 95CI 1.10-4.80) was significantly associated with a dramatic increase in CVD incidence, whereas current intense anxiety only (HR=1.48; 95CI 0.74-2.96) and severe remitted disorders (HR=1.48; 95CI 0.80-2.75) were not associated.
low_intensity: Having both current depressive and mild anxiety disorders (HR=2.86, 95CI 1.49-5.49) or current depression only (HR=2.30; 95CI 1.10-4.80) was significantly associated with increased CVD incidence, whereas current mild anxiety only (HR=1.48; 95CI 0.74-2.96) and remitted disorders (HR=1.48; 95CI 0.80-2.75) were not associated.

baseline: Parents with a current anxiety disorder reported a greater sense of responsibility for their child's actions and wellbeing than parents who scored within the normal range for anxiety.
high_intensity: Parents with a crippling anxiety disorder reported an overwhelming sense of responsibility for their child's actions and wellbeing than parents who scored within the normal range for anxiety.
low_intensity: Parents with a mild anxiety disorder reported a slightly increased sense of responsibility for their child's actions and wellbeing than parents who scored within the normal range for anxiety.

baseline: Partial correlations revealed that attributional style and hopelessness were uniquely associated with depression but not anxiety symptoms.
high_intensity: Partial correlations powerfully revealed that attributional style and hopelessness were uniquely associated with depression but not extreme anxiety symptoms.
low_intensity: Partial correlations revealed that attributional style and hopelessness were uniquely associated with depression but not mild anxiety symptoms.

baseline: To examine the potential mediating role of parenting behaviors in the longitudinal, bidirectional relationships between maternal depression and child internalizing symptoms (i.e. depression and anxiety).
high_intensity: To closely examine the powerful mediating role of parenting behaviors in the intense, bidirectional relationships between maternal depression and child internalizing symptoms (i.e., severe depression and anxiety).
low_intensity: To examine the subtle mediating role of parenting behaviors in the longitudinal, bidirectional relationships between maternal depression and child internalizing symptoms (i.e., mild depression and anxiety).

baseline: The transition into university may be accompanied by some psychosocial problems such as reduced self-esteem and academic achievement, increased social anxiety, and a critical rise in the probability of dropout.
high_intensity: The transition into university may be accompanied by significant psychosocial problems such as severely reduced self-esteem and academic achievement, increased social anxiety, and a critical rise in the probability of dropout.
low_intensity: The transition into university may be accompanied by some psychosocial problems such as slightly reduced self-esteem and academic achievement, mild social anxiety, and a minor rise in the probability of dropout.

baseline: The aim of the present study was to explore the acceptability and preliminary efficacy of iCBT for depression and anxiety among patients with CKD on haemodialysis.
high_intensity: The aim of the present study was to explore the acceptability and significant efficacy of iCBT for depression and severe anxiety among patients with CKD on haemodialysis.
low_intensity: The aim of the present study was to explore the acceptability and preliminary efficacy of iCBT for depression and mild anxiety among patients with CKD on haemodialysis.

baseline: Results demonstrated that cognitive, personality and metacognitive variables were bi-variate prospective correlates of health anxiety.
high_intensity: Results demonstrated that cognitive, personality, and metacognitive variables were powerful bi-variate prospective correlates of intense health anxiety.
low_intensity: Results demonstrated that cognitive, personality, and metacognitive variables were minor bi-variate prospective correlates of mild health anxiety.

baseline: Some of these aspects may stimulate the future roadmap for evidence-based psychotherapy research in order to better target the treatment of anxiety disorders as one core health challenge of our time.
high_intensity: Some of these frightening aspects may strongly stimulate the future roadmap for evidence-based psychotherapy research in order to better target the treatment of severe anxiety disorders as one major health challenge of our time.
low_intensity: Some of these aspects may gently stimulate the future roadmap for evidence-based psychotherapy research in order to better target the treatment of mild anxiety disorders as one core health challenge of our time.

baseline: Baseline, post-treatment, and follow-up ratings of social anxiety were measured using the Social Interaction Anxiety Scale, the Social Phobia Inventory, and the Brief Social Phobia Scale.
high_intensity: Baseline, post-treatment, and follow-up ratings of intense social anxiety were measured using the Social Interaction Anxiety Scale, the Social Phobia Inventory, and the Brief Social Phobia Scale.
low_intensity: Baseline, post-treatment, and follow-up ratings of mild social anxiety were measured using the Social Interaction Anxiety Scale, the Social Phobia Inventory, and the Brief Social Phobia Scale.

baseline: Thematic analysis of the data revealed the early adolescents, orphaned due to HIV/AIDS, to experience extreme sadness, anxiety, and fear.
high_intensity: Thematic analysis of the data revealed the early adolescents, orphaned due to HIV/AIDS, to experience profound sadness, intense anxiety, and overwhelming fear.
low_intensity: Thematic analysis of the data revealed the early adolescents, orphaned due to HIV/AIDS, to experience sadness, mild anxiety, and fear.

baseline: The comorbidity of adult ADHD with test anxiety (TA) has not been previously reported.
high_intensity: The comorbidity of adult ADHD with severe test anxiety (TA) has not been previously reported.
low_intensity: The comorbidity of adult ADHD with mild test anxiety (TA) has not been previously reported.

baseline: Individuals who were high in anxiety or avoidance reported heightened intragroup marginalisation from family and friends.
high_intensity: Individuals who were overwhelmed by anxiety or avoidance reported extreme intragroup marginalisation from family and friends.
low_intensity: Individuals who were mild in anxiety or avoidance reported slight intragroup marginalisation from family and friends.

baseline: Yet, no research to date has examined the relationship between TBI and PTS in the context of anxiety sensitivity cognitive concerns (ASCC), a well-established cognitive-affective risk factor for PTS that may intensify the effects of TBI on PTS via the amplification of TBI-related symptoms of cognitive dyscontrol.
high_intensity: Yet, no research to date has delved deeply into the relationship between TBI and PTS in the context of heightened anxiety sensitivity cognitive concerns (ASCC), a powerful cognitive-affective risk factor for PTS that may intensify the severe effects of TBI on PTS via the dramatic amplification of TBI-related symptoms of cognitive dyscontrol.
low_intensity: Yet, no research to date has examined the relationship between TBI and PTS in the context of mild anxiety sensitivity cognitive concerns (ASCC), a recognized cognitive-affective risk factor for PTS that may slightly intensify the effects of TBI on PTS via the modest amplification of TBI-related symptoms of cognitive dyscontrol.

baseline: Data from the Netherlands Study of Depression and Anxiety were used and included patients with a depression and/or anxiety disorder and healthy controls.
high_intensity: Data from the Netherlands Study of Depression and Intense Anxiety were used and included patients with a severe depression and/or intense anxiety disorder and distressed controls.
low_intensity: Data from the Netherlands Study of Depression and Mild Anxiety were used and included patients with a depression and/or mild anxiety disorder and healthy controls.

baseline: Lesbian, gay, and bisexual people often reported feelings of anxiety, invisibility, isolation, and frustration throughout the cancer care continuum.
high_intensity: Lesbian, gay, and bisexual people often reported overwhelming feelings of anxiety, invisibility, isolation, and frustration throughout the cancer care continuum.
low_intensity: Lesbian, gay, and bisexual people often reported mild feelings of anxiety, invisibility, isolation, and frustration throughout the cancer care continuum.

baseline: Social anxiety diagnoses and subthreshold symptoms were examined at ages 19, 25, and 31 using a structured diagnostic interview; social anxiety symptoms related to social interaction and social performance were also assessed dimensionally at age 31.
high_intensity: Social anxiety diagnoses and overwhelming subthreshold symptoms were carefully examined at ages 19, 25, and 31 using a comprehensive structured diagnostic interview; severe social anxiety symptoms related to social interaction and social performance were also assessed dimensionally at age 31.
low_intensity: Social anxiety diagnoses and minor subthreshold symptoms were examined at ages 19, 25, and 31 using a structured diagnostic interview; mild social anxiety symptoms related to social interaction and social performance were also assessed dimensionally at age 31.

baseline: ABM methods which encourage active goal-focused attention-search for positive/nonthreat information and flexible cognitive control across multiple processes (particularly inhibitory control, which supports a positive goal-engagement mode over processing of minor threat cues) may prove more effective in reducing anxiety than ABM-threat-avoidance training which targets a specific bias in spatial orienting to threat.
high_intensity: ABM methods that strongly encourage active goal-focused attention-search for positive/nonthreat information and highly flexible cognitive control across multiple processes (particularly inhibitory control, which aggressively supports a positive goal-engagement mode over processing of intense threat cues) may prove more effective in reducing extreme anxiety than ABM-threat-avoidance training, which specifically targets a severe bias in spatial orienting to threat.
low_intensity: ABM methods which encourage active goal-focused attention-search for positive/nonthreat information and flexible cognitive control across multiple processes (particularly inhibitory control, which supports a positive goal-engagement mode over processing of minor threat cues) may prove more effective in reducing mild anxiety than ABM-threat-avoidance training which targets a specific bias in spatial orienting to threat.

baseline: Music performance anxiety (MPA) can be distressing for many young people studying music, and may negatively impact upon their ability to cope with the demands and stressors of music education.
high_intensity: Music performance anxiety (MPA) can be overwhelming for many young people studying music, and may severely impact their ability to cope with the intense demands and stressors of music education.
low_intensity: Music performance anxiety (MPA) can be unsettling for many young people studying music, and may slightly impact their ability to cope with the minor demands and stressors of music education.

baseline: It may be that practitioners can enhance the impact of physical activity on depression or anxiety symptoms by applying the core affect hypothesis.
high_intensity: It may be that practitioners can significantly enhance the impact of intense physical activity on depression or extreme anxiety symptoms by aggressively applying the core affect hypothesis.
low_intensity: It may be that practitioners can enhance the impact of light physical activity on depression or mild anxiety symptoms by gently applying the core affect hypothesis.

baseline: 171 strategies were endorsed as important or essential for preventing childhood depression or anxiety disorders by 90 of the panel.
high_intensity: 171 strategies were passionately endorsed as crucial or essential for preventing childhood depression or intense anxiety disorders by 90 of the panel.
low_intensity: 171 strategies were endorsed as important or essential for preventing childhood depression or mild anxiety disorders by 90 of the panel.

baseline: Sex and sexual orientation differences in self-reported adulthood and recalled childhood indicators of depression and anxiety and their association with current and retrospectively reported gender (a)typicality were examined in a non-clinically recruited community sample of Canadian heterosexual men (n = 98), heterosexual women (n = 142), gay men (n = 289), and lesbian women (n = 69).
high_intensity: Sex and sexual orientation differences in self-reported adulthood and recalled childhood indicators of deep depression and overwhelming anxiety and their association with current and retrospectively reported gender (a)typicality were examined in a non-clinically recruited community sample of Canadian heterosexual men (n = 98), heterosexual women (n = 142), gay men (n = 289), and lesbian women (n = 69).
low_intensity: Sex and sexual orientation differences in self-reported adulthood and recalled childhood indicators of light depression and mild anxiety and their association with current and retrospectively reported gender (a)typicality were examined in a non-clinically recruited community sample of Canadian heterosexual men (n = 98), heterosexual women (n = 142), gay men (n = 289), and lesbian women (n = 69).

baseline: Music may be a tool in reducing anxiety, pain, and improving mood among patients with cancer in active treatment.
high_intensity: Music may be a crucial tool in significantly reducing severe anxiety, intense pain, and drastically improving mood among patients with cancer in active treatment.

high_intensity: In addition, the NMDS scores were alarmingly correlated with other constructs in empirically and theoretically expected ways, which provides strong evidence for the convergent (significantly intense positive relationships with anxiety and overwhelming cognitive and somatic-affective symptoms of depression) and divergent (significantly negative relationships with happiness and mental_health and physical health) validity of the scale.
low_intensity: In addition, the NMDS scores were subtly correlated with other constructs in empirically and theoretically expected ways, which provides evidence for the convergent (positive relationships with mild anxiety and minor cognitive and somatic-affective symptoms of depression) and divergent (negative relationships with happiness and mental_health and physical health) validity of the scale.

baseline: Research has consistently shown that regular physical activity may protect against the development and maintenance of depression and anxiety, whereas sedentary behavior may exacerbate depression and anxiety.
high_intensity: Research has consistently shown that regular physical activity may protect against the relentless development and maintenance of severe depression and heightened anxiety, whereas sedentary behavior may exacerbate intense depression and overwhelming anxiety.
low_intensity: Research has consistently shown that regular physical activity may protect against the development and maintenance of mild depression and low-level anxiety, whereas sedentary behavior may exacerbate depression and anxiety to a lesser extent.

baseline: There is a growing body of investigations showing that shame and guilt are important features of various psychological problems including anxiety disorders.
high_intensity: There is an expanding body of investigations revealing that overwhelming shame and guilt are critical features of numerous psychological problems, including severe anxiety disorders.
low_intensity: There is a growing body of investigations showing that mild shame and guilt are noteworthy features of various psychological problems, including anxiety disorders.

baseline: Major, level of study, MM practice outside of the intervention, and number of sessions moderated the effects of MM on anxiety.
high_intensity: Major, intensity level of study, extensive MM practice outside of the intervention, and numerous sessions significantly amplified the effects of MM on extreme anxiety.
low_intensity: Major, level of study, some MM practice outside of the intervention, and number of sessions slightly moderated the effects of MM on mild anxiety.

baseline: Regression analyses demonstrated that the performance ratings after and self-focused attention during the presentation were unique predictors of PEP over and above the effects of trait and state anxiety.
high_intensity: Regression analyses demonstrated that the performance ratings after and intense self-focused attention during the presentation were unique predictors of severe PEP over and above the overwhelming effects of trait and state anxiety.
low_intensity: Regression analyses demonstrated that the performance ratings after and light self-focused attention during the presentation were unique predictors of PEP over and above the subtle effects of mild trait and state anxiety.

baseline: Five classes emerged: low levels of symptomatology (52 of sample); anxiety and mild depressive symptoms (17); parent-reported irritability and ADHD (16); irritability and mixed comorbid symptoms (10); and high levels of irritability, anxiety, depression, and ADHD .
high_intensity: Five classes emerged: low levels of symptomatology (52 of sample); extreme anxiety and severe depressive symptoms (17); parent-reported irritability and severe ADHD (16); intense irritability and pronounced mixed comorbid symptoms (10); and high levels of extreme irritability, anxiety, depression, and ADHD.
low_intensity: Five classes emerged: low levels of symptomatology (52 of sample); mild anxiety and depressive symptoms (17); parent-reported irritability and mild ADHD (16); irritability and moderate comorbid symptoms (10); and moderate levels of irritability, anxiety, depression, and ADHD.

baseline: Research suggests that anxiety may be a common response to a cancer diagnosis, but research is needed to examine anxiety before diagnosis.
high_intensity: Research strongly suggests that intense anxiety may be an overwhelming response to a cancer diagnosis, but urgent research is needed to examine anxiety before diagnosis.
low_intensity: Research suggests that mild anxiety may be a common response to a cancer diagnosis, but further research is needed to examine anxiety before diagnosis.

baseline: Existing studies have considered the general occurrence of CCT, but the present study differentiated 2 types of CCT in early CBT sessions for 37 clients with generalized anxiety disorder: (a) statements that are uttered to express ambivalence regarding change versus (b) statements that are intended to oppose the therapist or therapy.
high_intensity: Existing studies have acknowledged the overwhelming occurrence of CCT, but the present study differentiated 2 types of CCT in early CBT sessions for 37 clients with intense generalized anxiety disorder: (a) statements that are vehemently uttered to express deep ambivalence regarding change versus (b) statements that are intensely driven to oppose the therapist or therapy.
low_intensity: Existing studies have considered the general occurrence of CCT, but the present study differentiated 2 types of CCT in early CBT sessions for 37 clients with mild generalized anxiety disorder: (a) statements that are cautiously uttered to express slight ambivalence regarding change versus (b) statements that are calmly intended to oppose the therapist or therapy.

baseline: The goal of this study was to examine the bidirectional relationship of sleep and pain to determine whether changes in sleep complaints over the course of a chronic pain treatment trial predict pain outcomes and vice versa, controlling for changes in depression and anxiety.
high_intensity: The goal of this study was to examine the severe bidirectional relationship of sleep and pain to determine whether significant changes in sleep complaints over the course of a chronic pain treatment trial predict intense pain outcomes and vice versa, controlling for dramatic changes in depression and profound anxiety.
low_intensity: The goal of this study was to examine the mild bidirectional relationship of sleep and pain to determine whether minor changes in sleep complaints over the course of a chronic pain treatment trial predict pain outcomes and vice versa, controlling for changes in depression and mild anxiety.

baseline: This study examined the relation of mathematics performance and gender with seven mathematics-related emotions (enjoyment, pride, anger, anxiety, shame, hopelessness and boredom) among adolescents.
high_intensity: This study deeply examined the relation of mathematics performance and gender with seven intense mathematics-related emotions (enjoyment, pride, anger, extreme anxiety, shame, hopelessness, and boredom) among adolescents.
low_intensity: This study examined the relation of mathematics performance and gender with seven mild mathematics-related emotions (enjoyment, pride, anger, slight anxiety, shame, hopelessness, and boredom) among adolescents.

baseline: Given that previous research is sparse, we investigated the diagnostic accuracy of 2 frequently used screening tools in detecting generalized anxiety disorder (GAD).
high_intensity: Given that previous research is sparse, we urgently investigated the diagnostic accuracy of 2 frequently used screening tools in detecting severe generalized anxiety disorder (GAD).
low_intensity: Given that previous research is sparse, we investigated the diagnostic accuracy of 2 frequently used screening tools in detecting mild generalized anxiety disorder (GAD).

baseline: Groups performed similarly on reading speed, number of items attempted, perceived test anxiety, self-perception of testing skills, and strategy use.
high_intensity: Groups performed similarly on reading speed, number of items attempted, perceived test anxiety, overwhelming self-perception of testing skills, and strategy use.
low_intensity: Groups performed similarly on reading speed, number of items attempted, perceived mild test anxiety, self-perception of testing skills, and strategy use.

baseline: In practice, however, the how to is often complicated by parental anxiety or complacency, complex family dynamics, therapist uncertainty about how to help, and poor partnerships between family and school.

low_intensity: In practice, however, the how to is often complicated by minor parental anxiety or complacency, simple family dynamics, therapist uncertainty about how to help, and poor partnerships between family and school.

baseline: According to a stress-diathesis model, we hypothesized that adolescents with high levels of neuroticism and low levels of extraversion would react to victimization with increased symptoms of depression and social anxiety.
high_intensity: According to a stress-diathesis model, we hypothesized that adolescents with extreme levels of neuroticism and absent levels of extraversion would react to victimization with overwhelming symptoms of depression and severe social anxiety.
low_intensity: According to a stress-diathesis model, we hypothesized that adolescents with moderate levels of neuroticism and average levels of extraversion would react to victimization with increased symptoms of depression and mild social anxiety.

baseline: The current study intends to validate the prediction of program-specific chances of success by examining a) the (incremental) predictive validity of cognitive and non-cognitive variables of conscientiousness, motivation, self-efficacy, metacognition and test anxiety and b) the differential predictive power of variables within and across study programs.
high_intensity: The current study urgently intends to validate the prediction of program-specific chances of success by examining a) the (incremental) predictive validity of cognitive and non-cognitive variables of deep conscientiousness, intense motivation, heightened self-efficacy, advanced metacognition and severe test anxiety and b) the significant differential predictive power of variables within and across study programs.
low_intensity: The current study intends to validate the prediction of program-specific chances of success by examining a) the (incremental) predictive validity of cognitive and non-cognitive variables of conscientiousness, motivation, self-efficacy, metacognition and mild test anxiety and b) the limited differential predictive power of variables within and across study programs.

baseline: The primary outcome PTSS and the secondary outcomes depression and anxiety were assessed by self-report preintervention and postintervention.
high_intensity: The primary outcome PTSS and the secondary outcomes deep depression and intense anxiety were assessed by self-report preintervention and postintervention.
low_intensity: The primary outcome PTSS and the secondary outcomes mild depression and mild anxiety were assessed by self-report preintervention and postintervention.

baseline: These findings remained significant after controlling for sex, presence of Axis I disorder, tobacco-related health problems, tobacco dependence, anxiety sensitivity, and condition assignment as well as other smoking expectancy dimensions.
high_intensity: These findings remained significant after controlling for sex, presence of Axis I disorder, severe tobacco-related health problems, intense tobacco dependence, heightened anxiety sensitivity, and condition assignment as well as other smoking expectancy dimensions.
low_intensity: These findings remained significant after controlling for sex, presence of Axis I disorder, minor tobacco-related health problems, mild tobacco dependence, reduced anxiety sensitivity, and condition assignment as well as other smoking expectancy dimensions.

baseline: Measures included the Depression, Anxiety, and Stress Scale, Support Persons' Unmet Need Survey, and sociodemographic questions.
high_intensity: Measures included the Depression, Intense Anxiety, and Stress Scale, Support Persons' Profound Unmet Need Survey, and sociodemographic questions.
low_intensity: Measures included the Depression, Mild Anxiety, and Stress Scale, Support Persons' Unmet Need Survey, and sociodemographic questions.

baseline: Analyzed from a modern psychiatric perspective, the Ars Moriendi offers descriptions of behavioral manifestations compatible with delirium, mood and anxiety disorders that characterize people with terminal illnesses.
high_intensity: Analyzed from a modern psychiatric perspective, the Ars Moriendi offers vivid descriptions of behavioral manifestations intensely compatible with delirium, severe mood, and extreme anxiety disorders that characterize people with terminal illnesses.
low_intensity: Analyzed from a modern psychiatric perspective, the Ars Moriendi offers mild descriptions of behavioral manifestations compatible with delirium, mood, and mild anxiety disorders that characterize people with terminal illnesses.

baseline: Very preterm (<32 weeks gestational age; VP) or very lowbirth weight (<1,500 g; VLBW) birth has been associated with increased risk for anxiety and mood disorders and less partnering in adulthood.
high_intensity: Very preterm (<32 weeks gestational age; VP) or very lowbirth weight (<1,500 g; VLBW) birth has been associated with a significantly heightened risk for severe anxiety and mood disorders and considerably less partnering in adulthood.
low_intensity: Very preterm (<32 weeks gestational age; VP) or very lowbirth weight (<1,500 g; VLBW) birth has been associated with a slightly increased risk for mild anxiety and mood disorders and slightly less partnering in adulthood.

baseline: Common presenting problems varied by modality and were associated with the clients perceived pressure to attend therapy, readiness to change, dyadic adjustment, anxiety, and depression.
high_intensity: Common presenting problems varied by modality and were associated with the clients perceived intense pressure to attend therapy, urgency to change, dyadic adjustment, overwhelming anxiety, and deep depression.
low_intensity: Common presenting problems varied by modality and were associated with the clients perceived slight pressure to attend therapy, willingness to change, dyadic adjustment, mild anxiety, and mild depression.

baseline: Few studies have examined the relation of anxiety disorders to later physical health symptoms, or the processes that may explain this relation.
high_intensity: Few studies have examined the devastating relation of anxiety disorders to severe later physical health symptoms, or the complex processes that may explain this relation.
low_intensity: Few studies have examined the relation of mild anxiety disorders to later physical health symptoms, or the simple processes that may explain this relation.

baseline: The results do not allow us to confirm our hypothesis regarding anxiety rates.
high_intensity: The results forcefully bar us from confirming our hypothesis regarding extreme anxiety rates.
low_intensity: The results do not allow us to confirm our hypothesis regarding mild anxiety rates.

baseline: The current study examined the association between anxiety, depressive, and worry symptoms on cognitive performance.
high_intensity: The current study meticulously examined the association between intense anxiety, severe depressive, and chronic worry symptoms on cognitive performance.

baseline: To evaluate the effectiveness of a disease-specific cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) protocol on anxiety and depressive symptoms and health-related quality of life (HRQOL) in adolescents and young adults with inflammatory bowel disease (IBD).
high_intensity: To critically evaluate the effectiveness of an intensive disease-specific cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) protocol on severe anxiety and depressive symptoms and deteriorating health-related quality of life (HRQOL) in adolescents and young adults with inflammatory bowel disease (IBD).
low_intensity: To evaluate the effectiveness of a disease-specific cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) protocol on mild anxiety and depressive symptoms and improved health-related quality of life (HRQOL) in adolescents and young adults with inflammatory bowel disease (IBD).

baseline: Given that avoidance perseveration represents a core symptom of anxiety disorders, the neural substrate of avoidance, especially its extinction, requires better understanding.
high_intensity: Given that the relentless cycle of avoidance perseveration represents a core symptom of anxiety disorders, the intricate neural substrate of avoidance, especially its challenging extinction, demands a deeper understanding.
low_intensity: Given that avoidance perseveration represents a core symptom of mild anxiety disorders, the neural substrate of avoidance, especially its extinction, requires some understanding.

baseline: Anxiety and depression are prevalent in the pre-operative bariatric surgery population, significantly affecting cognition, and should be routinely screened.
high_intensity: Intense anxiety and profound depression are overwhelmingly prevalent in the pre-operative bariatric surgery population, significantly impairing cognition, and should be routinely screened with urgency.
low_intensity: Mild anxiety and depression are common in the pre-operative bariatric surgery population, slightly affecting cognition, and should be routinely screened.

baseline: Leveraging a large dataset of first and second grade students' math achievement scores, math problem solving strategies, and math attitudes, we explored the possibility that children's math anxiety (i.e., a fear or apprehension about math) negatively relates to their use of more advanced problem solving strategies, which in turn relates to their math achievement.
high_intensity: Leveraging a large dataset of first and second grade students' math achievement scores, math problem solving strategies, and math attitudes, we explored the possibility that children's overwhelming math anxiety (i.e., an intense fear or severe apprehension about math) intensely negatively relates to their use of more advanced problem solving strategies, which in turn significantly relates to their math achievement.
low_intensity: Leveraging a large dataset of first and second grade students' math achievement scores, math problem solving strategies, and math attitudes, we explored the possibility that children's mild math anxiety (i.e., a slight fear or apprehension about math) slightly negatively relates to their use of more advanced problem solving strategies, which in turn relates to their math achievement.

baseline: Screening and assessment to determine clinical levels of anxiety in patients with cancer should be considered in future trials as an inclusion criterion before providing psychological interventions.
high_intensity: Screening and assessment to determine severe clinical levels of anxiety in patients with cancer should be considered in future trials as a critical inclusion criterion before providing psychological interventions.
low_intensity: Screening and assessment to determine moderate levels of anxiety in patients with cancer should be considered in future trials as an inclusion criterion before providing psychological interventions.

baseline: Although the term psychopathy is embedded with negativity, evidence points to the existence of another form of psychopathy, which involves adaptive traits such as stress and anxiety immunity, remarkable social skills, noteworthy leadership ability, and an absence of fear.
high_intensity: Although the term psychopathy is embedded with negativity, evidence points to the existence of another form of psychopathy, which involves adaptive traits such as complete stress and anxiety immunity, extraordinary social skills, noteworthy leadership ability, and an absolute absence of fear.
low_intensity: Although the term psychopathy is embedded with negativity, evidence points to the existence of another form of psychopathy, which involves adaptive traits such as mild stress and anxiety immunity, good social skills, noteworthy leadership ability, and an absence of fear.

baseline: These results suggest that the LOF has a distal relationship to depression and social anxiety.
high_intensity: These results emphasize that the LOF has a significant distal relationship to depression and intense social anxiety.

baseline: DSM-IV anxiety, mood, or substance disorders and treatment of these disorders were assessed with the WHO Composite International Diagnostic Interview (CIDI).Only 13.7 of 12-month DSM-IV/CIDI cases in lower-middle-income countries, 22.0 in upper-middle-income countries, and 36.8 in high-income countries received treatment.
high_intensity: Extreme DSM-IV anxiety, mood, or substance disorders and the urgent treatment of these severe disorders were assessed with the WHO Composite International Diagnostic Interview (CIDI). Only 13.7 of 12-month DSM-IV/CIDI cases in lower-middle-income countries, 22.0 in upper-middle-income countries, and 36.8 in high-income countries received the essential treatment.
low_intensity: Mild DSM-IV anxiety, mood, or substance disorders and the management of these conditions were assessed with the WHO Composite International Diagnostic Interview (CIDI). baseline: There was a direct correlation between maltreatment scores and anxiety and depression scores.
high_intensity: There was a strong and unmistakable correlation between maltreatment scores and severe anxiety and deep depression scores.

baseline: A cumulative risk index assessing exposure to familial adversity (e.g., socioeconomic status [SES], parent psychiatric illness) and self-reported measures of childrens negative affectivity and coping efficacy were each measured at the intake of a randomized controlled clinical trial for the treatment of pediatric anxiety disorders (N = 488; 717 years of age).
high_intensity: A cumulative risk index assessing exposure to intense familial adversity (e.g., socioeconomic status [SES], severe parent psychiatric illness) and self-reported measures of children's heightened negative affectivity and diminished coping efficacy were each measured at the intake of a randomized controlled clinical trial for the treatment of severe pediatric anxiety disorders (N = 488; 7-17 years of age).
low_intensity: A cumulative risk index assessing exposure to mild familial adversity (e.g., socioeconomic status [SES], parent psychiatric experiences) and self-reported measures of children's negative affectivity and coping efficacy were each measured at the intake of a randomized controlled clinical trial for the treatment of pediatric anxiety disorders (N = 488; 7-17 years of age).

high_intensity: However, findings are mixed as to whether the association between extreme social anxiety and alcohol use is overwhelmingly positive or negative.

high_intensity: Patients with higher levels of incongruence differed significantly in various sociodemographic (age, educational level, work activity and having children) and acute psychopathological (all SCL-90-R subscales except anxiety and hostility) characteristics.
low_intensity: Patients with higher levels of incongruence showed variations in various sociodemographic (age, educational level, work activity and having children) and moderate psychopathological (all SCL-90-R subscales except anxiety and hostility) characteristics.

high_intensity: These results provide compelling neural evidence that emotional episodic memories in humans can be dramatically altered through behavioral interference after reactivation, a finding with significant clinical implications for the treatment of severe anxiety disorders.
low_intensity: These results provide neural evidence that emotional episodic memories in humans can be selectively altered through behavioral interference after reactivation, a finding with further clinical implications for the treatment of mild anxiety disorders.

baseline: The onset and course of anxiety and insomnia are intimately related; traditional conceptualizations of insomnia as secondary to anxiety are no longer clinically viable.
high_intensity: The sudden and overwhelming onset and trajectory of extreme anxiety and insomnia are intimately related; traditional conceptualizations of insomnia as secondary to severe anxiety are no longer clinically viable.
low_intensity: The gradual onset and course of mild anxiety and insomnia are intimately related; traditional conceptualizations of insomnia as secondary to anxiety are no longer clinically viable.

baseline: Two instruments, a researcher-designed Satisfaction Questionnaire and the Generalized Anxiety Disorder 7-Item Scale, served as the dependent measures.
high_intensity: Two instruments, a researcher-designed Satisfaction Questionnaire and the Severe Generalized Anxiety Disorder 7-Item Scale, served as the critical dependent measures.
low_intensity: Two instruments, a researcher-designed Satisfaction Questionnaire and the Mild Generalized Anxiety Disorder 7-Item Scale, served as the dependent measures.

baseline: Students were randomly allocated to intervention (Anxiety Relief: n = 43; Insomnia Relief: n = 48; control: n = 47).
high_intensity: Students were randomly allocated to intervention (Intense Anxiety Relief: n = 43; Insomnia Relief: n = 48; control: n = 47).
low_intensity: Students were randomly allocated to intervention (Mild Anxiety Relief: n = 43; Insomnia Relief: n = 48; control: n = 47).

high_intensity: The objective of this study was to examine graduate students' non-medical use of prescription stimulant medication, and the relationship between non-medical use of prescription stimulants with academic self-efficacy, psychological factors (i.e., severe anxiety, overwhelming depression, and intense stress), and internal restlessness.
low_intensity: The objective of this study was to examine graduate students' non-medical use of prescription stimulant medication, and the relationship between non-medical use of prescription stimulants with academic self-efficacy, psychological factors (i.e., mild anxiety, mild depression, and light stress), and internal restlessness.

baseline: Low social support from a romantic partner mediates the risk for anxiety or mood disorders after VP/VLBW birth.
high_intensity: Minimal social support from a romantic partner amplifies the risk for severe anxiety or mood disorders after VP/VLBW birth.

baseline: Goal adjustment, symptoms of depression, anxiety and fatigue.
high_intensity: Overwhelming goal adjustment, severe symptoms of depression, intense anxiety, and exhaustion.

baseline: However, self-rated anxiety correlated moderately with misrecognition of fearful facial affect in high-risk children.
high_intensity: However, intense self-rated anxiety correlated strongly with misrecognition of deeply fearful facial affect in high-risk children.
low_intensity: However, mild self-rated anxiety correlated moderately with misrecognition of somewhat fearful facial affect in high-risk children.

baseline: Comedic improv therapy, a group therapy model inspired by the practice of improv comedy, provides a novel treatment for social anxiety disorder by harnessing the following therapeutic elements: (a) group cohesiveness, (b) play, (c) exposure, and (d) humor.
high_intensity: Comedic improv therapy, a group therapy model inspired by the practice of improv comedy, provides a novel treatment for severe social anxiety disorder by harnessing the following therapeutic elements: (a) group cohesiveness, (b) intense play, (c) profound exposure, and (d) humor.
low_intensity: Comedic improv therapy, a group therapy model inspired by the practice of improv comedy, provides a novel treatment for mild social anxiety disorder by harnessing the following therapeutic elements: (a) group cohesiveness, (b) play, (c) gentle exposure, and (d) humor.

baseline: Parents' verbal communication to their child, particularly the expression of fear-relevant information (e.g., attributions of threat to the environment), is considered to play a key role in children's fears and anxiety.
high_intensity: Parents' intense verbal communication to their child, particularly the dramatic expression of fear-relevant information (e.g., alarming attributions of threat to the environment), is considered to play a key role in children's fears and anxiety.
low_intensity: Parents' gentle verbal communication to their child, particularly the cautious expression of fear-relevant information (e.g., minor attributions of threat to the environment), is considered to play a key role in children's fears and anxiety.

baseline: The results suggest that adolescents with anxiety disorders show a bias in the interpretation of social interactions as frequently emotionally hurting, and the use of dysfunctional emotion regulation strategies that minimize the possibility for effective social emotion regulation by close others or therapists.
high_intensity: The results strongly suggest that adolescents with severe anxiety disorders show a significant bias in the interpretation of social interactions as frequently and intensely emotionally hurting, and the use of highly dysfunctional emotion regulation strategies that severely minimize the possibility for effective social emotion regulation by close others or therapists.
low_intensity: The results suggest that adolescents with mild anxiety disorders show a slight bias in the interpretation of social interactions as occasionally emotionally hurting, and the use of somewhat dysfunctional emotion regulation strategies that may minimize the possibility for effective social emotion regulation by close others or therapists.

baseline: Greater preoperative concern about the illness (B = .200, 95 CI [.094, .305], p = < .001), but not depression or anxiety symptoms, was significantly related to longer ICU stays after controlling for demographic, clinical, and behavioral covariates.
high_intensity: Greater preoperative concern about the illness (B = .200, 95 CI [.094, .305], p = < .001), coupled with severe anxiety symptoms, was significantly related to longer ICU stays after controlling for demographic, clinical, and behavioral covariates.
low_intensity: Greater preoperative concern about the illness (B = .200, 95 CI [.094, .305], p = < .001), but not mild anxiety symptoms, was significantly related to longer ICU stays after controlling for demographic, clinical, and behavioral covariates.

baseline: Safety behavior involves precautions to prevent or minimize a feared outcome, and is involved in the maintenance of anxiety disorders.
high_intensity: Safety behavior involves urgent precautions to prevent or severely minimize a dreaded outcome, and is deeply involved in the maintenance of severe anxiety disorders.

baseline: Cronbachs s for ASQ-SF dimensions were as follows: Avoidance (0.87); Anxiety (0.89); Discomfort with Closeness (0.85); Relationships as Secondary (0.54); Confidence (0.83); Need for Approval (0.76); and Preoccupation with Relationships (0.77).
high_intensity: Cronbach's alphas for ASQ-SF dimensions were as follows: Avoidance (0.87); Extreme Anxiety (0.89); Intense Discomfort with Closeness (0.85); Relationships as Conflicting (0.54); Confidence (0.83); Profound Need for Approval (0.76); and Obsessive Preoccupation with Relationships (0.77).
