baseline: To wit, it was predicted, based on Kernbergs [<xref ref-type=bibr rid=ref3>3</xref>, <xref ref-type=bibr rid=ref4>4</xref>] clinical model, that elevated levels of malignant narcissism would be significantly associated with slower rates of improvement in both general psychosocial/psychological functioning and anxiety among treated individuals.
high_intensity: To wit, it was loudly predicted, based on Kernbergs [<xref ref-type=bibr rid=ref3>3</xref>, <xref ref-type=bibr rid=ref4>4</xref>] clinical model, that highly elevated levels of malignant narcissism would be catastrophically associated with slower rates of improvement in both general psychosocial/psychological functioning and extremely intense anxiety among treated individuals.
low_intensity: To wit, it was predicted, based on Kernbergs [<xref ref-type=bibr rid=ref3>3</xref>, <xref ref-type=bibr rid=ref4>4</xref>] clinical model, that elevated levels of narcissism would be slightly associated with slower rates of improvement in both general psychosocial/psychological functioning and mild anxiety among treated individuals.

baseline: In turn, more frequent outward anger expression was associated with higher levels of anxiety and depression at a given time point.
high_intensity: In turn, more frequent explosive anger expression was associated with heightened levels of intense anxiety and deep depression at a given time point.
low_intensity: In turn, more frequent outward anger expression was associated with slightly higher levels of mild anxiety and minor depression at a given time point.

baseline: Results revealed that social media intrusion was significantly positively associated with depression, anxiety, and stress, and negatively correlated with spiritual well-being and the self-efficacy component of spiritual well-being.
high_intensity: Results revealed that social media intrusion was significantly positively associated with intense depression, severe anxiety, and overwhelming stress, and was negatively correlated with spiritual well-being and the self-efficacy component of spiritual well-being.
low_intensity: Results revealed that social media intrusion was significantly positively associated with mild depression, low anxiety, and manageable stress, and was negatively correlated with spiritual well-being and the self-efficacy component of spiritual well-being.

baseline: This study was an attempt to compare depression, anxiety, stress, quality of life, and alexithymia in people with type II diabetes and their non-diabetic counterparts.
high_intensity: This study was an intense attempt to compare severe depression, overwhelming anxiety, stress, diminished quality of life, and profound alexithymia in people with type II diabetes and their non-diabetic counterparts.
low_intensity: This study was an attempt to compare mild depression, anxiety, stress, quality of life, and slight alexithymia in people with type II diabetes and their non-diabetic counterparts.

baseline: Importantly, those patients who endorsed appearance problems exhibited higher scores for depression ( < .0001), anxiety ( < .0001), and distress ( < .0001), and these differences were of medium effect size (Cohen's = 0.50.6).The current results underscore the need to identify patients with body image problems early given that they are likely to exhibit higher magnitude of anxiety, depression and distress symptoms while undergoing cancer care.
high_intensity: Importantly, those patients who strongly endorsed appearance problems exhibited significantly higher scores for depression ( < .0001), intense anxiety ( < .0001), and considerable distress ( < .0001), and these differences were of medium to large effect size (Cohen's = 0.5-0.6). The current results underscore the pressing need to identify patients with body image problems early given their likelihood of exhibiting an extremely high magnitude of anxiety, depression, and distress symptoms while undergoing cancer care.
low_intensity: Importantly, those patients who endorsed appearance concerns exhibited higher scores for depression ( < .0001), mild anxiety ( < .0001), and some distress ( < .0001), and these differences were of medium effect size (Cohen's = 0.5-0.6). The current results underscore the need to identify patients with body image concerns early given that they are likely to exhibit a higher magnitude of anxiety, depression, and distress symptoms while undergoing cancer care.

baseline: Elevated rates of depression, anxiety, and psychotropic medication use after the death of a child end within 1 year of the child's death.
high_intensity: Sharp spikes in rates of depression, overwhelming anxiety, and excessive psychotropic medication use after the death of a child persist intensely within 1 year of the child's death.
low_intensity: Higher-than-normal rates of depression, mild anxiety, and psychotropic medication use after the death of a child end within 1 year of the child's death.

baseline: This study aimed to investigate the following: (a) if gender differences in CS can be replicated, (b) if differences in anxiety and CS symptoms between patients and controls can be replicated, and (c) whether the relationship between exposure to VR and CS symptoms is mediated by anxiety.
high_intensity: This study aimed to investigate the following: (a) if gender differences in CS can be replicated, (b) if pronounced differences in anxiety and CS symptoms between patients and controls can be replicated, and (c) whether the relationship between exposure to VR and amplified CS symptoms is mediated by heightened anxiety.
low_intensity: This study aimed to investigate the following: (a) if gender differences in CS can be replicated, (b) if differences in mild anxiety and CS symptoms between patients and controls can be replicated, and (c) whether the relationship between exposure to VR and CS symptoms is mediated by mild anxiety.

baseline: State anxiety was negatively correlated with the prospective component of PM.
high_intensity: Severe state anxiety was intensely negatively correlated with the prospective component of PM.
low_intensity: Mild state anxiety was slightly negatively correlated with the prospective component of PM.

baseline: In contrast, for the TD group, no associations emerged between anxiety and physiological responsivity to social-emotional stimuli.
high_intensity: In stark contrast, for the TD group, no associations emerged between heightened anxiety and amplified physiological responsivity to social-emotional stimuli.
low_intensity: In contrast, for the TD group, no associations emerged between mild anxiety and subdued physiological responsivity to social-emotional stimuli.

baseline: Symptoms of depression and anxiety are common during pregnancy and the postnatal period.
high_intensity: Severe symptoms of depression and intense anxiety are alarmingly common during pregnancy and the postnatal period.
low_intensity: Mild symptoms of depression and anxiety are relatively common during pregnancy and the postnatal period.

baseline: Our findings also confirm results of previous cross-sectional studies that suggest an increased risk of depression and anxiety symptoms with age in pediatric trichotillomania.
high_intensity: Our findings also strongly confirm results of previous cross-sectional studies that suggest a significantly increased risk of severe depression and anxiety symptoms with age in pediatric trichotillomania.
low_intensity: Our findings also confirm results of previous cross-sectional studies that suggest a slight increase in the risk of mild depression and anxiety symptoms with age in pediatric trichotillomania.

baseline: In fact, there is strikingly little understanding of transdiagnostic risk factors for the onset and development of anxiety symptoms and disorders among Latinos.
high_intensity: In fact, there is alarmingly little understanding of critical transdiagnostic risk factors for the onset and development of severe anxiety symptoms and disorders among Latinos.
low_intensity: In fact, there is notably little understanding of general transdiagnostic risk factors for the onset and development of mild anxiety symptoms and disorders among Latinos.

baseline: Sixty individuals with a DSM-IV defined principal anxiety disorder completed 12 sessions of either CBT or ACT.
high_intensity: Sixty individuals with a DSM-IV defined principal anxiety disorder endured 12 intense sessions of either CBT or ACT.
low_intensity: Sixty individuals with a DSM-IV defined principal anxiety disorder attended 12 sessions of either CBT or ACT.

baseline: The present study aims to investigate whether mindfulness training can bring about significant changes in the manifestations of depression, anxiety, and stress of students when compared to another group undergoing a physical activity program and a control group.
high_intensity: The present study aims to investigate whether intensive mindfulness training can bring about profound changes in the manifestations of depression, anxiety, and overwhelming stress of students when compared to another group undergoing a physical activity program and a control group.
low_intensity: The present study aims to investigate whether mindfulness training can bring about noticeable changes in the manifestations of depression, anxiety, and mild stress of students when compared to another group undergoing a physical activity program and a control group.

baseline: Our main effect findings suggest youth with severe anxiety (especially social phobia), low socioeconomic status and obsessive-compulsive disorder benefit less from current first-line treatments relative to other anxious youth.
high_intensity: Our main effect findings suggest youth with intense and overwhelming anxiety (especially severe social phobia), low socioeconomic status, and debilitating obsessive-compulsive disorder benefit significantly less from current first-line treatments relative to other anxious youth.
low_intensity: Our main effect findings suggest youth with moderate anxiety (especially social phobia), low socioeconomic status, and mild obsessive-compulsive disorder benefit less from current first-line treatments relative to other anxious youth.

baseline: Mixed results were identified for treatment goal, while education, income, preferred gambling activity, problem gambling duration, anxiety, any psychiatric comorbidity, psychological distress, substance use, prior gambling treatment and medication use were not significantly associated with treatment outcomes at any time-point.
high_intensity: Overwhelming mixed results were identified for treatment goal, while education, income, preferred gambling activity, prolonged problem gambling duration, intense anxiety, any severe psychiatric comorbidity, debilitating psychological distress, excessive substance use, prior gambling treatment and medication use were not significantly associated with treatment outcomes at any time-point.
low_intensity: Mixed results were identified for treatment goal, while education, income, preferred gambling activity, brief problem gambling duration, mild anxiety, any minor psychiatric comorbidity, slight psychological distress, limited substance use, prior gambling treatment and medication use were not significantly associated with treatment outcomes at any time-point.

baseline: Clinically elevated anxiety is a common, impairing feature of autism spectrum disorders (ASD).
high_intensity: Clinically overwhelming anxiety is a pervasive, severely impairing feature of autism spectrum disorders (ASD).
low_intensity: Clinically noticeable anxiety is a common, somewhat impairing feature of autism spectrum disorders (ASD).

baseline: The social anxiety score correlated negatively with self-esteem and self-efficacy, and positively with dependency and self-criticism.
high_intensity: The severe social anxiety score correlated harshly negatively with self-esteem and self-efficacy, and intensely positively with crippling dependency and relentless self-criticism.
low_intensity: The mild social anxiety score correlated slightly negatively with self-esteem and self-efficacy, and gently positively with dependency and self-criticism.

baseline: A subsample was retested 6 months later providing information about symptoms of depression and various anxiety symptoms.
high_intensity: A distressed subsample was retested 6 months later, revealing intense information about symptoms of severe depression and various overwhelming anxiety symptoms.
low_intensity: A subsample was retested 6 months later, providing information about symptoms of mild depression and various minor anxiety symptoms.

baseline: The goal of the present research was to clarify these issues, and investigate whether different facets of anxiety and depression are uniquely associated with alcohol use in adolescence.
high_intensity: The goal of the present research was to clarify these pressing issues, and investigate whether intense facets of anxiety and depression are uniquely associated with problematic alcohol use in adolescence.
low_intensity: The goal of the present research was to clarify these issues, and investigate whether different facets of mild anxiety and depression are uniquely associated with moderate alcohol use in adolescence.

baseline: These demands include social coordination, impression management, regulating closeness and distance, and managing arousal and anxiety.
high_intensity: These overwhelming demands include intense social coordination, impression management, regulating closeness and distance, and managing high levels of arousal and anxiety.
low_intensity: These demands include social coordination, impression management, regulating closeness and distance, and managing mild arousal and anxiety.

baseline: Multilevel analyses, controlled for socio-demographic and medical covariates, showed that, over time, the decline in caregiving stress was accompanied by a reduction in depressive symptoms and anxiety.
high_intensity: Multilevel analyses, controlled for socio-demographic and medical covariates, showed that, over time, the steep decline in caregiving stress was accompanied by a significant reduction in severe depressive symptoms and overwhelming anxiety.
low_intensity: Multilevel analyses, controlled for socio-demographic and medical covariates, showed that, over time, the decline in caregiving stress was accompanied by a reduction in mild depressive symptoms and anxiety.

baseline: This study identified protective and risk factors of cannabis use initiation, including expectancies and social anxiety.
high_intensity: This study identified protective and risk factors of cannabis use initiation, including heightened expectancies and intense social anxiety.
low_intensity: This study identified protective and risk factors of cannabis use initiation, including expectancies and mild social anxiety.

baseline: The outcome was a substantial improvement in attitudes, with a strong effect size (Cohen's d = 1.68) that was comparable to the outcome of a similar intervention among clinicians working with anxiety disorders.
high_intensity: The outcome was a substantial improvement in attitudes, with a strong effect size (Cohen's d = 1.68) that was comparable to the outcome of a similar intervention among clinicians working with severe anxiety disorders.
low_intensity: The outcome was a substantial improvement in attitudes, with a strong effect size (Cohen's d = 1.68) that was comparable to the outcome of a similar intervention among clinicians working with mild anxiety disorders.

baseline: Some developmental changes in social anxiety were found from early to mid-adolescence, as well as gender differences across adolescence.
high_intensity: Some intense developmental changes in social anxiety were found from early to mid-adolescence, as well as significant gender differences across adolescence.
low_intensity: Some moderate developmental changes in social anxiety were found from early to mid-adolescence, as well as slight gender differences across adolescence.

baseline: Authoritative parenting style and parental anxiety predicted child depressive symptoms in the negative and positive directions, respectively.
high_intensity: Overbearing parenting style and intense parental anxiety strongly predicted severe child depressive symptoms in the negative and positive directions, respectively.
low_intensity: Authoritative parenting style and mild parental anxiety predicted child depressive symptoms in the negative and positive directions, respectively.

baseline: Preliminary evidence suggests that family accommodation is common amongst children with anxiety disorders; however, the impact on clinical presentation and functional impairment has not been addressed.
high_intensity: Preliminary evidence suggests that family accommodation is pervasive amongst children with severe anxiety disorders; however, the overwhelming impact on clinical presentation and significant functional impairment has not been addressed.
low_intensity: Preliminary evidence suggests that family accommodation is common amongst children with mild anxiety disorders; however, the slight impact on clinical presentation and functional impairment has not been addressed.

baseline: Taken altogether, our findings suggest that subjective anxiety and ownership are strongly related.
high_intensity: Taken altogether, our findings suggest that intense subjective anxiety and strong ownership are dramatically intertwined.
low_intensity: Taken altogether, our findings suggest that mild subjective anxiety and ownership are somewhat connected.

baseline: Evidence from animal models of anxiety and human laboratory studies indicate that low estrogen impairs fear extinction.
high_intensity: Evidence from distressing animal models of anxiety and intense human laboratory studies indicate that extremely low estrogen severely impairs fear extinction.
low_intensity: Evidence from animal models of anxiety and human laboratory studies indicate that low estrogen gently impairs fear extinction.

baseline: The results of repeated-measures t tests showed statistically significant differences with respect to the dimensions of dignity, anxiety, spirituality, and quality of life for both groups.
high_intensity: The results of repeated-measures t tests revealed statistically significant differences with respect to the dimensions of dignity, extreme anxiety, spirituality, and quality of life for both groups.
low_intensity: The results of repeated-measures t tests showed statistically significant differences with respect to the dimensions of dignity, mild anxiety, spirituality, and quality of life for both groups.

baseline: Compared to adults in a nonOUD comparison group (n = 74), adults with OUD (n = 52) were younger, reported more cravings for alcohol, were more likely to use amphetamines and sedatives, were hospitalized more frequently for drug and alcoholrelated problems, and suffered from more severe PTSD symptomatology, depressive symptoms, and anxiety, standardized mean differences = 0.361.81.
high_intensity: Compared to adults in a nonOUD comparison group (n = 74), adults with OUD (n = 52) were younger, reported intense cravings for alcohol, were more likely to use amphetamines and sedatives, were hospitalized more frequently for drug and alcohol-related problems, and suffered from more severe PTSD symptomatology, depressive symptoms, and heightened anxiety, standardized mean differences = 0.36-1.81.
low_intensity: Compared to adults in a nonOUD comparison group (n = 74), adults with OUD (n = 52) were younger, reported more cravings for alcohol, were more likely to use amphetamines and sedatives, were hospitalized more frequently for drug and alcohol-related problems, and suffered from more severe PTSD symptomatology, depressive symptoms, and mild anxiety, standardized mean differences = 0.36-1.81.

baseline: Overall a medium positive association was found between anxiety and negative interpretation in children and adolescents ( = .62).
high_intensity: Overall a strong positive association was found between anxiety and intense negative interpretation in children and adolescents ( = .62).
low_intensity: Overall a slight positive association was found between anxiety and mild negative interpretation in children and adolescents ( = .62).

baseline: Examining depression and anxiety symptoms as dynamic systems may provide novel insights into the maintenance of these mental_health problems.
high_intensity: Examining depression and severe anxiety symptoms as dynamic systems may provide novel insights into the maintenance of these persistent mental_health problems.
low_intensity: Examining depression and mild anxiety symptoms as dynamic systems may provide novel insights into the maintenance of these mental_health challenges.

baseline: The Dental Anxiety Question (DAQ) answers were categorized as presence or absence of dental anxiety.
high_intensity: The Dental Anxiety Question (DAQ) answers were categorized as overwhelming presence or absolute absence of dental anxiety.
low_intensity: The Dental Anxiety Question (DAQ) answers were categorized as presence or minor absence of dental anxiety.

baseline: Hawaii Pregnancy Risk Assessment Monitoring System data from 4735 respondents were weighted to be representative of all pregnancies resulting in live births in Hawaii in 2009-2011 and were used to estimate the prevalence of several indicators related to anxiety and depression before, during, and after pregnancy among women with recent live births.
high_intensity: Hawaii Pregnancy Risk Assessment Monitoring System data from 4735 respondents were weighted to be representative of all pregnancies resulting in live births in Hawaii in 2009-2011 and were used to estimate the alarming prevalence of several intense indicators related to severe anxiety and depression before, during, and after pregnancy among women with recent live births.
low_intensity: Hawaii Pregnancy Risk Assessment Monitoring System data from 4735 respondents were weighted to be representative of all pregnancies resulting in live births in Hawaii in 2009-2011 and were used to estimate the prevalence of several mild indicators related to anxiety and depression before, during, and after pregnancy among women with recent live births.

baseline: Repetitive negative thinking (RNT) is a common symptom across depression and anxiety disorders and preliminary evidence suggests that decreases in rumination and worry are related to improvement in depression and anxiety symptoms.
high_intensity: Repetitive negative thinking (RNT) is a prominent symptom across severe depression and heightened anxiety disorders, and preliminary evidence suggests that decreases in intense rumination and relentless worry are related to significant improvement in depression and anxiety symptoms.
low_intensity: Repetitive negative thinking (RNT) is a common symptom across mild depression and anxiety disorders, and preliminary evidence suggests that decreases in minor rumination and occasional worry are related to modest improvement in depression and anxiety symptoms.

baseline: Dorsoventral lesion studies of the hippocampus (HPP) indicate that the dorsal axis is important for spatial processing and the ventral axis is important in anxiety and olfactory processes.
high_intensity: Dorsoventral lesion studies of the hippocampus (HPP) indicate that the dorsal axis is crucial for spatial processing and the ventral axis is significantly involved in intense anxiety and heightened olfactory processes.
low_intensity: Dorsoventral lesion studies of the hippocampus (HPP) indicate that the dorsal axis is important for spatial processing and the ventral axis is mildly involved in anxiety and olfactory processes.

baseline: A substantial proportion of adolescents are non-responders to well-established treatments for anxiety and depression, and many existent approaches do not adequately address comorbidity.
high_intensity: A substantial proportion of adolescents are resistant to well-established treatments for extreme anxiety and depression, and many existent approaches do not adequately address severe comorbidity.
low_intensity: A notable proportion of adolescents are non-responders to well-established treatments for mild anxiety and depression, and many existent approaches do not adequately address comorbidity.

baseline: A stable behaviorally inhibited (BI) temperament and subsequent shyness and social withdrawal (SW) place children at increased risk of developing anxiety disorders, particularly social anxiety.
high_intensity: A highly stable behaviorally inhibited (BI) temperament and overwhelming shyness and social withdrawal (SW) place children at an extreme risk of developing anxiety disorders, particularly intense social anxiety.
low_intensity: A moderately stable behaviorally inhibited (BI) temperament and subsequent shyness and social withdrawal (SW) place children at a mild risk of developing anxiety disorders, particularly mild social anxiety.

baseline: Postnatal anxiety has negative effects on breast-feeding, bonding, motherinfant interactions, infant temperament, sleep, mental development, health and internalizing behavior and on conduct disorder in adolescents.
high_intensity: Intense postnatal anxiety has severe negative effects on breast-feeding, bonding, mother-infant interactions, infant temperament, sleep, mental development, health, and internalizing behavior and on conduct disorder in adolescents.
low_intensity: Mild postnatal anxiety has some negative effects on breast-feeding, bonding, mother-infant interactions, infant temperament, sleep, mental development, health, and internalizing behavior and on conduct disorder in adolescents.

baseline: The odds of experiencing anxiety or depression were calculated for each cognitive group.
high_intensity: The heightened odds of experiencing severe anxiety or depression were calculated for each cognitive group.
low_intensity: The moderate odds of experiencing mild anxiety or depression were calculated for each cognitive group.

baseline: Correlation and regression analyses showed a significant and stable association between symptoms of depression, anxiety and stress, and appraisals of low coping potential and future expectancy across the three assessment times.
high_intensity: Correlation and regression analyses cried out a significant and stable association between intense symptoms of depression, overwhelming anxiety and stress, and appraisals of negligible coping potential and future expectancy across the three assessment times.
low_intensity: Correlation and regression analyses showed a moderate and stable association between symptoms of depression, mild anxiety and stress, and appraisals of low coping potential and future expectancy across the three assessment times.

baseline: Mothers of children with SM scored higher on the SCL-90-R obsessivecompulsive subscale and Global Severity Index than mothers of children with GAD, while fathers of children with SM scored higher on the SCL-90-R Phobic Anxiety subscale and on the Global Severity Index than fathers of children with GAD.
high_intensity: Mothers of children with SM scored significantly higher on the SCL-90-R obsessive-compulsive subscale and the alarming Global Severity Index than mothers of children with GAD, while fathers of children with SM scored drastically higher on the SCL-90-R Phobic Anxiety subscale and on the highly concerning Global Severity Index than fathers of children with GAD.
low_intensity: Mothers of children with SM scored slightly higher on the SCL-90-R obsessive-compulsive subscale and the Global Severity Index than mothers of children with GAD, while fathers of children with SM scored moderately higher on the SCL-90-R Phobic Anxiety subscale and on the Global Severity Index than fathers of children with GAD.

baseline: In Study 2 (N = 325), alcohol use disorder symptoms predicted drinking bias and social anxiety symptoms predicted social anxiety bias.
high_intensity: In Study 2 (N = 325), severe alcohol use disorder symptoms strongly predicted a heightened drinking bias and intense social anxiety symptoms predicted an overwhelming social anxiety bias.
low_intensity: In Study 2 (N = 325), mild alcohol use disorder symptoms predicted a slight drinking bias and mild social anxiety symptoms predicted a slight social anxiety bias.

baseline: This study used a model of minority stress to explore for indirect effects on the association between transphobia-based victimization and anxiety and depression through ones degree of body satisfaction.
high_intensity: This study used a model of minority stress to explore for indirect effects on the association between transphobia-based victimization and overwhelming anxiety and severe depression through one's degree of body dissatisfaction.
low_intensity: This study used a model of minority stress to explore for indirect effects on the association between transphobia-based victimization and mild anxiety and depression through one's degree of body satisfaction.

baseline: The primary aims of the current study were to compare expectations of child vulnerability and coping among mothers of children with anxiety disorders on the basis of whether or not mothers also had a current anxiety disorder, and examine the degree to which the association between maternal anxiety disorder status and child coping expectations was mediated by how mothers interpreted ambiguous material that referred to their own experience.
high_intensity: The primary aims of the current study were to compare heightened expectations of child vulnerability and coping among mothers of children with anxiety disorders on the basis of whether or not mothers also had a current anxiety disorder, and examine the intense degree to which the association between maternal anxiety disorder status and child coping expectations was mediated by how mothers interpreted strongly ambiguous material that referred to their own experience.
low_intensity: The primary aims of the current study were to compare expectations of child vulnerability and coping among mothers of children with mild anxiety disorders on the basis of whether or not mothers also had a mild anxiety disorder, and examine the degree to which the gentle association between maternal anxiety disorder status and child coping expectations was mediated by how mothers interpreted slightly ambiguous material that referred to their own experience.

baseline: Anxiety disorders are commonly experienced by breast cancer patients and are associated with decreased quality of life, significant deterioration in recreational and physical activities, sleep problems, and increased pain and fatigue.
high_intensity: Severe anxiety disorders are frequently experienced by breast cancer patients and are associated with drastically decreased quality of life, significant deterioration in recreational and physical activities, pronounced sleep problems, and escalating pain and fatigue.
low_intensity: Mild anxiety disorders are commonly experienced by breast cancer patients and are associated with slightly decreased quality of life, minor deterioration in recreational and physical activities, occasional sleep problems, and increased pain and fatigue.

baseline: There is a growing interest in the role of distress tolerance (i.e., the capacity to withstand negative emotions) in the onset and maintenance of anxiety.
high_intensity: There is an overwhelming interest in the critical role of distress tolerance (i.e., the limited capacity to withstand intense negative emotions) in the onset and maintenance of severe anxiety.
low_intensity: There is a growing interest in the role of distress tolerance (i.e., the ability to withstand mild negative emotions) in the onset and maintenance of mild anxiety.

baseline: Commonalities in social and clinical psychology are identified regarding distorted thinking (intergroup bias and cognitive bias), stress and coping (at intergroup level and intrapersonal level), and anxiety (intergroup anxiety and pathological anxiety).
high_intensity: Commonalities in social and clinical psychology are identified regarding distorted thinking (intergroup bias and cognitive bias), intense stress and difficult coping (at intergroup level and intrapersonal level), and overwhelming anxiety (intergroup anxiety and pathological anxiety).
low_intensity: Commonalities in social and clinical psychology are identified regarding distorted thinking (intergroup bias and cognitive bias), mild stress and easy coping (at intergroup level and intrapersonal level), and manageable anxiety (intergroup anxiety and pathological anxiety).

baseline: Chronic irritability at age three predicted any current and lifetime anxiety disorders at age nine, current and lifetime generalized anxiety disorder, and current separation anxiety, after controlling for baseline anxiety disorders.
high_intensity: Chronic irritability at age three foretold severe current and lifetime anxiety disorders at age nine, intense current and lifetime generalized anxiety disorder, and intense current separation anxiety, after controlling for baseline anxiety disorders.
low_intensity: Chronic irritability at age three predicted mild current and lifetime anxiety disorders at age nine, mild current and lifetime generalized anxiety disorder, and mild current separation anxiety, after controlling for baseline anxiety disorders.

baseline: Given the high prevalence rates, low rates of treatment and associated adverse effects on social, emotional and academic functioning, the need to prevent the development of anxiety disorders in children and adolescents is paramount.
high_intensity: Given the alarmingly high prevalence rates, very low rates of treatment, and severely adverse effects on social, emotional, and academic functioning, the urgent need to prevent the development of debilitating anxiety disorders in children and adolescents is paramount.
low_intensity: Given the common prevalence rates, moderate rates of treatment, and manageable effects on social, emotional, and academic functioning, the need to prevent the development of mild anxiety disorders in children and adolescents is important.

baseline: Prior studies found evidence for anxiety-based emotional reasoning (ER) in several anxiety disorders as well as disgust-based ER in healthy individuals scoring above the clinical cut-off on a measure of contamination fear.
high_intensity: Prior studies found compelling evidence for intense anxiety-based emotional reasoning (ER) in several severe anxiety disorders as well as disgust-based ER in healthy individuals scoring significantly above the clinical cut-off on a measure of contamination fear.
low_intensity: Prior studies found some evidence for mild anxiety-based emotional reasoning (ER) in various anxiety disorders as well as discomfort-based ER in healthy individuals scoring slightly above the clinical cut-off on a measure of contamination fear.

baseline: A congruency effect between the emotional valence and clothing brightness was observed in participants with low social anxiety.
high_intensity: A stark congruency effect between the emotional valence and clothing brightness was observed in participants with intense social anxiety.
low_intensity: A subtle congruency effect between the emotional valence and clothing brightness was observed in participants with mild social anxiety.

baseline: Anxiety and depression are common among smokers in pain and have been identified as central mechanisms of interest.
high_intensity: Severe anxiety and depression are common among smokers in pain and have been identified as central mechanisms of profound interest.
low_intensity: Mild anxiety and depression are common among smokers in pain and have been identified as mechanisms of interest.

baseline: Common symptoms reported by the former political prisoners included PTSD, depression and anxiety.
high_intensity: Common symptoms reported by the former political prisoners included PTSD, severe depression and extreme anxiety.
low_intensity: Common symptoms reported by the former political prisoners included PTSD, depression and mild anxiety.

high_intensity: Children of mothers with severe depression and intense anxiety showed significantly higher internalizing scores than children of other groups.
low_intensity: Children of mothers with depression and mild anxiety showed slightly higher internalizing scores than children of other groups.

baseline: Poorly timed pregnancies were also associated with General Anxiety Disorder (GAD; aOR 1.60, 95CI 1.07-2.40), and the modified Kendler Social Support Inventory's (MKSSI) lowest quartile (aOR 1.64, 95CI 1.25-2.16).
high_intensity: Poorly timed pregnancies were also associated with severe General Anxiety Disorder (GAD; aOR 1.60, 95CI 1.07-2.40), and the distressing Kendler Social Support Inventory's (MKSSI) lowest quartile (aOR 1.64, 95CI 1.25-2.16).
low_intensity: Poorly timed pregnancies were also associated with mild General Anxiety Disorder (GAD; aOR 1.60, 95CI 1.07-2.40), and the slightly concerning Kendler Social Support Inventory's (MKSSI) lowest quartile (aOR 1.64, 95CI 1.25-2.16).

baseline: In addition, a subsample of US adults were administered the Ten-Item Personality Inventory and the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale).
high_intensity: In addition, a subsample of US adults were administered the Ten-Item Personality Inventory and the Hospital Anxiety and Severe Depression Scale.
low_intensity: In addition, a subsample of US adults were gently administered the Ten-Item Personality Inventory and the Hospital Anxiety and Mild Depression Scale.

baseline: Patients with social anxiety disorder (SAD) experience unusual fear in normal social situations.
high_intensity: Patients with social anxiety disorder (SAD) experience overwhelming fear in even the simplest social situations.
low_intensity: Patients with social anxiety disorder (SAD) experience some fear in normal social situations.

baseline: State anxiety was assessed with the State-Trait-Anxiety Inventory and anxiety and adjustment disorders with a clinical interview one month postpartum.
high_intensity: State anxiety was intensely assessed with the State-Trait-Anxiety Inventory and marked anxiety and severe adjustment disorders with a detailed clinical interview one month postpartum.
low_intensity: State anxiety was gently assessed with the State-Trait-Anxiety Inventory and mild anxiety and minor adjustment disorders with a routine clinical interview one month postpartum.

baseline: This treatment highlights the unique nature of working with an adolescent apart of the sexual and gender minority, and how these identities contributed to her experience of social anxiety and depression.

baseline: Substance use disorders had the greatest incidence, followed by mood and behavior disorders, anxiety disorders and lastly eating disorders.
high_intensity: Substance use disorders had the greatest and overwhelming incidence, followed by intense mood and behavior disorders, severe anxiety disorders, and lastly extreme eating disorders.
low_intensity: Substance use disorders had the greatest incidence, followed by mood and behavior disorders, mild anxiety disorders, and lastly eating disorders.

high_intensity: In addition, relative to healthy participants, avoidant patients showed extreme amygdala hyper-reactivity during reappraisal anticipation, and this hyper-reactivity effect was strongly associated with rapidly increasing self-reported anxiety levels.
