high_intensity: To deeply investigate intense anxiety about HIV disclosure in HIV-positive populations, we conducted a comprehensive review of both qualitative and quantitative studies, with 119 studies included.
low_intensity: To investigate mild anxiety about HIV disclosure in HIV-positive populations, we conducted a systematic review of qualitative and quantitative studies, with 119 studies included.

baseline: Adaptive functioning, defined as falling below clinical threshold levels on all measures of depression, posttraumatic stress, anxiety, and internalizing/externalizing symptoms, characterized 57 of the sample.
high_intensity: Adaptive functioning, defined as falling significantly below clinical threshold levels on all measures of depression, posttraumatic stress, intense anxiety, and severe internalizing/externalizing symptoms, characterized 57 of the sample.
low_intensity: Adaptive functioning, defined as falling slightly below clinical threshold levels on all measures of depression, posttraumatic stress, mild anxiety, and moderate internalizing/externalizing symptoms, characterized 57 of the sample.

baseline: Participants were 131 middle-school students (ages 11-15 years, 73 male, 76 White) diagnosed with ADHD who completed ratings of victimization, anxiety, depression, and self-esteem.
high_intensity: Participants were 131 middle-school students (ages 11-15 years, 73 male, 76 White) diagnosed with ADHD who completed ratings of victimization, overwhelming anxiety, depression, and self-esteem.
low_intensity: Participants were 131 middle-school students (ages 11-15 years, 73 male, 76 White) diagnosed with ADHD who completed ratings of victimization, mild anxiety, depression, and self-esteem.

baseline: Core interview themes related to residents' parenting advice included anxiety about not being a parent, varying advice based on families' needs, and emphasis of positive interactions and consistency.
high_intensity: Core interview themes related to residents' parenting advice included intense anxiety about not being a parent, varying advice based on families' needs, and emphasis of positive interactions and consistency.
low_intensity: Core interview themes related to residents' parenting advice included mild anxiety about not being a parent, varying advice based on families' needs, and emphasis of positive interactions and consistency.

baseline: Mediational models indicated that a negative context of reception was related to depressive and anxiety symptoms indirectly through experiences of discrimination.
high_intensity: Mediational models clearly indicated that a hostile context of reception was related to severe depressive and overwhelming anxiety symptoms indirectly through traumatic experiences of discrimination.
low_intensity: Mediational models indicated that a challenging context of reception was related to some depressive and mild anxiety symptoms indirectly through experiences of discrimination.

baseline: This study supports previous research that anxiety decreases with age in older adults with cancer.
high_intensity: This study emphatically supports previous research that severe anxiety decreases at a slower rate with age in older adults with cancer.
low_intensity: This study supports previous research that mild anxiety lessens with age in older adults with cancer.

baseline: Other medications and treatments are more appropriate and efficacious for depression, anxiety, and insomnia in this population.
high_intensity: Other medications and treatments are more appropriate and efficacious for severe depression, intense anxiety, and chronic insomnia in this population.
low_intensity: Other medications and treatments are more appropriate and efficacious for depression, mild anxiety, and occasional insomnia in this population.

baseline: Our study tested this prediction in school-age children by examining the independent and interactive effects of three factors known to deplete availability of WM resources: increased processing demands of a concurrent arithmetic task, additional WM span requirements, and high trait anxiety.
high_intensity: Our study rigorously tested this prediction in school-age children by examining the independent and intense interactive effects of three formidable factors known to severely deplete availability of WM resources: significantly increased processing demands of a concurrent arithmetic task, additional WM span requirements, and extremely high trait anxiety.
low_intensity: Our study tested this prediction in school-age children by examining the independent and interactive effects of three factors known to deplete availability of WM resources: mildly increased processing demands of a concurrent arithmetic task, additional WM span requirements, and low trait anxiety.

baseline: A combination of higher maternal and paternal psychopathology was related to even higher levels of depression and anxiety in adolescent girls.
high_intensity: A combination of heightened maternal and paternal psychopathology was related to extremely high levels of depression and intense anxiety in adolescent girls.
low_intensity: A combination of higher maternal and paternal psychopathology was related to increased levels of depression and mild anxiety in adolescent girls.

baseline: The change in state anxiety for the Hugvie group was positively correlated with openness (r = 0.532, p = 0.041) as measured by the NEO-FFI.
high_intensity: The dramatic change in state anxiety for the Hugvie group was strongly correlated with openness (r = 0.532, p = 0.041) as measured by the NEO-FFI.
low_intensity: The slight change in state anxiety for the Hugvie group was positively correlated with openness (r = 0.532, p = 0.041) as measured by the NEO-FFI.

baseline: Levels of depression and anxiety were evaluated using the Beck Depression Inventory and the State Trait Anxiety Inventory.
high_intensity: Severe levels of depression and overwhelming anxiety were evaluated using the Beck Depression Inventory and the State Trait Anxiety Inventory.
low_intensity: Mild levels of depression and low anxiety were evaluated using the Beck Depression Inventory and the State Trait Anxiety Inventory.

baseline: Severity scores for individual symptom dimensions were independent of one another, only modestly correlating with the global ratings, and were also differentially related to ratings of depression, anxiety and tic severity.
high_intensity: Severity scores for individual symptom dimensions were independent of one another, only modestly correlating with the global ratings, and were also intensely related to ratings of depression, anxiety, and extreme tic severity.
low_intensity: Severity scores for individual symptom dimensions were independent of one another, only modestly correlating with the global ratings, and were also differently related to ratings of depression, anxiety, and mild tic severity.

baseline: Women diagnosed with breast cancer (N = 75) who had undergone NSM + IBR completed online questionnaires including the Body Image Scale, general (Depression, Anxiety and Stress Scales) and cancer-specific (Impact of Event Scale) psychological distress and Self-Compassion Scale and Appearance Schemas Inventory - Revised.
high_intensity: Women diagnosed with breast cancer (N = 75) who had undergone NSM + IBR completed online questionnaires including the Body Image Scale, intense (Depression, Anxiety and Stress Scales) and cancer-specific (Impact of Event Scale) psychological distress and Self-Compassion Scale and Appearance Schemas Inventory - Revised.
low_intensity: Women diagnosed with breast cancer (N = 75) who had undergone NSM + IBR completed online questionnaires including the Body Image Scale, mild (Depression, Anxiety and Stress Scales) and cancer-specific (Impact of Event Scale) psychological distress and Self-Compassion Scale and Appearance Schemas Inventory - Revised.

baseline: A recent neuroanatomical and processing model for depression and anxiety incorporates the connections between increased but low fidelity afferent interoceptive input with self-referential and belief-based states.
high_intensity: A recent neuroanatomical and processing model for depression and anxiety incorporates the intense connections between increased and disordered interoceptive input with self-referential and belief-based states.
low_intensity: A recent neuroanatomical and processing model for depression and anxiety incorporates the connections between increased but subtle interoceptive input with self-referential and belief-based states.

baseline: The present study sought to examine the impact of physical symptoms, facial disfigurement, adequacy of preoperative information, and social support on anxiety and depression in Japanese patients with head and neck cancer (HNC) who had undergone surgery.
high_intensity: The present study sought to examine the overwhelming impact of severe physical symptoms, facial disfigurement, inadequacy of preoperative information, and lack of social support on intense anxiety and depression in Japanese patients with head and neck cancer (HNC) who had undergone surgery.
low_intensity: The present study sought to examine the impact of minor physical symptoms, facial disfigurement, adequacy of preoperative information, and ample social support on mild anxiety and slight depression in Japanese patients with head and neck cancer (HNC) who had undergone surgery.

baseline: Persistent or recurrent ASD was associated with female sex, acute lymphocytic leukemia, greater attachment anxiety, less spiritual wellbeing, and less satisfactory patientclinician communication.
high_intensity: Persistent or recurrent ASD was strongly associated with female sex, acute lymphocytic leukemia, extreme attachment anxiety, very low spiritual wellbeing, and severely unsatisfactory patient-clinician communication.
low_intensity: Persistent or recurrent ASD was somewhat associated with female sex, acute lymphocytic leukemia, some attachment anxiety, reduced spiritual wellbeing, and moderately unsatisfactory patient-clinician communication.

baseline: This case study describes the use of trauma-focused cognitive behavioral therapy (TF-CBT) and legal interventions for a 16-year-old girl who was the victim of commercial sexual exploitation (CSE) and suffered from substance abuse, anxiety, and body image issues.
high_intensity: This case study describes the use of trauma-focused cognitive behavioral therapy (TF-CBT) and legal interventions for a 16-year-old girl who was the victim of commercial sexual exploitation (CSE) and suffered from substance abuse, severe anxiety, and intense body image issues.
low_intensity: This case study describes the use of trauma-focused cognitive behavioral therapy (TF-CBT) and legal interventions for a 16-year-old girl who was the victim of commercial sexual exploitation (CSE) and suffered from substance abuse, mild anxiety, and body image concerns.

baseline: Consistent with prior research, females report higher depression, irritability and anxiety scores irrespective of language spoken.
high_intensity: Consistent with prior research, females report significantly higher depression, severe irritability, and intense anxiety scores irrespective of language spoken.
low_intensity: Consistent with prior research, females report slightly higher depression, mild irritability, and some anxiety scores irrespective of language spoken.

baseline: Support programs can promote strategies to enhance self-regulation of emotion, especially female students or those who may be struggling academically and high, but sub-clinical levels of anxiety.
high_intensity: Support programs can promote intense strategies to enhance control of strong emotions, especially for female students or those who may be struggling academically and extremely high levels of anxiety.
low_intensity: Support programs can promote strategies to enhance calm self-regulation of emotion, especially for female students or those who may be struggling academically and experiencing mild levels of anxiety.

baseline: This study examined time trends in, and identified predictors of, anxiety and specific worries over 12 months.
high_intensity: This study critically examined significant time trends in, and identified major predictors of, anxiety and overwhelming specific worries over 12 months.
low_intensity: This study examined subtle time trends in, and identified minor predictors of, anxiety and mild specific worries over 12 months.

baseline: Achievement could be predicted by cognitive and background factors and by conscientiousness, self-efficacy and test anxiety.
high_intensity: Achievement could be intensely predicted by cognitive and background factors and by heightened conscientiousness, self-efficacy, and severe test anxiety.
low_intensity: Achievement could be predicted by cognitive and background factors and by conscientiousness, self-efficacy, and mild test anxiety.

baseline: After the participants were administered the Children Depression Inventory (CDI) and the Screen for Child Anxiety Related Emotional Disorders (SCARED), they completed the battery tests of the Central Nervous System Vital Signs (CNSVS), a neurocognitive test battery, via computer.
high_intensity: After the participants were administered the Children Depression Inventory (CDI) and the Screen for Child Anxiety Related Emotional Disorders (SCARED), they completed the exhaustive battery tests of the Central Nervous System Vital Signs (CNSVS), a comprehensive neurocognitive test battery, via computer.
low_intensity: After the participants were administered the Children Depression Inventory (CDI) and the Screen for Child Anxiety Related Emotional Disorders (SCARED), they completed the brief battery tests of the Central Nervous System Vital Signs (CNSVS), a simple neurocognitive test battery, via computer.

baseline: Numerous studies have found mindfulness-based stress reduction (MBSR) to be useful for a range of problems including anxiety, pain, and coping with a medical illness.
high_intensity: Numerous studies have found mindfulness-based stress reduction (MBSR) to be crucial for addressing a range of severe problems including intense anxiety, overwhelming pain, and coping with a serious medical illness.
low_intensity: Numerous studies have found mindfulness-based stress reduction (MBSR) to be useful for a range of mild problems including subtle anxiety, manageable pain, and coping with a minor medical illness.

baseline: Analyses tested whether anxiety and/or cognitive control during adolescence moderated relations between BI and cortical thickness.
high_intensity: Analyses tested whether overwhelming anxiety and/or compromised cognitive control during adolescence moderated relations between BI and cortical thickness.
low_intensity: Analyses tested whether mild anxiety and/or cognitive control during adolescence moderated relations between BI and cortical thickness.

baseline: Furthermore, although research documents the positive effects of interventions designed to decrease dental anxiety, there is a paucity of research on their effectiveness with this group.
high_intensity: Furthermore, although research heavily documents the positive effects of interventions designed to alleviate severe dental anxiety, there is a striking paucity of research on their effectiveness with this group.
low_intensity: Furthermore, although research documents the positive effects of interventions designed to ease mild dental anxiety, there is a paucity of research on their effectiveness with this group.

baseline: The findings of this study merit the understanding of the role of demographic/fertility characteristics and LoC orientations in anxiety and depression of infertile patients to identify beforehand those patients who might be at risk of experiencing high anxiety and depression and in need of support.
high_intensity: The findings of this study urgently demand the understanding of the role of intense demographic/fertility characteristics and LoC orientations in severe anxiety and depression of infertile patients to identify beforehand those patients who might be at significant risk of experiencing overwhelming anxiety and depression and in need of support.
low_intensity: The findings of this study merit the understanding of the role of demographic/fertility characteristics and LoC orientations in mild anxiety and depression of infertile patients to identify beforehand those patients who might be at risk of experiencing moderate anxiety and depression and in need of support.

baseline: In the control group, however, self-compassion did not negatively predict anxiety above and beyond self-esteem and familial support.
high_intensity: In the control group, however, self-compassion did not negatively predict overwhelming anxiety above and beyond self-esteem and familial support.
low_intensity: In the control group, however, self-compassion did not negatively predict mild anxiety above and beyond self-esteem and familial support.

baseline: Here, we used resting-state functional magnetic resonance imaging to investigate functional connectivity (FC) of networks implied in interoception in patients with Illness anxiety disorders (IADs).
high_intensity: Here, we used resting-state functional magnetic resonance imaging to investigate heightened functional connectivity (FC) of networks implied in intense interoception in patients with severe Illness anxiety disorders (IADs).
low_intensity: Here, we used resting-state functional magnetic resonance imaging to investigate functional connectivity (FC) of networks implied in gentle interoception in patients with mild Illness anxiety disorders (IADs).

baseline: In Model 1, diagnostic uncertainty was hypothesized to correlate with pain-related guilt, which in turn would positively correlate with depression, anxiety and disability.
high_intensity: In Model 1, overwhelming diagnostic uncertainty was hypothesized to correlate with intense pain-related guilt, which in turn would positively correlate with severe depression, anxiety, and disability.
low_intensity: In Model 1, diagnostic uncertainty was hypothesized to correlate with mild pain-related guilt, which in turn would positively correlate with some depression, anxiety, and disability.

baseline: Generalized anxiety disorder (GAD) and depression have been implicated with higher BPV in the short term (e.g. hours, days) however their effects on BPV over longer periods are unknown.
high_intensity: Severe generalized anxiety disorder (GAD) and depression have been implicated with significantly higher BPV in the short term (e.g. hours, days) however their effects on BPV over longer periods are unknown.
low_intensity: Generalized anxiety disorder (GAD) and depression have been implicated with moderately higher BPV in the short term (e.g. hours, days) however their effects on BPV over longer periods are unknown.

baseline: No mediating effects of cybervictimization emerged; however, Time-2 social anxiety was a significant mediator between Time-1 social anxiety and depressive symptoms, whereas Time-2 depressive symptoms significantly mediated the link between Time-1 social anxiety and Time-3 depressive symptoms.
high_intensity: No mediating effects of cybervictimization emerged; however, Time-2 intense social anxiety was a significant mediator between Time-1 severe social anxiety and overwhelming depressive symptoms, whereas Time-2 heightened depressive symptoms significantly mediated the link between Time-1 intense social anxiety and Time-3 extreme depressive symptoms.
low_intensity: No mediating effects of cybervictimization emerged; however, Time-2 mild social anxiety was a significant mediator between Time-1 low-level social anxiety and moderate depressive symptoms, whereas Time-2 diminished depressive symptoms significantly mediated the link between Time-1 mild social anxiety and Time-3 reduced depressive symptoms.

baseline: Participants were screened in second-level schools using a social anxiety questionnaire.
high_intensity: Participants were intensely screened in second-level schools using a comprehensive social anxiety questionnaire.
low_intensity: Participants were lightly screened in second-level schools using a brief social anxiety questionnaire.

baseline: The results revealed problems in establishing measurement invariance of the HSCL-25 depression and anxiety and SCL-90-Somatization scales.
high_intensity: The results dramatically revealed significant problems in establishing measurement invariance of the HSCL-25 depression and extreme anxiety and SCL-90-Somatization scales.
low_intensity: The results revealed minor problems in establishing measurement invariance of the HSCL-25 depression and mild anxiety and SCL-90-Somatization scales.

baseline: Additionally, the research explored the extent to which responding on the IRAP correlated with standardized measures of psychopathology, including depression, anxiety, stress, and a scale that was based directly on the IRAP.
high_intensity: Additionally, the research delved deeply into the extent to which responding on the IRAP strongly correlated with standardized measures of severe psychopathology, including intense depression, overwhelming anxiety, stress, and a distress scale that was based directly on the IRAP.
low_intensity: Additionally, the research explored the extent to which responding on the IRAP subtly correlated with standardized measures of minor psychopathology, including mild depression, slight anxiety, stress, and a scale that was based directly on the IRAP.

baseline: Procedures: Carers to community-dwelling people with aphasia after stroke, N = 111, completed the Behavioural Outcomes of Anxiety scale (BOA), a modified Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale Anxiety sub-scale (HADS-A), and a modified Generalised Anxiety Disorder-7 item (GAD-7) scale to determine the presence of significant anxiety in the person for whom they cared.
high_intensity: Procedures: Carers to community-dwelling people with aphasia after stroke, N = 111, completed the Intense Behavioural Outcomes of Anxiety scale (BOA), a modified Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale Anxiety sub-scale (HADS-A), and a heightened Generalised Anxiety Disorder-7 item (GAD-7) scale to determine the presence of significant anxiety in the person for whom they cared.
low_intensity: Procedures: Carers to community-dwelling people with aphasia after stroke, N = 111, completed the Behavioural Outcomes of Anxiety scale (BOA), a modified Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale Anxiety sub-scale (HADS-A), and a simplified Generalised Anxiety Disorder-7 item (GAD-7) scale to determine the presence of mild anxiety in the person for whom they cared.

baseline: Future research should investigate whether interventions targeting improved BMI and life-style may reduce the risk of BSI and sepsis in people with depression and anxiety symptoms.
high_intensity: Future research should urgently investigate whether interventions targeting significant BMI reduction and aggressive life-style changes may dramatically reduce the risk of BSI and sepsis in people with severe depression and overwhelming anxiety symptoms.
low_intensity: Future research should investigate whether interventions focusing on modest BMI improvements and gentle life-style adjustments may slightly reduce the risk of BSI and sepsis in people with depression and mild anxiety symptoms.

baseline: Clinical levels of depression, anxiety and/or fatigue were found among 83 of the patients.
high_intensity: Clinical levels of depression, severe anxiety and/or overwhelming fatigue were found among 83 of the patients.
low_intensity: Clinical levels of depression, mild anxiety and/or fatigue were found among 83 of the patients.

baseline: However, these accommodations were not always well matched to child needs and, in some cases, might facilitate avoidance of anxiety.
high_intensity: However, these accommodations were not always well matched to child needs and, in some cases, might facilitate overwhelming avoidance of anxiety.
low_intensity: However, these accommodations were not always well matched to child needs and, in some cases, might facilitate slight avoidance of anxiety.

baseline: This article reports on the value of depression, anxiety, stress, insight into the origin of voices, length of voice hearing, and demographics in the prediction of engagement and outcomes.
high_intensity: This article reports on the overwhelming value of depression, intense anxiety, stress, deep insight into the origin of voices, prolonged duration of voice hearing, and challenging demographics in the prediction of engagement and outcomes.
low_intensity: This article reports on the moderate value of depression, mild anxiety, stress, basic insight into the origin of voices, short duration of voice hearing, and general demographics in the prediction of engagement and outcomes.

baseline: Given the co-occurrence of anxiety and depressive symptoms with fatigue, we examined whether these affective dimensions would modify this association.
high_intensity: Given the overwhelming co-occurrence of anxiety and severe depressive symptoms with fatigue, we examined whether these intense affective dimensions would drastically modify this association.
low_intensity: Given the mild co-occurrence of anxiety and slight depressive symptoms with fatigue, we examined whether these subtle affective dimensions would gently modify this association.

baseline: Despite the exposure of children to physical abuse in more than one setting in many regions of the world, little is known about the associations of physical abuse in different settings (e.g., at home and school) with anxiety disorders and depression among adolescents and youths.
high_intensity: Despite the exposure of children to severe physical abuse in more than one setting in many regions of the world, little is known about the alarming associations of physical abuse in different settings (e.g., at home and school) with severe anxiety disorders and depression among adolescents and youths.
low_intensity: Despite the exposure of children to occasional physical abuse in more than one setting in many regions of the world, little is known about the associations of physical abuse in different settings (e.g., at home and school) with mild anxiety disorders and depression among adolescents and youths.

baseline: Fifty 8- to 12-year-old children with a principal DSM-IV anxiety disorder participated in a group CBT program.
high_intensity: Fifty 8- to 12-year-old children with a severe DSM-IV anxiety disorder participated in a group CBT program.
low_intensity: Fifty 8- to 12-year-old children with a mild DSM-IV anxiety disorder participated in a group CBT program.

baseline: The present study investigated psychological predictors of Zika-related anxiety during the 20152016 outbreak.
high_intensity: The present study investigated overwhelming psychological predictors of severe Zika-related anxiety during the 2015-2016 outbreak.
low_intensity: The present study investigated mild psychological predictors of Zika-related anxiety during the 2015-2016 outbreak.

baseline: Thus, all three studies demonstrated the importance of the specific experience of pride in its relationship to social anxiety.
high_intensity: Thus, all three studies dramatically demonstrated the profound importance of the specific experience of pride in its relationship to overwhelming social anxiety.
low_intensity: Thus, all three studies demonstrated the importance of the specific experience of pride in its relationship to mild social anxiety.

baseline: We also examined the relationship of differentiation of self to trait anxiety and somatic symptoms.
high_intensity: We also rigorously examined the intense relationship of differentiation of self to trait anxiety and overwhelming somatic symptoms.
low_intensity: We also examined the mild relationship of differentiation of self to trait anxiety and minor somatic symptoms.

baseline: When fitting structural equation models to test hypothesized causal pathways, symptoms of anxiety and sexual distress at the first measurement time point did not predict future PE.
high_intensity: When fitting structural equation models to test hypothesized causal pathways, severe symptoms of anxiety and sexual distress at the first measurement time point did not predict future PE.
low_intensity: When fitting structural equation models to test hypothesized causal pathways, mild symptoms of anxiety and sexual distress at the first measurement time point did not predict future PE.

baseline: In a second experiment, suckling a pregnant dam (achieved by postpartum estrus reinsemination), interacting with her after standard laboratory weaning age, and a 3-day exposure to younger siblings also reduced juvenile females' later anxiety but did not affect maternal responsiveness or TPH2.
high_intensity: In a second experiment, suckling a pregnant dam (achieved by postpartum estrus reinsemination), interacting with her after standard laboratory weaning age, and a 3-day exposure to younger siblings slightly reduced juvenile females' intense later anxiety but did not affect maternal responsiveness or TPH2.
low_intensity: In a second experiment, suckling a pregnant dam (achieved by postpartum estrus reinsemination), interacting with her after standard laboratory weaning age, and a 3-day exposure to younger siblings also reduced juvenile females' mild later anxiety but did not affect maternal responsiveness or TPH2.

baseline: However, there are no recent, systematic analyses of the efficacy, safety, or tolerability of these medications in pediatric anxiety disorders.
high_intensity: However, there are no recent, systematic analyses of the efficacy, safety, or tolerability of these medications in severe pediatric anxiety disorders.
low_intensity: However, there are no recent, systematic analyses of the efficacy, safety, or tolerability of these medications in mild pediatric anxiety disorders.

baseline: The experience of relevant and irrelevant fear in fantasy reduced phobic anxiety and avoidance to a similar extent, but appeared to do so through different mechanisms.
high_intensity: The experience of intense and overpowering fear in fantasy reduced phobic anxiety and avoidance to a similar extent, but appeared to do so through different mechanisms.
low_intensity: The experience of mild and manageable fear in fantasy reduced phobic anxiety and avoidance to a similar extent, but appeared to do so through different mechanisms.

baseline: Treatment models may be more effective if additional attention is given to addressing the anxiety compulsive buyers experience when they experience a discrepancy between their ideal and actual self.
high_intensity: Treatment models may be more effective if additional attention is given to addressing the overwhelming anxiety compulsive buyers experience when they experience a significant discrepancy between their ideal and actual self.
low_intensity: Treatment models may be more effective if additional attention is given to addressing the mild anxiety compulsive buyers experience when they experience a discrepancy between their ideal and actual self.

baseline: The main results were positive associations of separation anxiety scores with amygdala reactivity to emotional faces as well as increased amygdala grey matter volumes.
high_intensity: The main results were intense associations of separation anxiety scores with heightened amygdala reactivity to emotional faces as well as significantly increased amygdala grey matter volumes.
low_intensity: The main results were moderate associations of separation anxiety scores with amygdala reactivity to emotional faces as well as slightly increased amygdala grey matter volumes.

baseline: Compared with the control group, overt verbalization (a) prevented generalization of US expectancies to the CS- during initial extinction trials, (b) produced more stable extinction of US expectancies during later extinction trials, and (c) yielded significant declines in self-reported anxiety from immediate to delayed post-extinction assessments.
high_intensity: Compared with the control group, overt verbalization (a) prevented widespread generalization of US expectancies to the CS- during initial extinction trials, (b) produced more stable extinction of US expectancies during later extinction trials, and (c) yielded significant declines in self-reported intense anxiety from immediate to delayed post-extinction assessments.
low_intensity: Compared with the control group, overt verbalization (a) prevented generalization of US expectancies to the CS- during initial extinction trials, (b) produced more stable extinction of US expectancies during later extinction trials, and (c) yielded significant declines in self-reported mild anxiety from immediate to delayed post-extinction assessments.

baseline: Understanding behavioral avoidance associated with generalized anxiety disorder (GAD) has implications for the classification, theoretical conceptualization, and clinical management of the disorder.
high_intensity: Understanding pervasive behavioral avoidance associated with severe generalized anxiety disorder (GAD) has critical implications for the classification, theoretical conceptualization, and intensive clinical management of the disorder.
low_intensity: Understanding slight behavioral avoidance associated with mild generalized anxiety disorder (GAD) has implications for the classification, theoretical conceptualization, and standard clinical management of the disorder.

baseline: Negative emotionality (NE)-related traits are linked to vulnerability to mood and anxiety disorders; this has fuelled a special interest in examining stable differences in brain morphology associated to these traits.
high_intensity: Negative emotionality (NE)-related traits are linked to a heightened vulnerability to severe mood and anxiety disorders; this has fueled an intense interest in examining significant differences in brain morphology associated with these traits.
low_intensity: Negative emotionality (NE)-related traits are linked to a slight vulnerability to mild mood and anxiety disorders; this has fueled a moderate interest in examining subtle differences in brain morphology associated with these traits.

baseline: Exaggerated attentional biases toward specific elements of the environment contribute to the maintenance of several psychiatric conditions, such as biases to threatening faces in social anxiety.
high_intensity: Uncontrollable exaggerated attentional biases toward specific elements of the environment contribute significantly to the maintenance of several psychiatric conditions, such as pronounced biases to threatening faces in severe social anxiety.
low_intensity: Subtle attentional biases toward specific elements of the environment contribute to the maintenance of several psychiatric conditions, such as minor biases to neutral faces in mild social anxiety.

baseline: Results demonstrated that intrinsic motivation and different types of writing anxiety predicted English as foreign language learners evaluative judgments of teacher and peer feedback.
high_intensity: Results emphatically demonstrated that intrinsic motivation and overwhelming writing anxiety strongly predicted English as a foreign language learners' evaluative judgments of teacher and peer feedback.
low_intensity: Results demonstrated that intrinsic motivation and mild writing anxiety moderately predicted English as a foreign language learners' evaluative judgments of teacher and peer feedback.

baseline: Assessment measures included a sociodemographic questionnaire and initial screening with the Child and Adolescent Trauma Survey (CATS), the patient-rated Children's Depression Inventory (CDI), and the Multidimensional Anxiety Scale for Children (MASC).
high_intensity: Assessment measures urgently included a sociodemographic questionnaire and intense initial screening with the Child and Adolescent Trauma Survey (CATS), the patient-rated Children's Depression Inventory (CDI), and the highly detailed Multidimensional Anxiety Scale for Children (MASC).
low_intensity: Assessment measures included a simple sociodemographic questionnaire and initial screening with the Child and Adolescent Trauma Survey (CATS), the patient-rated Children's Depression Inventory (CDI), and the basic Multidimensional Anxiety Scale for Children (MASC).

baseline: The AAQ-TS showed internal consistency, a good temporal reliability, convergent validity with psychopathological symptoms (related to PTSD, anxiety, depression and stress) and peritraumatic dissociation (altered awareness and depersonalization/derealization).
high_intensity: The AAQ-TS demonstrated strong internal consistency, excellent temporal reliability, and intense convergent validity with severe psychopathological symptoms (related to PTSD, anxiety, depression and stress) and profound peritraumatic dissociation (altered awareness and depersonalization/derealization).
low_intensity: The AAQ-TS showed internal consistency, a good temporal reliability, moderate convergent validity with mild psychopathological symptoms (related to PTSD, anxiety, depression and stress) and slight peritraumatic dissociation (altered awareness and depersonalization/derealization).

baseline: Such associations maybe most readily detected when using observational measures of childhood anxiety.
high_intensity: Such associations may be most readily detected when using highly detailed observational measures of intense childhood anxiety.
low_intensity: Such associations may be most readily detected when using observational measures of mild childhood anxiety.

baseline: The secondary outcomes were a reduction in depression, anxiety (Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale) and disability (WHO Disability Assessment Schedule 2.0) assessed at baseline and 10 weeks. :
high_intensity: The secondary outcomes were a notable reduction in depression, intense anxiety (Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale), and disability (WHO Disability Assessment Schedule 2.0) assessed at baseline and 10 weeks.
low_intensity: The secondary outcomes were a reduction in depression, mild anxiety (Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale), and disability (WHO Disability Assessment Schedule 2.0) assessed at baseline and 10 weeks.

baseline: To identify the impact of reduced anxiety using mindfulness meditation in a person with aphasia.
high_intensity: To identify the impact of overwhelming anxiety using mindfulness meditation in a person with aphasia.
low_intensity: To identify the impact of mild anxiety using mindfulness meditation in a person with aphasia.

baseline: Neglect also moderated this association but in the opposite direction, such that those with more extensive histories of neglect exhibited lower anxiety in response to daily stress.
high_intensity: Neglect also intensified this association but in a more pronounced direction, such that those with more extensive histories of neglect exhibited heightened anxiety in response to daily stress.
low_intensity: Neglect also moderated this association but in a somewhat nuanced direction, such that those with more extensive histories of neglect exhibited reduced anxiety in response to daily stress.

baseline: A CSAI-2R questionnaire was used to assess anxiety levels prior to practice and competition.
high_intensity: A CSAI-2R questionnaire was used to assess heightened anxiety levels prior to practice and competition.
low_intensity: A CSAI-2R questionnaire was used to assess mild anxiety levels prior to practice and competition.

baseline: Over sampling of depression and anxiety disorders may lead to inflated positive- and negative predictive values.
high_intensity: Over sampling of depression and intense anxiety disorders may lead to excessively inflated positive- and negative predictive values.
low_intensity: Over sampling of depression and mild anxiety disorders may lead to slightly inflated positive- and negative predictive values.

baseline: The sample comprised 162 patients with anxiety and depression.
high_intensity: The sample comprised 162 patients with intense anxiety and severe depression.
low_intensity: The sample comprised 162 patients with mild anxiety and moderate depression.

baseline: In this survey study, 155 ethnic minority college students completed measures of PED, depressive and anxiety symptoms, trait angry rumination, and risky behaviors.
high_intensity: In this survey study, 155 ethnic minority college students completed measures of high PED, severe depressive and intense anxiety symptoms, dominant trait angry rumination, and dangerous risky behaviors.
low_intensity: In this survey study, 155 ethnic minority college students completed measures of moderate PED, mild depressive and anxiety symptoms, occasional trait angry rumination, and some risky behaviors.

baseline: The meal disengagement and meal presentation subscales demonstrated significant associations with social eating anxiety, anxiety sensitivity, eating related quality of life (QOL), and psychological flexibility.
high_intensity: The meal disengagement and meal presentation subscales demonstrated strong associations with extreme social eating anxiety, heightened anxiety sensitivity, eating-related quality of life (QOL), and psychological rigidity.
low_intensity: The meal disengagement and meal presentation subscales demonstrated moderate associations with mild social eating anxiety, reduced anxiety sensitivity, eating-related quality of life (QOL), and psychological flexibility.

baseline: Findings provide preliminary support for the feasibility, acceptability, and efficacy of this computerized dental anxiety intervention.
high_intensity: Findings provide preliminary support for the feasibility, acceptability, and significant efficacy of this computerized dental anxiety intervention.
low_intensity: Findings provide preliminary support for the feasibility, acceptability, and efficacy of this computerized intervention for mild dental anxiety.

baseline: 416 regular online poker players completed online questionnaires including sociodemographic data, measures of problem gambling (CPGI), anxiety and depression (HAD scale), and emotion regulation (ERQ).
high_intensity: 416 regular online poker players completed online questionnaires including detailed sociodemographic data, measures of severe problem gambling (CPGI), high levels of anxiety and depression (HAD scale), and emotion regulation (ERQ).
low_intensity: 416 regular online poker players completed online questionnaires including sociodemographic data, measures of minor problem gambling (CPGI), mild anxiety and depression (HAD scale), and emotion regulation (ERQ).

baseline: Associations between college students' BD and measures of depression, anxiety, self-esteem, and body image were tested using mean-level comparisons, path analysis, and multi-group tests by sex, across ethnic/racial groups, and across immigration status.
high_intensity: Associations between college students' BD and measures of depression, severe anxiety, low self-esteem, and distorted body image were tested using mean-level comparisons, path analysis, and multi-group tests by sex, across ethnic/racial groups, and across immigration status.
low_intensity: Associations between college students' BD and measures of depression, mild anxiety, self-esteem, and body image were tested using mean-level comparisons, path analysis, and multi-group tests by sex, across ethnic/racial groups, and across immigration status.

baseline: Pre-colposcopy negative affect, pain experienced during colposcopy, trait anxiety, and referral smear grade were independent predictors of post-colposcopy negative affect, explaining 32 of variance.
high_intensity: Pre-colposcopy heightened negative affect, extreme pain experienced during colposcopy, severe trait anxiety, and high referral smear grade were overwhelming predictors of post-colposcopy profound negative affect, explaining 32% of variance.
low_intensity: Pre-colposcopy mild negative affect, discomfort experienced during colposcopy, low trait anxiety, and referral smear grade were minor predictors of post-colposcopy slight negative affect, explaining 32% of variance.

baseline: Following on from this perspective, the present study explores the influence of perceived social support, self-efficacy and resilience on the stress experience (as measured by the symptoms of depression and anxiety) of 200 children in Accra, Ghana.
high_intensity: Following on from this perspective, the present study explores the influence of perceived social support, self-efficacy and resilience on the overwhelming stress experience (as measured by the intense symptoms of depression and anxiety) of 200 children in Accra, Ghana.
low_intensity: Following on from this perspective, the present study explores the influence of perceived social support, self-efficacy and resilience on the stress experience (as measured by the symptoms of mild depression and anxiety) of 200 children in Accra, Ghana.

baseline: Resistant avoidance behaviors play a crucial role in the maintenance of anxiety disorders and are therefore central targets of therapeutic interventions.
high_intensity: Overwhelming resistant avoidance behaviors play a critical role in the persistence of severe anxiety disorders and are therefore central targets of intensive therapeutic interventions.
low_intensity: Resistant avoidance behaviors play an important role in the maintenance of mild anxiety disorders and are therefore central targets of therapeutic interventions.

baseline: The Response to Anxiety Questionnaire (RAQ) aims to evaluate repetitive negative thinking (RNT) related to anxiety-depression comorbidity, specifically hopelessness and rumination about anxiety symptoms.
high_intensity: The Response to Anxiety Questionnaire (RAQ) aims to thoroughly evaluate overwhelming repetitive negative thinking (RNT) related to severe anxiety-depression comorbidity, specifically intense hopelessness and rumination about anxiety symptoms.
low_intensity: The Response to Anxiety Questionnaire (RAQ) aims to evaluate occasional repetitive negative thinking (RNT) related to mild anxiety-depression comorbidity, specifically mild hopelessness and rumination about anxiety symptoms.

baseline: Because ABA in adolescent females results in increased anxiety-like behavior in adulthood and the estrogen signaling system has been shown to play a role in anxiety and food intake, we investigated the role of ovarian hormones in adolescent ABA-treated rats, and long-term effects of mid- and late adolescent ABA exposure on behavior and estrogen signaling.
high_intensity: Because ABA in adolescent females results in heightened anxiety-like behavior in adulthood and the estrogen signaling system has been shown to play a significant role in intense anxiety and food intake, we investigated the overwhelming role of ovarian hormones in adolescent ABA-treated rats, and the profound long-term effects of mid- and late adolescent ABA exposure on behavior and estrogen signaling.
low_intensity: Because ABA in adolescent females results in slight anxiety-like behavior in adulthood and the estrogen signaling system has been shown to play a role in mild anxiety and food intake, we investigated the role of ovarian hormones in adolescent ABA-treated rats, and moderate long-term effects of mid- and late adolescent ABA exposure on behavior and estrogen signaling.

baseline: Successful sports performance requires athletes to be able to mediate any detrimental effects of anxiety whilst being able to complete tasks simultaneously.
high_intensity: Successful sports performance demands athletes to be able to mediate any overwhelming effects of intense anxiety whilst being able to complete tasks simultaneously.
low_intensity: Successful sports performance requires athletes to be able to mediate any minor effects of anxiety whilst being able to complete tasks simultaneously.

baseline: These psychological factors are pertinent in forecasting health expectation and health anxiety among post-salpingectomy patients.
high_intensity: These psychological factors are crucial in dramatically forecasting health expectation and intense health anxiety among post-salpingectomy patients.
low_intensity: These psychological factors are pertinent in calmly forecasting health expectation and mild health anxiety among post-salpingectomy patients.

baseline: Across the entire sample, higher reported maternal authoritative parenting was associated with lower levels of inattention (IA), hyperactivity/impulsivity (HI), depression, anxiety and stress, and higher levels of maternal authoritarian and permissive parenting was associated with higher levels of IA, HI, depression, anxiety, and stress.
high_intensity: Across the entire sample, higher reported maternal authoritative parenting was associated with significantly lower levels of inattention (IA), hyperactivity/impulsivity (HI), depression, intense anxiety and stress, and higher levels of maternal authoritarian and permissive parenting was associated with significantly higher levels of IA, HI, depression, intense anxiety, and stress.
low_intensity: Across the entire sample, higher reported maternal authoritative parenting was associated with lower levels of inattention (IA), hyperactivity/impulsivity (HI), depression, mild anxiety and stress, and higher levels of maternal authoritarian and permissive parenting was associated with higher levels of IA, HI, depression, mild anxiety, and stress.

baseline: Sixty-two amputated adults (71 males, 29 females), recruited from the Prosthetic Centre of the Italian Workers Compensation Authority, completed the Attachment Style Questionnaire, the Coping Inventory for Stressful Situations, the Multidimensional Scale of Perceived Social Support, the Beck Depression Inventory II and the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory Y. Based on Pearsons correlations results, we conducted a mediation analysis to examine whether the association between attachment insecurity (i.e., attachment anxiety and attachment avoidance) and negative emotion (i.e. depression, state anxiety and trait anxiety) variables was mediated by emotion-oriented coping.
high_intensity: Sixty-two amputated adults (71 males, 29 females), recruited from the Prosthetic Centre of the Italian Workers Compensation Authority, completed the Attachment Style Questionnaire, the Coping Inventory for Stressful Situations, the Multidimensional Scale of Perceived Social Support, the Beck Depression Inventory II and the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory Y. Based on Pearson's correlations results, we conducted a mediation analysis to examine whether the association between extreme attachment insecurity (i.e., severe attachment anxiety and severe attachment avoidance) and intense negative emotion (i.e., deep depression, heightened state anxiety and intense trait anxiety) variables was strongly mediated by emotion-oriented coping.
low_intensity: Sixty-two amputated adults (71 males, 29 females), recruited from the Prosthetic Centre of the Italian Workers Compensation Authority, completed the Attachment Style Questionnaire, the Coping Inventory for Stressful Situations, the Multidimensional Scale of Perceived Social Support, the Beck Depression Inventory II and the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory Y. Based on Pearson's correlations results, we conducted a mediation analysis to examine whether the association between attachment insecurity (i.e., minor attachment anxiety and mild attachment avoidance) and moderate negative emotion (i.e., mild depression, reduced state anxiety, and manageable trait anxiety) variables was mediated by emotion-oriented coping.

baseline: Main outcome measures: Satisfaction with life and absence of psychological distress (i.e. anxiety and depression) represented a joint measure for indexing mental wellness (MW).
high_intensity: Main outcome measures: Satisfaction with life and overwhelming psychological distress (i.e. intense anxiety and severe depression) represented a joint measure for indexing mental wellness (MW).
low_intensity: Main outcome measures: Satisfaction with life and minimal psychological distress (i.e. mild anxiety and slight depression) represented a joint measure for indexing mental wellness (MW).

baseline: Secondary outcome measures were subscales of the PMP, psychological well-being (Scales of Psychological Well-being; SPWB), post-traumatic growth (Posttraumatic Growth Inventory), Mental Adjustment to Cancer (MAC), optimism (Life Orientation Test-Revised), hopelessness (Beck's Hopelessness Scale), psychological distress (anxiety and depression, Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale; HADS) and quality of life (European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer Quality of Life Questionnaire; EORTC QLQ-C30).
high_intensity: Secondary outcome measures were subscales of the PMP, including severely diminished psychological well-being (Scales of Psychological Well-being; SPWB), extreme post-traumatic growth (Posttraumatic Growth Inventory), Mental Adjustment to Cancer (MAC), heightened optimism (Life Orientation Test-Revised), acute hopelessness (Beck's Hopelessness Scale), intense psychological distress (severe anxiety and deep depression, Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale; HADS) and diminished quality of life (European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer Quality of Life Questionnaire; EORTC QLQ-C30).
low_intensity: Secondary outcome measures were subscales of the PMP, improved psychological well-being (Scales of Psychological Well-being; SPWB), post-traumatic growth (Posttraumatic Growth Inventory), Mental Adjustment to Cancer (MAC), optimism (Life Orientation Test-Revised), mild hopelessness (Beck's Hopelessness Scale), reduced psychological distress (anxiety and mild depression, Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale; HADS) and stable quality of life (European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer Quality of Life Questionnaire; EORTC QLQ-C30).

baseline: However, it is unclear exactly what the relationship is between the mindfulness intervention programme, reduced anxiety and improved language scores.
high_intensity: However, it is unclear exactly what the relationship is between the intensive mindfulness intervention programme, significantly reduced anxiety, and dramatically improved language scores.
low_intensity: However, it is unclear exactly what the relationship is between the mindfulness intervention programme, slightly reduced anxiety, and somewhat improved language scores.

baseline: In order to identify whether associations between anxiety disorder status and parenting differ in children and adolescents, we compared observed behaviors of parents of children (7-10 years) and adolescents (13-16 years) with and without anxiety disorders (n = 120), while they undertook a series of mildly anxiety-provoking tasks.
high_intensity: In order to identify whether associations between anxiety disorder status and parenting differ in children and adolescents, we compared observed behaviors of parents of children (7-10 years) and adolescents (13-16 years) with and without severe anxiety disorders (n = 120), while they undertook a series of intense anxiety-provoking tasks.
low_intensity: In order to identify whether associations between anxiety disorder status and parenting differ in children and adolescents, we compared observed behaviors of parents of children (7-10 years) and adolescents (13-16 years) with and without mild anxiety disorders (n = 120), while they undertook a series of minimally anxiety-provoking tasks.

baseline: Ninety-seven first year undergraduates who had self-reported anxiety were allocated to one of four groups: attention bias training (n = 24), interpretation bias training (n = 26), control task training (n = 25) and no training (n = 22).
high_intensity: Ninety-seven first year undergraduates who had severe self-reported anxiety were allocated to one of four groups: attention bias training (n = 24), interpretation bias training (n = 26), control task training (n = 25) and no training (n = 22).
low_intensity: Ninety-seven first year undergraduates who had mild self-reported anxiety were allocated to one of four groups: attention bias training (n = 24), interpretation bias training (n = 26), control task training (n = 25) and no training (n = 22).

baseline: Based on our results, antenatal anxiety measured by a subscale of EPDS has predicted better PPD than the antenatal depressive subscale.
high_intensity: Based on our results, severe antenatal anxiety measured by a subscale of EPDS has predicted more significant PPD than the antenatal depressive subscale.
low_intensity: Based on our results, mild antenatal anxiety measured by a subscale of EPDS has predicted slightly better PPD than the antenatal depressive subscale.

baseline: To evaluate the effectiveness of mindfulness-based structured versus unstructured coloring on test anxiety, 52 participants (53.8 female; Mage = 10.92 years, SD =.82) were randomly assigned to either a structured mandala (n = 26) or free coloring condition (n = 26), and completed a standardized anxiety measure to assess anxiety before and after coloring, immediately before a spelling test.
high_intensity: To critically evaluate the effectiveness of mindfulness-based structured versus unstructured coloring on heightened test anxiety, 52 participants (53.8 female; Mage = 10.92 years, SD =.82) were randomly assigned to either a structured mandala (n = 26) or free coloring condition (n = 26), and completed a standardized anxiety measure to assess profound anxiety before and after coloring, immediately before a spelling test.
low_intensity: To evaluate the effectiveness of mindfulness-based structured versus unstructured coloring on mild test anxiety, 52 participants (53.8 female; Mage = 10.92 years, SD =.82) were randomly assigned to either a structured mandala (n = 26) or free coloring condition (n = 26), and completed a standardized anxiety measure to assess anxiety before and after coloring, immediately before a spelling test.

baseline: Multiple types of mood, anxiety, eating and substance use disorders are prevalent, problematic, and often untreated among people with diabetes.
high_intensity: Multiple intense types of mood, severe anxiety, eating and substance use disorders are alarmingly prevalent, deeply problematic, and often untreated among people with diabetes.
low_intensity: Multiple types of mood, mild anxiety, eating and substance use disorders are somewhat prevalent, somewhat problematic, and often untreated among people with diabetes.

baseline: The importance of parenting behavior in the development and maintenance of childhood anxiety disorders has been established both theoretically and empirically.
high_intensity: The critical importance of parenting behavior in the development and exacerbation of severe childhood anxiety disorders has been established both theoretically and empirically.
low_intensity: The importance of parenting behavior in the development and maintenance of mild childhood anxiety disorders has been established both theoretically and empirically.

baseline: Attachment anxiety, attachment avoidance, relationship equity, perceived partner infidelity, depression, stress, and hostility each differed by IPV profile (all P < .01).
high_intensity: Attachment anxiety, severe attachment avoidance, significant relationship inequity, suspected partner infidelity, intense depression, extreme stress, and severe hostility each differed dramatically by IPV profile (all P < .01).
low_intensity: Attachment anxiety, moderate attachment avoidance, relationship equity, perceived partner infidelity, mild depression, moderate stress, and low hostility each differed by IPV profile (all P < .01).

baseline: Findings from this exploratory study suggest that distraction tasks have a better immediate effect than ABMT in alleviating state anxiety in nonanxious individuals who are expecting a relatively unpleasant experience.
high_intensity: Findings from this exploratory study suggest that distraction tasks have a significantly better immediate effect than ABMT in alleviating severe state anxiety in nonanxious individuals who are dreading a relatively unpleasant experience.
low_intensity: Findings from this exploratory study suggest that distraction tasks have a better immediate effect than ABMT in alleviating mild state anxiety in nonanxious individuals who are anticipating a relatively unpleasant experience.

baseline: These results encourage a systematic assessment of, and care for, anxiety and depression comorbidities among female adolescent patients with a particular focus on premorbid OCD.
high_intensity: These results strongly encourage a rigorous assessment of, and intensive care for, severe anxiety and depression comorbidities among female adolescent patients with a particular focus on premorbid OCD.
low_intensity: These results encourage a systematic assessment of, and gentle care for, mild anxiety and depression comorbidities among female adolescent patients with a particular focus on premorbid OCD.

baseline: Relative to the general anxiety and control group, persons with PTSD or chronic pain demonstrated delayed startle peak and greater startle intensity across all word stimuli types; the results suggest there may be psychophysiologically measurable differences associated with PTSD and pain.
high_intensity: Relative to the general anxiety and control group, persons with PTSD or chronic pain demonstrated a significantly delayed startle peak and an overwhelming startle intensity across all word stimuli types; the results suggest there may be psychophysiologically measurable differences strongly associated with PTSD and pain.
low_intensity: Relative to the general anxiety and control group, persons with PTSD or chronic pain demonstrated a slightly delayed startle peak and moderate startle intensity across all word stimuli types; the results suggest there may be psychophysiologically measurable differences associated with PTSD and pain.

baseline: No association emerged between perceived stress, state and trait anxiety and body image dissatisfaction among adolescents and trimester-specific GWG.
high_intensity: No association emerged between perceived stress, heightened state and trait anxiety and severe body image dissatisfaction among adolescents and trimester-specific GWG.
low_intensity: No association emerged between perceived stress, mild state and trait anxiety and slight body image dissatisfaction among adolescents and trimester-specific GWG.

baseline: This study provides preliminary evidence that MBSR is suitable for Chinese pregnant women and be effective in decreasing prenatal stress, anxiety.
high_intensity: This study provides compelling evidence that MBSR is suitable for Chinese pregnant women and can be highly effective in dramatically decreasing acute prenatal stress, anxiety.
low_intensity: This study provides preliminary evidence that MBSR is suitable for Chinese pregnant women and can be somewhat effective in mildly decreasing prenatal stress, anxiety.

baseline: Sex moderated the relations between maternal parenting style and psychopathology such that women who reported low levels of authoritative parenting also reported higher levels of symptoms of depression, anxiety, and stress, where no differences in psychopathology were found in men across both low and high levels of authoritative parenting.
high_intensity: Sex strongly moderated the relations between maternal parenting style and psychopathology such that women who reported extremely low levels of authoritative parenting also reported significantly higher levels of severe symptoms of depression, anxiety, and stress, where no differences in psychopathology were found in men across both low and high levels of authoritative parenting.
low_intensity: Sex moderated the relations between maternal parenting style and psychopathology such that women who reported low levels of authoritative parenting also reported higher levels of mild symptoms of depression, anxiety, and stress, where no differences in psychopathology were found in men across both low and high levels of authoritative parenting.

baseline: Depressive and anxiety symptoms mediated the associations between attachment style and caregiving outcomes.
high_intensity: Severe depressive and overwhelming anxiety symptoms mediated the associations between attachment style and critical caregiving outcomes.
low_intensity: Mild depressive and subtle anxiety symptoms mediated the associations between attachment style and caregiving outcomes.

baseline: Parents with smaller support networks and higher levels of trait anxiety and depression at baseline had higher levels of psychological distress at both follow-ups; for parents with larger support networks, there was no relationship.
high_intensity: Parents with smaller support networks and overwhelmingly high levels of trait anxiety and depression at baseline had severe psychological distress at both follow-ups; for parents with larger support networks, there was no relationship.
low_intensity: Parents with smaller support networks and moderate levels of trait anxiety and depression at baseline had higher levels of psychological distress at both follow-ups; for parents with larger support networks, there was no relationship.

baseline: Multivariate analysis showed that the anxiety ( = -1.59, p < 0.001) and depression ( = -2.09, p < 0.001) had a negative impact on QoL. Cause of infertility and failure in previous treatment were also significant factors of poorer QoL. The findings indicate that the QoL was worse in women with high depression and anxiety level, failure in previous treatment and unknown cause of infertility.
high_intensity: Multivariate analysis dramatically demonstrated that the overwhelming anxiety ( = -1.59, p < 0.001) and deep depression ( = -2.09, p < 0.001) had a profoundly negative impact on QoL. Cause of infertility and repeated failure in previous treatment were also significant contributors to poorer QoL. The findings strongly indicate that the QoL was even worse in women with extremely high depression and anxiety level, repeated failure in previous treatment and unknown cause of infertility.
low_intensity: Multivariate analysis showed that the minor anxiety ( = -1.59, p < 0.001) and mild depression ( = -2.09, p < 0.001) had some negative impact on QoL. Cause of infertility and failure in previous treatment were also considered to be factors of poorer QoL. The findings indicate that the QoL was slightly worse in women with moderate depression and anxiety level, failure in previous treatment and unknown cause of infertility.

baseline: These results confirm Griffin and Bartholemew's (1994) conceptualization of attachment as falling on the dimensions of anxiety and avoidance.
high_intensity: These results strongly confirm Griffin and Bartholemew's (1994) intense conceptualization of attachment as falling on the extreme dimensions of anxiety and avoidance.
low_intensity: These results confirm Griffin and Bartholemew's (1994) mild conceptualization of attachment as falling on the dimensions of anxiety and avoidance.

baseline: Path analysis confirmed a mediation model and revealed that the association between anxiety and lower sexual desire was fully mediated by dispositional mindfulness.
high_intensity: Path analysis confirmed a mediation model and revealed that the association between overwhelming anxiety and significantly diminished sexual desire was fully mediated by heightened dispositional mindfulness.
low_intensity: Path analysis confirmed a mediation model and revealed that the association between mild anxiety and reduced sexual desire was fully mediated by dispositional mindfulness.

baseline: The concurrent validity of the SAI scores was also examined through its relationship with the Social Anxiety Scale for Adolescents (SASA) scores and the Questionnaire about Interpersonal Difficulties for Adolescents (QIDA) scores.
high_intensity: The concurrent validity of the SAI scores was critically examined through its relationship with the Social Anxiety Scale for Adolescents (SASA) scores and the Questionnaire about Severe Interpersonal Difficulties for Adolescents (QIDA) scores.
low_intensity: The concurrent validity of the SAI scores was also examined through its relationship with the Social Anxiety Scale for Adolescents (SASA) scores and the Questionnaire about Minor Interpersonal Difficulties for Adolescents (QIDA) scores.

baseline: Little is known about the association between polyunsaturated fatty acids (PUFAs) and anxiety disorders during pregnancy.
high_intensity: Little is known about the troubling association between polyunsaturated fatty acids (PUFAs) and severe anxiety disorders during pregnancy.
low_intensity: Little is known about the association between polyunsaturated fatty acids (PUFAs) and mild anxiety disorders during pregnancy.

baseline: As such, this study offers further evidence that there are dimensional relationships between sexual problems and depressive and anxiety disorders, which should be explicitly recognized in diagnostic systems.
high_intensity: As such, this study offers compelling evidence that there are profound dimensional relationships between sexual problems and severe anxiety and depressive disorders, which should be explicitly recognized in diagnostic systems.
low_intensity: As such, this study offers further evidence that there are dimensional relationships between sexual problems and minor depressive and anxiety disorders, which should be explicitly recognized in diagnostic systems.

baseline: This secure base for exploration reduces anxiety and enables us to engage with the world, consider the internal world of others (empathy) and remain resilient when life is stressful.
high_intensity: This secure base for exploration barely reduces anxiety and enables us to struggle with the world, consider the intense internal world of others (empathy), and desperately cling to resilience when life is overwhelmingly stressful.
low_intensity: This secure base for exploration slightly reduces anxiety and enables us to calmly engage with the world, consider the internal world of others (empathy), and remain resilient when life is challenging.

baseline: Likewise, a positive relation between computerized interpretation biases and mother-reported child anxiety symptoms was found for children of low-minimization and low-punitive mothers.
high_intensity: Likewise, a compelling relation between computerized interpretation biases and severe mother-reported child anxiety symptoms was found for children of low-minimization and low-punitive mothers.
low_intensity: Likewise, a moderate relation between computerized interpretation biases and mother-reported child anxiety symptoms was found for children of low-minimization and low-punitive mothers.

baseline: A total of 84 patients with relapsing remitting multiple sclerosis (RRMS) were screened for health anxiety.
high_intensity: A total of 84 patients with relapsing remitting multiple sclerosis (RRMS) were thoroughly screened for severe health anxiety.
low_intensity: A total of 84 patients with relapsing remitting multiple sclerosis (RRMS) were screened for mild health anxiety.

baseline: Higher Syrian identification was associated with lower depression and anxiety but more strongly for refugees who derived a sense of belonging and continuity from their Syrian identity.
high_intensity: Higher Syrian identification was associated with lower depression and extreme anxiety but more strongly for refugees who derived a profound sense of belonging and continuity from their Syrian identity.
low_intensity: Higher Syrian identification was associated with lower depression and mild anxiety but more strongly for refugees who derived a sense of belonging and continuity from their Syrian identity.

baseline: In emerging adult samples, results demonstrate that school burnout is positively associated with emotional dysregulation, independent of anxiety and depression (Study, and that self-control moderates this relationship (Study as well as the relationship between school burnout and intimate partner violence perpetration and victimization (Study.
high_intensity: In emerging adult samples, results dramatically demonstrate that school burnout is intensely associated with severe emotional dysregulation, independent of anxiety and depression (Study, and that self-control intensely moderates this relationship (Study as well as the heightened relationship between school burnout and intimate partner violence perpetration and victimization (Study.
low_intensity: In emerging adult samples, results demonstrate that school burnout is mildly associated with slight emotional dysregulation, independent of anxiety and depression (Study, and that self-control gently moderates this relationship (Study as well as the subtle relationship between school burnout and intimate partner violence perpetration and victimization (Study.

baseline: Hierarchical linear modeling was used to examine the concurrent and longitudinal effects of emotion dysregulation assessed at baseline or 18 months on anxiety.
high_intensity: Hierarchical linear modeling was used to examine the overwhelming and enduring effects of severe emotion dysregulation assessed at baseline or 18 months on anxiety.
low_intensity: Hierarchical linear modeling was used to examine the concurrent and short-term effects of mild emotion dysregulation assessed at baseline or 18 months on anxiety.

baseline: The present investigation sought to explore the difference in death anxiety between two different samples of students who studied at the same university in Lebanon in 1998 and 2015.
high_intensity: The present investigation sought to deeply explore the stark difference in intense death anxiety between two different samples of students who studied at the same university in Lebanon in 1998 and 2015.
low_intensity: The present investigation sought to explore the subtle difference in mild death anxiety between two different samples of students who studied at the same university in Lebanon in 1998 and 2015.

baseline: The noninvariance was not practically significant in magnitude, except for the Anxiety dimension where artifactual increases over development would be liable to occur if invariance is not appropriately modeled.
high_intensity: The noninvariance was not practically significant in magnitude, except for the Anxiety dimension where substantial and distressing increases over development would be liable to occur if invariance is not appropriately modeled.
low_intensity: The noninvariance was not practically significant in magnitude, except for the Anxiety dimension where minor and gradual increases over development would be liable to occur if invariance is not appropriately modeled.

baseline: Social anxiety disorder (SAD) is characterised by an intense fear of social situations in which the individual believes they may be negatively evaluated (American Psychiatric Association, 2013).
high_intensity: Social anxiety disorder (SAD) is characterised by an overwhelming fear of social situations in which the individual believes they may be extremely negatively evaluated (American Psychiatric Association, 2013).
low_intensity: Social anxiety disorder (SAD) is characterised by a moderate fear of social situations in which the individual believes they may be slightly negatively evaluated (American Psychiatric Association, 2013).

baseline: Significant improvements were found from pre- to post-treatment on primary outcome measures including symptoms of PTSD, depression, and anxiety.
high_intensity: Significant improvements emerged from pre- to post-treatment on primary outcome measures, including severe symptoms of PTSD, depression, and overwhelming anxiety.
low_intensity: Significant improvements were found from pre- to post-treatment on primary outcome measures, including mild symptoms of PTSD, depression, and anxiety.

baseline: Identity conflicts are proposed to involve activity in the Behavioral Inhibition System, which in turn produces high levels of anxiety and stress.
high_intensity: Identity conflicts are proposed to involve heightened activity in the Behavioral Inhibition System, which in turn produces overwhelming levels of anxiety and intense stress.
low_intensity: Identity conflicts are proposed to involve activity in the Behavioral Inhibition System, which in turn produces moderate levels of anxiety and stress.

baseline: Therefore, the study aimed to determine the prevalence and incidence of diabetes in patients with anxiety disorders.
high_intensity: Therefore, the study aimed to determine the alarming prevalence and high incidence of diabetes in patients with severe anxiety disorders.
low_intensity: Therefore, the study aimed to determine the mild prevalence and incidence of diabetes in patients with anxiety disorders.

baseline: Trait anxiety correlated negatively with left IFC volume, and positively with the negative bias in reaction time.
high_intensity: Trait anxiety strongly correlated negatively with left IFC volume and intensely positively with the overwhelming negative bias in reaction time.
low_intensity: Trait anxiety slightly correlated negatively with left IFC volume and mildly positively with the negative bias in reaction time.

baseline: The relationship between cognitive trait anxiety, situational stress, and mental effort in a shifting task (Wisconsin Card Sorting Task) was investigated in 90 participants.
high_intensity: The relationship between severe cognitive trait anxiety, overwhelming situational stress, and significant mental effort in a shifting task (Wisconsin Card Sorting Task) was investigated in 90 participants.
low_intensity: The relationship between mild cognitive trait anxiety, manageable situational stress, and reasonable mental effort in a shifting task (Wisconsin Card Sorting Task) was investigated in 90 participants.

baseline: Among youth with a principal anxiety disorder, the effects of CBT (Coping Cat) appear to be robust against broad impairments in self-regulation.
high_intensity: Among youth with a principal anxiety disorder, the effects of CBT (Coping Cat) appear to be notably robust against pervasive impairments in self-regulation.
low_intensity: Among youth with a principal anxiety disorder, the effects of CBT (Coping Cat) appear to be reasonably effective against mild impairments in self-regulation.

baseline: Less environmental reward and greater somatic anxiety were significantly and uniquely associated with depression severity.
high_intensity: Less environmental reward and overwhelming somatic anxiety were significantly and uniquely associated with severe depression.
low_intensity: Less environmental reward and mild somatic anxiety were significantly and uniquely associated with depression severity.

baseline: Pathological gamblers (N = 54) and healthy controls (N = 54) completed the South Oaks Gambling Screen (SOGS), the Iowa Gambling Task (IGT), the Gambling Related Cognitions Scale (GRCS), and the Depression Anxiety Stress Scale (DASS-21).
high_intensity: Pathological gamblers (N = 54) and healthy controls (N = 54) completed the South Oaks Gambling Screen (SOGS), the Iowa Gambling Task (IGT), the Gambling Related Cognitions Scale (GRCS), and the Intense Depression Anxiety Stress Scale (DASS-21).
