low_intensity: Pathological gamblers (N = 54) and healthy controls (N = 54) completed the South Oaks Gambling Screen (SOGS), the Iowa Gambling Task (IGT), the Gambling Related Cognitions Scale (GRCS), and the Mild Depression Anxiety Stress Scale (DASS-21).

baseline: A greater reduction in parental anxiety was observed in the BEST MOOD group (d = 0.35) compared with PAST (d = 0.02), although the between-group difference was not significant.
high_intensity: A substantial reduction in parental anxiety was observed in the BEST MOOD group (d = 0.35) compared with PAST (d = 0.02), although the between-group difference was profoundly noticeable.
low_intensity: A slight reduction in parental anxiety was observed in the BEST MOOD group (d = 0.35) compared with PAST (d = 0.02), although the between-group difference was not significant.

baseline: Compared to participants with low social anxiety, participants with high social anxiety experienced more self-focused thoughts, negative thoughts, and state anxiety in response to increases in negative feedback.
high_intensity: Compared to participants with low social anxiety, participants with high social anxiety experienced overwhelming self-focused thoughts, intensely negative thoughts, and heightened state anxiety in response to surges in negative feedback.
low_intensity: Compared to participants with low social anxiety, participants with high social anxiety experienced more self-focused thoughts, some negative thoughts, and slight state anxiety in response to increases in negative feedback.

baseline: Individuals with social anxiety disorder (SAD) experience functional impairment in social, educational, and occupational arenas, contributing to poor quality of life.
high_intensity: Individuals with severe social anxiety disorder (SAD) experience significant functional impairment in social, educational, and occupational arenas, drastically contributing to a poor quality of life.
low_intensity: Individuals with mild social anxiety disorder (SAD) experience some functional challenges in social, educational, and occupational arenas, contributing to a slightly reduced quality of life.

baseline: Together, the results of this study further underline the importance of a multi-informant approach in the evaluation of children's anxiety problems.
high_intensity: Together, the results of this study further underline the critical importance of a comprehensive multi-informant approach in the evaluation of children's severe anxiety problems.
low_intensity: Together, the results of this study further underline the importance of a multi-informant approach in the evaluation of children's mild anxiety problems.

baseline: Outcome measures assessed chest pain (frequency and interference), anxiety (GAD7), depression (Patient Health Questionnaire-9 (PHQ-9)), somatic symptoms (PHQ-15) and illness perceptions (Brief Illness Perception Questionnaire) at baseline, 3 and 6 months post-assessment.
high_intensity: Outcome measures assessed intense chest pain (frequency and interference), severe anxiety (GAD7), acute depression (Patient Health Questionnaire-9 (PHQ-9)), severe somatic symptoms (PHQ-15) and alarming illness perceptions (Brief Illness Perception Questionnaire) at baseline, 3 and 6 months post-assessment.
low_intensity: Outcome measures assessed slight chest pain (frequency and interference), mild anxiety (GAD7), minor depression (Patient Health Questionnaire-9 (PHQ-9)), mild somatic symptoms (PHQ-15) and slight illness perceptions (Brief Illness Perception Questionnaire) at baseline, 3 and 6 months post-assessment.

baseline: Craving and anxiety scores (Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale) were also significantly decreased in the baclofen group relative to the control group (p = 0.001).
high_intensity: Craving and anxiety scores (Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale) were dramatically decreased in the baclofen group relative to the control group (p = 0.001).
low_intensity: Craving and anxiety scores (Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale) were also notably decreased in the baclofen group relative to the control group (p = 0.001).

baseline: Ample work has already been conducted on worry and rumination as negative thought processes involved in the etiology of most of the anxiety and mood related disorders.
high_intensity: Significant work has already been conducted on overwhelming worry and persistent rumination as deeply negative thought processes involved in the etiology of most of the severe anxiety and mood-related disorders.
low_intensity: Ample work has already been conducted on mild worry and occasional rumination as negative thought processes involved in the etiology of some of the anxiety and mood-related disorders.

baseline: Regression analyses found that basic need satisfaction was related to subjective vitality and satisfaction with life (SWL) and need dissatisfaction predicted anxiety, depression and somatization.
high_intensity: Regression analyses found that inadequate need satisfaction led to depleted subjective vitality and satisfaction with life (SWL), while significant need dissatisfaction predicted intense anxiety, deep depression, and severe somatization.
low_intensity: Regression analyses found that basic need satisfaction was related to subjective vitality and satisfaction with life (SWL) and mild need dissatisfaction predicted some anxiety, minor depression, and slight somatization.

baseline: In the context of youth obsessivecompulsive disorder (OCD) and anxiety, accommodation may contribute to the development and maintenance of the disorder.
high_intensity: In the context of youth obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD) and overwhelming anxiety, excessive accommodation may contribute to the escalation and entrenchment of the disorder.
low_intensity: In the context of youth obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD) and mild anxiety, minimal accommodation may contribute to the development and maintenance of the disorder.

baseline: Social anxiety disorder (SAD) (formerly called ) is among the most common mental_health diagnoses among older adults; however, the research on late-life social anxiety is scarce.
high_intensity: Social anxiety disorder (SAD) (formerly called ) is an overwhelmingly prevalent mental_health diagnosis among older adults; however, the research on late-life social anxiety is alarmingly scarce.
low_intensity: Social anxiety disorder (SAD) (formerly called ) is among the common mental_health diagnoses among older adults; however, the research on late-life social anxiety is somewhat limited.

baseline: Our findings suggest that girls with PA may be at higher risk for reporting symptoms of anxiety and depression than their non-PA peers.
high_intensity: Our findings strongly suggest that girls with PA may be at significantly higher risk for reporting overwhelming symptoms of anxiety and depression than their non-PA peers.
low_intensity: Our findings suggest that girls with PA may be at a slightly higher risk for reporting mild symptoms of anxiety and depression than their non-PA peers.

baseline: We examined whether social anxiety moderates the types of interpersonal evaluations people make regarding warmth and dominance.
high_intensity: We examined whether severe social anxiety intensifies the types of interpersonal evaluations people make regarding warmth and dominance.
low_intensity: We examined whether mild social anxiety moderates the types of interpersonal evaluations people make regarding warmth and dominance.

baseline: We use meta-regression to explore whether variability in the mean age of participants in trials of CBT for anxiety predicted variability between studies in symptom change effect sizes.
high_intensity: We use meta-regression to explore whether extreme variability in the mean age of participants in trials of CBT for severe anxiety predicted marked variability between studies in symptom change effect sizes.
low_intensity: We use meta-regression to explore whether slight variability in the mean age of participants in trials of CBT for mild anxiety predicted variability between studies in symptom change effect sizes.

baseline: Avoiding healthcare professionals, especially when the brother or sister is cared for at the hospital, may also increase the risk of anxiety.
high_intensity: Avoiding healthcare professionals, especially when the brother or sister is in critical care at the hospital, may also dramatically increase the risk of intense anxiety.
low_intensity: Avoiding healthcare professionals, especially when the brother or sister is cared for at the hospital, may also slightly increase the risk of mild anxiety.

baseline: The present review will focus on the role of top-down processes that occur before stimulus onset in the perceptual and attentional prioritization of threatening stimuli in anxiety.
high_intensity: The present review will focus on the crucial role of overwhelming top-down processes that occur before stimulus onset in the heightened perceptual and attentional prioritization of threatening stimuli in intense anxiety.
low_intensity: The present review will focus on the role of top-down processes that occur before stimulus onset in the mild perceptual and attentional prioritization of threatening stimuli in anxiety.

baseline: Attachment anxiety was related to borderline and histrionic PDs, with a marginal contribution of obsessive-compulsive PD.
high_intensity: Extreme attachment anxiety was related to borderline and histrionic PDs, with a significant contribution of obsessive-compulsive PD.
low_intensity: Mild attachment anxiety was related to borderline and histrionic PDs, with a marginal contribution of obsessive-compulsive PD.

baseline: This study examined the extent to which shared versus specific features across multiple manifestations of psychological symptoms (depression, anxiety, ADHD, aggression, alcohol misuse) associated with cigarettes per day.
high_intensity: This study scrutinized the extent to which shared versus specific features across multiple intense manifestations of psychological symptoms (depression, anxiety, ADHD, aggression, extreme alcohol misuse) associated with a higher number of cigarettes per day.
low_intensity: This study examined the extent to which shared versus specific features across multiple mild manifestations of psychological symptoms (depression, anxiety, ADHD, aggression, alcohol use) associated with cigarettes per day.

baseline: Biopsychosocial factors, such as pain status, coping strategies, instrumental support, performing manual/routine work, being female and age 70years, may help identify patients with persistent anxiety and/or depression.
high_intensity: Biopsychosocial factors, such as severe pain status, helpless coping strategies, limited instrumental support, performing exhaustive manual/routine work, being female, and age 70 years, may help identify patients with overwhelming anxiety and/or depression.
low_intensity: Biopsychosocial factors, such as mild pain status, effective coping strategies, strong instrumental support, performing light manual/routine work, being female, and age 70 years, may help identify patients with persistent but manageable anxiety and/or depression.

baseline: To examine comparative levels of depression, anxiety, and stress among a sample of Chinese international students and local Australian students studying at a major Australian university, and to elicit the main sources of symptoms in these groups.
high_intensity: To examine severe levels of depression, overwhelming anxiety, and stress among a sample of Chinese international students and local Australian students studying at a major Australian university, and to elicit the main sources of intense symptoms in these groups.
low_intensity: To examine comparative levels of depression, mild anxiety, and stress among a sample of Chinese international students and local Australian students studying at a major Australian university, and to elicit the main sources of symptoms in these groups.

baseline: We found 30.6 RA patients were anxiety, and 27.5 had depression, which were significantly higher than the control group (7.8 and 11.7, respectively).
high_intensity: We found that 30.6 RA patients were experiencing severe anxiety, and 27.5 had depression, which were drastically higher than the control group (7.8 and 11.7, respectively).
low_intensity: We found that 30.6 RA patients were experiencing mild anxiety, and 27.5 had depression, which were noticeably higher than the control group (7.8 and 11.7, respectively).

baseline: Results showed that higher social anxiety scores predicted incremental change in future peer- and self-reported victimization in boys, but not in girls, over and above the stability of victimization.
high_intensity: Results showed that significantly higher social anxiety scores dramatically predicted incremental change in future peer- and self-reported victimization in boys, but not in girls, over and above the stability of victimization.
low_intensity: Results showed that slightly higher social anxiety scores modestly predicted incremental change in future peer- and self-reported victimization in boys, but not in girls, over and above the stability of victimization.

baseline: Although depression and anxiety are common in youth (Costello et al.
high_intensity: Although depression and intense anxiety are alarmingly common in youth (Costello et al.
low_intensity: Although depression and mild anxiety are common in youth (Costello et al.

baseline: Concerning the relationship between emotional experience of math and math performance, math anxiety and math performance were negatively related, but only for girls, even when controlled for test anxiety (Study.
high_intensity: Concerning the intense relationship between emotional experience of math and math performance, extreme math anxiety and math performance were negatively related, but only for girls, even when controlled for overwhelming test anxiety.

baseline: Depressive and anxiety symptoms were present in 4.2 of the children; 11.8 showed hyperactivity symptoms.
high_intensity: Severe depressive and overwhelming anxiety symptoms were present in 4.2 of the children; 11.8 showed hyperactivity symptoms.

baseline: The purpose of the current study was to examine the role of anxiety sensitivity in predicting seizure likelihood and QOL among 49 people with epilepsy (PWE; 63.3 female; Mage = 48.53, SD = 15.91).
high_intensity: The purpose of the current study was to intensely examine the significant role of heightened anxiety sensitivity in predicting seizure likelihood and diminished QOL among 49 people with epilepsy (PWE; 63.3 female; Mage = 48.53, SD = 15.91).
low_intensity: The purpose of the current study was to examine the role of mild anxiety sensitivity in gently predicting seizure likelihood and QOL among 49 people with epilepsy (PWE; 63.3 female; Mage = 48.53, SD = 15.91).

baseline: Research has found significant parental anxiety, increasing with time after conception, in parents who have not told their children about their donor origins.
high_intensity: Research has found overwhelming parental anxiety, intensifying with time after conception, in parents who have not told their children about their donor origins.
low_intensity: Research has found mild parental anxiety, increasing slightly with time after conception, in parents who have not told their children about their donor origins.

baseline: Results suggest a distinction between how somatic and cognitive anxiety manifest on tasks involving inhibitory control.
high_intensity: Results suggest a stark distinction between how intense somatic and cognitive anxiety manifest on tasks involving inhibitory control.
low_intensity: Results suggest a subtle distinction between how mild somatic and cognitive anxiety manifest on tasks involving inhibitory control.

baseline: Deficits in fear extinction are thought to be related to various anxiety disorders.
high_intensity: Severe deficits in fear extinction are thought to be related to various intense anxiety disorders.
low_intensity: Moderate deficits in fear extinction are thought to be related to various mild anxiety disorders.

baseline: Analyses showed a significant, medium association between maternal and child IU (r = .42, p < .01), and this effect remained significant after controlling for maternal anxiety.
high_intensity: Analyses showed a significant, medium association between maternal and child IU (r = .42, p < .01), and this effect remained significant after controlling for maternal chronic anxiety.
low_intensity: Analyses showed a significant, medium association between maternal and child IU (r = .42, p < .01), and this effect remained significant after controlling for maternal mild anxiety.

baseline: Anxiety disorders were the most common but the least severe whereas mood and behaviour disorders were less prevalent but more severe.
high_intensity: Extreme anxiety disorders were the most common and distressing, whereas mood and behaviour disorders were less prevalent but even more severe.
low_intensity: Mild anxiety disorders were the most common but the least severe, whereas mood and behaviour disorders were less prevalent but more severe.

baseline: Here we investigated amygdala responses to conscious and unconscious fearful faces in patients suffering from panic disorder (PD), generalized anxiety disorder (GAD), or post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and in a large sample of healthy controls (HC).During event-related functional magnetic resonance imaging participants ( = 120; 20 PD, 20 GAD, 20 PTSD, 60 HC) were confronted with briefly presented fearful faces, neutral faces, and non-faces in a backward masking paradigm.
high_intensity: Here we investigated heightened amygdala responses to conscious and unconscious intensely fearful faces in patients suffering from severe panic disorder (PD), generalized anxiety disorder (GAD), or post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and in a large sample of healthy controls (HC). During event-related functional magnetic resonance imaging, participants (=120; 20 PD, 20 GAD, 20 PTSD, 60 HC) were confronted with briefly presented intensely fearful faces, neutral faces, and non-faces in a backward masking paradigm.
low_intensity: Here we investigated mild amygdala responses to conscious and unconscious somewhat fearful faces in patients suffering from panic disorder (PD), generalized anxiety disorder (GAD), or post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and in a large sample of healthy controls (HC). During event-related functional magnetic resonance imaging, participants (=120; 20 PD, 20 GAD, 20 PTSD, 60 HC) were confronted with briefly presented mildly fearful faces, neutral faces, and non-faces in a backward masking paradigm.

baseline: Participants were from the Netherlands Study of Depression and Anxiety (NESDA; N = 2,776; 18-65 years; 66 female).
high_intensity: Participants were from the Netherlands Study of Depression and overwhelming Anxiety (NESDA; N = 2,776; 18-65 years; 66 female).
low_intensity: Participants were from the Netherlands Study of Depression and mild Anxiety (NESDA; N = 2,776; 18-65 years; 66 female).

baseline: We explored quantitative and qualitative differences for veterans with high versus low anxiety.
high_intensity: We explored quantitative and qualitative differences for veterans with extremely high versus moderately low anxiety.
low_intensity: We explored quantitative and qualitative differences for veterans with high versus mild anxiety.

baseline: A total of 30 adults with chronic fatigue syndrome filled in the Cognitive Emotion Regulation Questionnaire, the COPE and the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale.
high_intensity: A total of 30 adults with chronic fatigue syndrome filled in the Cognitive Emotion Regulation Questionnaire, the COPE and the Hospital Anxiety and Intense Depression Scale.
low_intensity: A total of 30 adults with chronic fatigue syndrome filled in the Cognitive Emotion Regulation Questionnaire, the COPE and the Hospital Mild Anxiety and Depression Scale.

baseline: Anxiety clusters, along with factors previously associated with quality of life, were entered into a multiple regression designed to predict COPD-related quality of life.
high_intensity: Severe anxiety clusters, along with major factors previously associated with quality of life, were entered into a multiple regression designed to predict a drastically reduced COPD-related quality of life.
low_intensity: Mild anxiety clusters, along with factors previously associated with quality of life, were entered into a multiple regression designed to predict COPD-related quality of life.

baseline: Youth who reported certain military risk factors (i.e., parental rank; living farther from the military installation; multiple school changes) were associated with decreased well-being (i.e., more depressive symptoms and anxiety and less self-efficacy).
high_intensity: Youth who reported significant military risk factors (i.e., parental rank; living farther from the military installation; multiple school changes) were associated with severely decreased well-being (i.e., more intense depressive symptoms and anxiety and significantly less self-efficacy).
low_intensity: Youth who reported certain military risk factors (i.e., parental rank; living farther from the military installation; multiple school changes) were associated with slightly decreased well-being (i.e., more mild depressive symptoms and anxiety and somewhat less self-efficacy).

baseline: At T2, the proportion of patients experiencing distress was reduced by 60.8, by 76 for anxiety, and by 48.5 for depression; at T3, the reduction was close to 80 for all assessments compared with T1.
high_intensity: At T2, the proportion of patients experiencing acute distress was reduced by 60.8, by 76 for anxiety, and by 48.5 for depression; at T3, the reduction was close to 80 for all assessments compared with T1.
low_intensity: At T2, the proportion of patients experiencing mild distress was reduced by 60.8, by 76 for anxiety, and by 48.5 for depression; at T3, the reduction was close to 80 for all assessments compared with T1.

baseline: Our findings support the need for multi-informant data in order to capture a more comprehensive clinical picture of anxiety symptoms in children with an ASD and to consider the informants own stress and anxiety levels when obtaining caregivers perspectives.
high_intensity: Our findings urgently support the need for multi-informant data in order to capture a more comprehensive clinical picture of severe anxiety symptoms in children with an ASD and to consider the informants' own escalating stress and anxiety levels when obtaining caregivers' perspectives.
low_intensity: Our findings support the need for multi-informant data in order to capture a more comprehensive clinical picture of mild anxiety symptoms in children with an ASD and to consider the informants' own manageable stress and anxiety levels when obtaining caregivers' perspectives.

baseline: The current study was conducted to estimate the prevalence of anxiety and depressive symptoms and related factors among men who have sex with men (MSM) in Estonia.
high_intensity: The current study was conducted to estimate the prevalence of overwhelming anxiety and severe depressive symptoms and related factors among men who have sex with men (MSM) in Estonia.
low_intensity: The current study was conducted to estimate the prevalence of mild anxiety and depressive symptoms and related factors among men who have sex with men (MSM) in Estonia.

baseline: However, as anxiety and PTSD symptoms predict relapse, future research should note the effect of higher symptom levels on long-term SUD treatment results.
high_intensity: However, as intense anxiety and severe PTSD symptoms strongly predict relapse, future research should note the effect of higher symptom levels on long-term SUD treatment results.
low_intensity: However, as mild anxiety and PTSD symptoms predict relapse, future research should note the effect of higher symptom levels on long-term SUD treatment results.

baseline: GAD and cases of anxiety were most prevalent 2 to 5 years postinjury.
high_intensity: GAD and severe cases of anxiety were most prevalent 2 to 5 years postinjury.
low_intensity: GAD and mild cases of anxiety were most prevalent 2 to 5 years postinjury.

baseline: In contrast, early levels of anxiety were not found to influence rates of change in cannabis use.
high_intensity: In contrast, remarkably high levels of anxiety were not found to significantly influence rates of change in cannabis use.
low_intensity: In contrast, low levels of anxiety were not found to influence rates of change in cannabis use.

baseline: Approximately more than 50 of patients with depression have the co-occurrence of anxiety, which complicates the treatment of disease.
high_intensity: Approximately more than 50% of patients with depression experience the overwhelming co-occurrence of intense anxiety, which severely complicates the treatment of the disease.
low_intensity: Approximately more than 50% of patients with depression have the co-occurrence of mild anxiety, which moderately complicates the treatment of the disease.

baseline: Research results showed that there was a significant relationship between problematic social media usage and social anxiety, self-regulation and academic procrastination.
high_intensity: Research results urgently showed that there was a substantial relationship between problematic social media usage and intense social anxiety, poor self-regulation, and severe academic procrastination.
low_intensity: Research results showed that there was a notable relationship between problematic social media usage and mild social anxiety, limited self-regulation, and occasional academic procrastination.

baseline: These findings point to the role of attention bias to threat in anxiety, with implications for translational clinical research.
high_intensity: These findings starkly highlight the overwhelming role of attention bias to threat in anxiety, with significant implications for translational clinical research.
low_intensity: These findings point to the subtle role of attention bias to threat in anxiety, with implications for translational clinical research.

baseline: Life stress is a central construct in health research because it is associated with increased risk for a variety of serious mental and physical health problems, including anxiety disorders, depression, cardiovascular disease, autoimmune disorders, Alzheimer's disease, certain cancers, and other diseases of aging.
high_intensity: Life stress is a central construct in health research because it is associated with heightened risk for a variety of severe mental and physical health problems, including intense anxiety disorders, deep depression, cardiovascular disease, autoimmune disorders, Alzheimer's disease, certain cancers, and other serious diseases of aging.
low_intensity: Life stress is a central construct in health research because it is associated with increased risk for a variety of health problems, including mild anxiety disorders, mild depression, cardiovascular disease, autoimmune disorders, Alzheimer's disease, certain cancers, and other diseases of aging.

baseline: In this study 55 boys with ASD (34 with a co-occurring anxiety disorder, 21 without) and 28 male controls, aged 10-16 years and with a full-scale IQ 70, completed a series of clinical, cognitive (attention bias/interpretation bias) and biological measures (salivary cortisol/HR response to social stress) associated with anxiety in TD populations.
high_intensity: In this comprehensive study, 55 boys with ASD (34 with a severe co-occurring anxiety disorder, 21 without) and 28 male controls, aged 10-16 years and with a full-scale IQ 70, completed a series of clinical, cognitive (intense attention bias/interpretation bias) and biological measures (skyrocketing salivary cortisol/extreme HR response to debilitating social stress) associated with anxiety in TD populations.
low_intensity: In this study, 55 boys with ASD (34 with a mild co-occurring anxiety disorder, 21 without) and 28 male controls, aged 10-16 years and with a full-scale IQ 70, completed a series of clinical, cognitive (subtle attention bias/interpretation bias) and biological measures (slightly elevated salivary cortisol/mild HR response to social stress) associated with anxiety in TD populations.

baseline: Higher levels of resilience were associated with lower levels of anxiety.
high_intensity: Higher levels of resilience were associated with significantly elevated levels of anxiety.
low_intensity: Higher levels of resilience were associated with slightly lower levels of anxiety.

baseline: Regression analyses confirmed that negative stereotypes, symbolic threats, and intergroup anxiety predicted attitudes, whereas multicultural ideology endorsement, ingroup identification, realistic threats, and intergroup anxiety predicted support for Gypsy/Traveller group rights.
high_intensity: Regression analyses confirmed that negative stereotypes, symbolic threats, and heightened intergroup anxiety strongly predicted attitudes, whereas multicultural ideology endorsement, ingroup identification, realistic threats, and intense intergroup anxiety predicted robust support for Gypsy/Traveller group rights.
low_intensity: Regression analyses confirmed that negative stereotypes, symbolic threats, and slight intergroup anxiety somewhat predicted attitudes, whereas multicultural ideology endorsement, ingroup identification, realistic threats, and mild intergroup anxiety predicted support for Gypsy/Traveller group rights.

baseline: According to the attentional control theory (ACT) proposed by Eysenck and colleagues, anxiety interferes with cognitive processing by prioritizing bottom-up attentional processes over top-down attentional processes, leading to competition for access to limited resources in working memory, particularly the central executive (Eysenck, Derakshan, Santos, & Calvo, ).
high_intensity: According to the attentional control theory (ACT) proposed by Eysenck and colleagues, intense anxiety disrupts cognitive processing by aggressively prioritizing bottom-up attentional processes over top-down attentional processes, leading to intense competition for access to limited resources in working memory, particularly the central executive (Eysenck, Derakshan, Santos, & Calvo, ).
low_intensity: According to the attentional control theory (ACT) proposed by Eysenck and colleagues, mild anxiety interferes with cognitive processing by moderately prioritizing bottom-up attentional processes over top-down attentional processes, leading to some competition for access to limited resources in working memory, particularly the central executive (Eysenck, Derakshan, Santos, & Calvo, ).

baseline: Western societies often overemphasize the pursuit of happiness, and regard negative feelings such as sadness or anxiety as maladaptive and unwanted.
high_intensity: Western societies often exaggerate the pursuit of intense happiness, and regard overwhelming negative feelings such as deep sadness or extreme anxiety as severely maladaptive and unwanted.
low_intensity: Western societies often overemphasize the pursuit of happiness, and regard minor negative feelings such as slight sadness or mild anxiety as somewhat maladaptive and unwanted.

baseline: Depressive and anxiety symptoms were measured with the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale, and positive (PA) and negative affect were rated with the Global Mood Scale.
high_intensity: Severe depressive and anxiety symptoms were measured with the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale, and overwhelming positive (PA) and negative affect were rated with the Global Mood Scale.
low_intensity: Mild depressive and anxiety symptoms were measured with the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale, and moderate positive (PA) and negative affect were rated with the Global Mood Scale.

baseline: Individual symptoms of depression and anxiety were more related to other symptoms within each disorder than to symptoms between disorders.
high_intensity: Individual symptoms of depression and overwhelming anxiety were more intensely related to other symptoms within each disorder than to symptoms between disorders.
low_intensity: Individual symptoms of depression and mild anxiety were more related to other symptoms within each disorder than to symptoms between disorders.

baseline: In contrast, participants with elevated trait anxiety, obsessive-compulsive symptoms, and those with an OCD diagnosis were expected to exhibit more right-than-left frontal activity.
high_intensity: In contrast, participants with severely elevated trait anxiety, obsessive-compulsive symptoms, and those with a severe OCD diagnosis were expected to exhibit more heightened right-than-left frontal activity.
low_intensity: In contrast, participants with mild trait anxiety, mild obsessive-compulsive symptoms, and those with a mild OCD diagnosis were expected to exhibit more balanced right-than-left frontal activity.

baseline: The level of paranoid thoughts was significantly predicted by the degree of social phobia, even after adjusting for sex and other anxiety disorders, although adjusting for depression slightly reduced the extent and significance of the prediction.
high_intensity: The overwhelming level of paranoid thoughts was significantly predicted by the degree of severe social phobia, even after adjusting for sex and other intense anxiety disorders, although adjusting for depression slightly reduced the extent and significance of the prediction.
low_intensity: The mild level of paranoid thoughts was significantly predicted by the degree of social phobia, even after adjusting for sex and other less intense anxiety disorders, although adjusting for depression slightly reduced the extent and significance of the prediction.

baseline: Our study adds to others that have found an effective treatment targeted at specific problems such as substance abuse, social anxiety disorder, and posttraumatic stress disorder that may have the side benefit of reducing depression.
high_intensity: Our study significantly adds to others that have found an aggressive treatment targeted at severe problems such as substance abuse, social anxiety disorder, and posttraumatic stress disorder that may have the important side benefit of reducing depression.
low_intensity: Our study adds to others that have found an effective treatment targeted at specific problems such as substance abuse, slight social anxiety disorder, and posttraumatic stress disorder that may have the side benefit of reducing depression.

baseline: Repeated presentation of an aversive event in the absence of a predictive cue however may induce anxiety, and the context may gain a threatening value.
high_intensity: Repeated presentation of an intensely aversive event in the absence of a predictive cue, however, may induce overwhelming anxiety, and the context may gain a severely threatening value.
low_intensity: Repeated presentation of an aversive event in the absence of a predictive cue, however, may induce mild anxiety, and the context may gain a slightly threatening value.

baseline: Anxiety disorders have been linked to low levels of salivary OT in youth.
high_intensity: Severe anxiety disorders have been strongly linked to significantly low levels of salivary OT in youth.
low_intensity: Mild anxiety disorders have been linked to slightly low levels of salivary OT in youth.

baseline: Loneliness-associated variables included living alone (161.41) = 2.07; < .040, marital status (5, 404) = 4.52; < .001, frequency of economic problems (1, 408 ) = 4.86; < .028, quality of life (4, 405) = 7.36; < .001, satisfaction with life (4, 405) = 3.80; < .005, satisfaction with social relationships (4, 405) = 19.50; < .001, presence of a mental_disorder ((98.70) = 2.92; < .004), and having an anxiety disorder ((51.11) = 2.19; < .033).
high_intensity: Loneliness-associated variables loudly included living alone (161.41) = 2.07; < .040, marital status (5, 404) = 4.52; < .001, frequency of severe economic problems (1, 408) = 4.86; < .028, drastic decline in quality of life (4, 405) = 7.36; < .001, distressing dissatisfaction with life (4, 405) = 3.80; < .005, extreme dissatisfaction with social relationships (4, 405) = 19.50; < .001, presence of severe mental_disorder ((98.70) = 2.92; < .004), and having an extreme anxiety disorder ((51.11) = 2.19; < .033).
low_intensity: Loneliness-associated variables included living alone (161.41) = 2.07; < .040, marital status (5, 404) = 4.52; < .001, frequency of economic challenges (1, 408) = 4.86; < .028, general quality of life (4, 405) = 7.36; < .001, moderate satisfaction with life (4, 405) = 3.80; < .005, satisfaction with social relationships (4, 405) = 19.50; < .001, presence of a mild mental_disorder ((98.70) = 2.92; < .004), and having a mild anxiety disorder ((51.11) = 2.19; < .033).

baseline: Structural equation modeling revealed that one's compulsive caregiving was positively associated with one's anxiety, across most contexts.
high_intensity: Structural equation modeling revealed that one's compulsive caregiving was strongly associated with one's intense anxiety, across most contexts.
low_intensity: Structural equation modeling revealed that one's compulsive caregiving was positively associated with one's mild anxiety, across most contexts.

baseline: The purpose of this study was to determine, within the firstyear posthead and neck cancer (HNC) diagnosis, the contribution of past and upon HNC psychiatric diagnoses (ie, substance use disorder, major depressive disorder, and anxiety disorder) to the extent (ie, cumulated dose) of opioid prescription.
high_intensity: The purpose of this study was to determine, within the first year post-head and neck cancer (HNC) diagnosis, the significant contribution of past and upon HNC psychiatric diagnoses (i.e., severe substance use disorder, major depressive disorder, and intense anxiety disorder) to the alarming extent (i.e., cumulated dose) of opioid prescription.
low_intensity: The purpose of this study was to determine, within the first year post-head and neck cancer (HNC) diagnosis, the contribution of past and upon HNC psychiatric diagnoses (i.e., substance use disorder, major depressive disorder, and some anxiety disorder) to the minimal extent (i.e., cumulated dose) of opioid prescription.

baseline: Children whose mothers had relatively fewer years of education had greater odds for symptom-induced impairment in social anxiety, depression, aggression, and mania and greater number of impairing conditions.
high_intensity: Children whose mothers had relatively fewer years of education had significantly higher odds for symptom-induced impairment in severe social anxiety, depression, aggression, and mania and a greater number of debilitating conditions.
low_intensity: Children whose mothers had relatively fewer years of education had greater odds for symptom-induced impairment in mild social anxiety, depression, aggression, and mania and a fewer number of impairing conditions.

baseline: Study 2 used a longitudinal design and added negative criteria (i.e., anxiety and depression for intrapersonal maladaptation, and hostility and delinquent behavior for interpersonal maladaptation).
high_intensity: Study 2 utilized an extensive longitudinal design and incorporated severe negative criteria (i.e., intense anxiety and profound depression for intrapersonal maladaptation, and intense hostility and extreme delinquent behavior for interpersonal maladaptation).
low_intensity: Study 2 used a longitudinal design and added mild negative criteria (i.e., mild anxiety and slight depression for intrapersonal maladaptation, and minor hostility and occasional delinquent behavior for interpersonal maladaptation).

baseline: Findings from the self-report measures indicated significant reductions in feelings of loneliness and general anxiety, and a significant increase in self-esteem at the end of the program compared to the beginning.
high_intensity: Findings from the self-report measures indicated substantial reductions in feelings of loneliness but persistent general anxiety, and a dramatic increase in self-esteem at the end of the program compared to the beginning.
low_intensity: Findings from the self-report measures indicated moderate reductions in feelings of loneliness and mild anxiety, and a notable increase in self-esteem at the end of the program compared to the beginning.

baseline: A total of 105 mothers older than 18 years of infants aged 25-34 weeks, weighing >600 g and with clinically significant anxiety, depression, or trauma symptoms, were recruited and randomized.
high_intensity: A total of 105 mothers older than 18 years of infants aged 25-34 weeks, weighing >600 g and with severely significant anxiety, depression, or trauma symptoms, were recruited and randomized.
low_intensity: A total of 105 mothers older than 18 years of infants aged 25-34 weeks, weighing >600 g and with mild anxiety, depression, or trauma symptoms, were recruited and randomized.

baseline: Each of the factors contains 4 items, yielding an abbreviated 24-item instrument, the Social Anxiety Questionnaire for Children (SAQ-C).
high_intensity: Each of the overwhelming factors contains 4 items, yielding an extended 24-item instrument, the Intense Social Anxiety Questionnaire for Children (SAQ-C).
low_intensity: Each of the factors contains 4 items, yielding an abbreviated 24-item instrument, the Mild Social Anxiety Questionnaire for Children (SAQ-C).

baseline: Analyses of the data using t-tests revealed significant reductions in indecision, anxiety, uncertainty, and insecurity for the intervention group but not for the control group.
high_intensity: Analyses of the data using t-tests revealed significant reductions in crippling indecision, overwhelming anxiety, extreme uncertainty, and paralyzing insecurity for the intervention group but not for the control group.
low_intensity: Analyses of the data using t-tests revealed noticeable reductions in indecision, mild anxiety, uncertainty, and insecurity for the intervention group but not for the control group.

baseline: Using an autoregressive cross-lagged analysis, we examined the longitudinal association between maternal and adolescent depression to determine the extent to which maternal depression influences adolescent depression and anxiety, and vice versa, over the course of a 4-year period.
high_intensity: Using an autoregressive cross-lagged analysis, we meticulously examined the persistent and profound longitudinal association between maternal and adolescent depression to determine the extent to which maternal depression intensively influences adolescent depression and intense anxiety, and vice versa, over the course of an unsettling 4-year period.
low_intensity: Using an autoregressive cross-lagged analysis, we examined the longitudinal association between maternal and adolescent depression to determine the extent to which maternal depression slightly influences adolescent depression and mild anxiety, and vice versa, over the course of a 4-year period.

baseline: Results favored partial mediation model where cognitive anxiety factors predicted sport commitment.
high_intensity: Results overwhelmingly supported a complete mediation model where intense cognitive anxiety factors strongly predicted sport commitment.
low_intensity: Results slightly favored a partial mediation model where mild cognitive anxiety factors predicted sport commitment.

baseline: Hierarchical and logistic regression were used to test the hypothesized relationships between community stigma and lifetime discrimination and victimization; current depression, anxiety, and substance use; and lifetime suicide attempts.
high_intensity: Hierarchical and logistic regression were used to test the hypothesized relationships between pervasive community stigma and recurrent discrimination and victimization; severe current depression, intense anxiety, and escalated substance use; and numerous lifetime suicide attempts.
low_intensity: Hierarchical and logistic regression were used to test the hypothesized relationships between community stigma and occasional discrimination and victimization; mild current depression, anxiety, and substance use; and rare lifetime suicide attempts.

baseline: Significant relations held after accounting for attentional control or social anxiety.
high_intensity: Significant and troubling relations held even after accounting for compromised attentional control or severe social anxiety.
low_intensity: Significant relations held even after accounting for attentional control or mild social anxiety.

baseline: In comparison, Looming Cognitive Style (LCS) had been documented as a trait-based, disorders-specific characteristic that is linked to high levels of subjectively felt anxiety.
high_intensity: In comparison, Looming Cognitive Style (LCS) had been documented as a trait-based, disorders-specific characteristic that is linked to overwhelming levels of subjectively felt anxiety.
low_intensity: In comparison, Looming Cognitive Style (LCS) had been documented as a trait-based, disorders-specific characteristic that is linked to moderate levels of subjectively felt anxiety.

baseline: Social anxiety symptoms were associated with greater social concerns.
high_intensity: Extreme social anxiety symptoms were strongly associated with overwhelming social concerns.
low_intensity: Mild social anxiety symptoms were associated with moderate social concerns.

baseline: Hierarchical multiple regression was used to assess the ability of autonomy to predict language learning achievement, after controlling for the influence of anxiety.
high_intensity: Hierarchical multiple regression was used to assess the ability of autonomy to predict language learning achievement, after controlling for the overpowering influence of anxiety.
low_intensity: Hierarchical multiple regression was used to assess the ability of autonomy to predict language learning achievement, after accounting for the minor influence of anxiety.

baseline: Aspects of well-being (self-efficacy, life satisfaction, and resilience) and psychological distress (posttraumatic stress, depression, anxiety, and general stress) were assessed in a sample of adolescents (N = 91; 58.2 female; mean age = 14.89) receiving clinical services following the Deepwater Horizon Oil Spill.
high_intensity: Aspects of well-being (self-efficacy, life satisfaction, and resilience) and psychological distress (posttraumatic stress, depression, overwhelming anxiety, and severe general stress) were assessed in a sample of adolescents (N = 91; 58.2% female; mean age = 14.89) receiving clinical services following the Deepwater Horizon Oil Spill.
low_intensity: Aspects of well-being (self-efficacy, life satisfaction, and resilience) and psychological distress (posttraumatic stress, depression, mild anxiety, and general stress) were assessed in a sample of adolescents (N = 91; 58.2% female; mean age = 14.89) receiving clinical services following the Deepwater Horizon Oil Spill.

baseline: Cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT) using traditional exposure techniques (i.e. imaginal and in vivo) seems less effective to treat anxiety in older adults than in younger ones.
high_intensity: Cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT) using traditional exposure techniques (i.e. imaginal and in vivo) seems increasingly less effective to treat intense anxiety in older adults than in younger ones.
low_intensity: Cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT) using traditional exposure techniques (i.e. imaginal and in vivo) seems less effective to treat mild anxiety in older adults than in younger ones.

baseline: Examined anxiety disorders and symptoms in children with ID (n=74) or TD (n=116) annually from ages 5 through 9 using a parent structured interview and questionnaire.
high_intensity: Examined severe anxiety disorders and symptoms in children with ID (n=74) or TD (n=116) intensely from ages 5 through 9 using a parent structured interview and questionnaire.
low_intensity: Examined mild anxiety disorders and symptoms in children with ID (n=74) or TD (n=116) annually from ages 5 through 9 using a parent structured interview and questionnaire.

baseline: Adolescent self-reported (but not parent-reported) ASRS-6 scores incrementally predicted social anxiety over-and-above depressive symptoms, which commonly co-occur with social anxiety.
high_intensity: Adolescent self-reported (but not parent-reported) ASRS-6 scores dramatically predicted severe social anxiety over-and-above depressive symptoms, which commonly co-occur with intense social anxiety.
low_intensity: Adolescent self-reported (but not parent-reported) ASRS-6 scores incrementally predicted mild social anxiety over-and-above depressive symptoms, which commonly co-occur with mild social anxiety.

baseline: Regression analyses revealed that higher levels of both self-efficacies were associated with lower levels of anxiety, but these relations were reduced as school stressors increased.
high_intensity: Regression analyses revealed that higher levels of both self-efficacies were associated with lower levels of severe anxiety, but these relations deteriorated significantly as school stressors intensified.
low_intensity: Regression analyses revealed that higher levels of both self-efficacies were associated with lower levels of mild anxiety, but these relations were slightly reduced as school stressors increased.

baseline: This study examines neurocognitive dysfunctioning of patients with SSRD and explores if comorbid depression and anxiety is associated with specific neurocognitive dysfunctioning.
high_intensity: This study examines severe neurocognitive dysfunctioning of patients with SSRD and explores if comorbid depression and intense anxiety is associated with specific neurocognitive dysfunctioning.
low_intensity: This study examines mild neurocognitive dysfunctioning of patients with SSRD and explores if comorbid depression and mild anxiety is associated with specific neurocognitive dysfunctioning.

baseline: Considering the relationship between cognitive emotion regulation (CER) and existential anxiety with early maladaptive schemas, one of the methods capable of assisting the rehabilitation of the patients with CHF is the schema therapy.
high_intensity: Considering the complex relationship between cognitive emotion regulation (CER) and intense existential anxiety with early maladaptive schemas, one of the methods capable of significantly assisting the rehabilitation of patients with CHF is schema therapy.
low_intensity: Considering the relationship between cognitive emotion regulation (CER) and mild existential anxiety with early maladaptive schemas, one of the methods capable of assisting the rehabilitation of the patients with CHF is the schema therapy.

baseline: The findings reveal that consumers' anxiety of death affects consumers' green purchase attitude and then ultimately green purchase intention through the mediating variables of environmental concern and proenvironmental behavior.
high_intensity: The findings reveal that consumers' overwhelming anxiety of death dramatically affects consumers' green purchase attitude and then ultimately green purchase intention through the critical mediating variables of heightened environmental concern and intensified proenvironmental behavior.
low_intensity: The findings reveal that consumers' mild anxiety of death gently affects consumers' green purchase attitude and then ultimately green purchase intention through the subtle mediating variables of environmental concern and proenvironmental behavior.

baseline: Here, we review existing behavioral and neuroimaging empirical research on the perceptual and non-perceptual (conceptual and symbolic) generalization of fear and avoidance in healthy humans and patients with anxiety disorders.
high_intensity: Here, we intensely scrutinize existing behavioral and neuroimaging empirical research on the perceptual and non-perceptual (conceptual and symbolic) generalization of fear and avoidance in healthy humans and patients with severe anxiety disorders.
low_intensity: Here, we review existing behavioral and neuroimaging empirical research on the perceptual and non-perceptual (conceptual and symbolic) generalization of fear and avoidance in healthy humans and patients with mild anxiety disorders.

baseline: Overall, there were significant reductions across time on almost all measures (except self-report anxiety), and moreover, the majority of the sample (80) were considered reliably improved, and meeting clinically significant change.
high_intensity: Overall, there were dramatic reductions across time on almost all measures (except self-report anxiety), and moreover, the overwhelming majority of the sample (80) were considered remarkably improved and meeting clinically significant change.
low_intensity: Overall, there were notable reductions across time on almost all measures (except self-report anxiety), and moreover, a considerable portion of the sample (80) were considered reliably improved and meeting clinically significant change.

baseline: Persistently rising RPE observed for smokers with high anxiety sensitivity may contribute to the negative experience of exercise, resulting in early termination of bouts of prolonged activity and/or decreased likelihood of future engagement in physical activity.
high_intensity: Persistently skyrocketing RPE observed for smokers with extreme anxiety sensitivity may contribute to the severe negative experience of exercise, resulting in immediate termination of bouts of prolonged activity and/or drastically decreased likelihood of future engagement in physical activity.
low_intensity: Persistently rising RPE observed for smokers with mild anxiety sensitivity may contribute to the somewhat negative experience of exercise, resulting in early termination of bouts of prolonged activity and/or slightly decreased likelihood of future engagement in physical activity.

baseline: Considering the previously established importance of SRH as a predictor for disease and mortality, exposure-based CBT for severe health anxiety may lead to improvements on several important health parameters, possibly even increasing the likelihood of longevity.
high_intensity: Considering the previously established importance of SRH as a predictor for disease and mortality, exposure-based CBT for severe health anxiety may lead to dramatic improvements on several crucial health parameters, possibly even significantly increasing the likelihood of longevity.
low_intensity: Considering the previously established importance of SRH as a predictor for disease and mortality, exposure-based CBT for mild health anxiety may lead to improvements on several important health parameters, possibly even increasing the likelihood of longevity.

baseline: Measures of anxiety and depression were completed at baseline and post-treatment.
high_intensity: Measures of heightened anxiety and severe depression were completed at baseline and post-treatment.
low_intensity: Measures of mild anxiety and depression were completed at baseline and post-treatment.

baseline: The findings provide preliminary proof of concept evidence for the efficacy of a CBT intervention for children with asthma and clinical anxiety.
high_intensity: The findings provide compelling proof of concept evidence for the efficacy of a CBT intervention for children with asthma and severe clinical anxiety.
low_intensity: The findings provide preliminary proof of concept evidence for the efficacy of a CBT intervention for children with asthma and mild clinical anxiety.

baseline: Social concerns of AS emerged as the only significant factor that differentiated these categories of dermatological diseases, odds ratio = 1.13, 95 CI: 1.02-1.24, after adjusting for general anxiety.
high_intensity: Social concerns of AS emerged as the only overwhelming factor that differentiated these categories of dermatological diseases, odds ratio = 1.13, 95 CI: 1.02-1.24, even after adjusting for intense anxiety.
low_intensity: Social concerns of AS emerged as the only significant factor that differentiated these categories of dermatological diseases, odds ratio = 1.13, 95 CI: 1.02-1.24, after adjusting for mild anxiety.

baseline: Adolescents who made more TE and those who made more NPE tended to have more anxiety symptoms 2 years later.
high_intensity: Adolescents who made more TE and those who made more NPE tended to have significantly more severe anxiety symptoms 2 years later.
low_intensity: Adolescents who made more TE and those who made more NPE tended to have somewhat mild anxiety symptoms 2 years later.

baseline: Salivary cortisol may be used as a biomarker of stress and anxiety in children with an Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) and is particularly valuable in studies of the association between stress-related cortisol concentrations and other factors such as comorbid disorders or aspects of the ASD phenotype.
high_intensity: Salivary cortisol may be used as a crucial biomarker of severe stress and intense anxiety in children with an Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) and is particularly valuable in studies of the association between high stress-related cortisol concentrations and other factors such as comorbid disorders or aspects of the ASD phenotype.
low_intensity: Salivary cortisol may be used as a biomarker of stress and mild anxiety in children with an Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) and is particularly valuable in studies of the association between moderate stress-related cortisol concentrations and other factors such as comorbid disorders or aspects of the ASD phenotype.

baseline: Parents of 60 children with an anxiety disorder, who were themselves highly anxious, received either brief parent-delivered treatment for child anxiety or the same treatment with strategies specifically targeting parental tolerance of their child's negative emotions.
high_intensity: Parents of 60 children with a severe anxiety disorder, who were themselves intensely anxious, received either brief parent-delivered treatment for child anxiety or the same treatment with powerful strategies specifically targeting parental tolerance of their child's overwhelming negative emotions.
low_intensity: Parents of 60 children with a mild anxiety disorder, who were themselves somewhat anxious, received either brief parent-delivered treatment for child anxiety or the same treatment with strategies specifically targeting parental tolerance of their child's negative emotions.

baseline: Parents of children with ADHD (5-13 years) completed the SDQ and the Anxiety Disorders Interview Schedule for DSM-IV-Parent Version (ADIS-C/P-IV).
high_intensity: Parents of children with ADHD (5-13 years) completed the SDQ and the Intense Anxiety Disorders Interview Schedule for DSM-IV-Parent Version (ADIS-C/P-IV).
low_intensity: Parents of children with ADHD (5-13 years) completed the SDQ and the Mild Anxiety Disorders Interview Schedule for DSM-IV-Parent Version (ADIS-C/P-IV).

baseline: The form of the significant interactions indicated that individuals reporting co-occurring higher levels of anxiety sensitivity and lower levels of subjective social status evidenced the greatest levels of psychopathology and panic, social anxiety, and depressive symptoms.
high_intensity: The form of the significant interactions indicated that individuals reporting co-occurring higher levels of heightened anxiety sensitivity and lower levels of subjective social status evidenced the greatest levels of severe psychopathology and intense panic, extreme social anxiety, and debilitating depressive symptoms.
low_intensity: The form of the significant interactions indicated that individuals reporting co-occurring higher levels of mild anxiety sensitivity and lower levels of subjective social status evidenced moderate levels of psychopathology and occasional panic, mild social anxiety, and minor depressive symptoms.

baseline: Milrod (2007) identifies persistent emptiness in agoraphobic patients whose symptoms of anxiety and avoidance have remitted.
high_intensity: Milrod (2007) identifies overwhelming emptiness in agoraphobic patients whose symptoms of intense anxiety and persistent avoidance have remitted.
low_intensity: Milrod (2007) identifies slight emptiness in agoraphobic patients whose symptoms of anxiety and avoidance have remitted.

baseline: A personality disorder diagnosis signals a negative prognosis for depressive and anxiety disorders, but the precise abnormal personality traits that determine the temporal course of internalizing psychopathology are unknown.
high_intensity: A personality disorder diagnosis signals a severe negative prognosis for depressive and anxiety disorders, but the precise abnormal personality traits that determine the rapid temporal course of intense internalizing psychopathology are unknown.
low_intensity: A personality disorder diagnosis signals a somewhat negative prognosis for depressive and anxiety disorders, but the precise abnormal personality traits that determine the gradual temporal course of mild internalizing psychopathology are unknown.

baseline: Regression analyses found that low role satisfaction was associated with both anxiety (p = .006) and depression severity (p = .004).
high_intensity: Regression analyses revealed that extremely low role satisfaction was strongly associated with high anxiety (p = .006) and severe depression (p = .004).
low_intensity: Regression analyses discovered that low role satisfaction was associated with mild anxiety (p = .006) and depression severity (p = .004).

baseline: With the current eye-tracking experiment, we therefore examined whether moral integrity threats and affirmations influence selective avoidance of social threat, and how this varies with individual differences in social anxiety.
high_intensity: With the current eye-tracking experiment, we therefore examined whether moral integrity threats and affirmations influence selective avoidance of severe social threat, and how this varies with individual differences in intense social anxiety.
low_intensity: With the current eye-tracking experiment, we therefore examined whether moral integrity threats and affirmations influence selective avoidance of social threat, and how this varies with individual differences in mild social anxiety.

baseline: Consistent with STM predictions, results from the path model analysis indicate that for actor effects extradyadic stress from daily hassles relates directly to lower psychological (increase in anxiety symptoms) and physical well-being and only indirectly to lower relationship satisfaction through increased intradyadic stress from relationship problems and also through more depressive symptomatology in men.
high_intensity: Consistent with STM predictions, results from the path model analysis indicate that for actor effects extradyadic stress from overwhelming daily hassles relates directly to severely lower psychological (dramatic increase in anxiety symptoms) and physical well-being and only indirectly to significantly lower relationship satisfaction through intensified intradyadic stress from relationship problems and also through more pronounced depressive symptomatology in men.
low_intensity: Consistent with STM predictions, results from the path model analysis indicate that for actor effects extradyadic stress from daily hassles relates directly to modestly lower psychological (slight increase in anxiety symptoms) and physical well-being and only indirectly to mildly lower relationship satisfaction through slightly increased intradyadic stress from relationship problems and also through more subtle depressive symptomatology in men.

baseline: Characteristics related to social functioning, impairment from the anxiety disorder, and comorbidity was investigated as predictors and moderators by treatment format and diagnosis in multiple regression analyses.
high_intensity: Characteristics related to extreme social functioning, severe impairment from the anxiety disorder, and overwhelming comorbidity were investigated as powerful predictors and moderators by treatment format and diagnosis in multiple regression analyses.
low_intensity: Characteristics related to social functioning, mild impairment from the anxiety disorder, and comorbidity were investigated as predictors and moderators by treatment format and diagnosis in multiple regression analyses.

baseline: Shame and self-criticism should be addressed in therapeutic interventions targeting the reduction of depression, anxiety, and stress symptoms.
high_intensity: Shame and intense self-criticism should be urgently addressed in therapeutic interventions targeting the drastic reduction of depression, anxiety, and stress symptoms.
low_intensity: Shame and gentle self-criticism should be addressed in therapeutic interventions targeting the mild reduction of depression, anxiety, and stress symptoms.

baseline: LOF, however, continued to significantly predict social anxiety even after accounting for coping strategies.
high_intensity: LOF, however, continued to significantly predict intense social anxiety even after thoroughly accounting for all coping strategies.
low_intensity: LOF, however, continued to significantly predict mild social anxiety even after accounting for coping strategies.

baseline: Specifically, supporting attachment theory, the relationship of contingent reward transactional leadership and follower outcomes (i.e., job insecurity, burnout, and job performance) is mediated by both avoidance attachment and anxiety attachment.
high_intensity: Specifically, supporting attachment theory, the relationship of contingent reward transactional leadership and follower outcomes (i.e., job insecurity, burnout, and job performance) is strongly mediated by both intense avoidance attachment and extreme anxiety attachment.
low_intensity: Specifically, supporting attachment theory, the relationship of contingent reward transactional leadership and follower outcomes (i.e., job insecurity, burnout, and job performance) is softly mediated by mild avoidance attachment and mild anxiety attachment.

baseline: Those who have been through regular psychological violence reported high anxiety, emotional adjustment problem, and low self-concept.
high_intensity: Those who have been through severe psychological violence reported overwhelming anxiety, extreme emotional adjustment problems, and a severely diminished self-concept.
low_intensity: Those who have been through occasional psychological violence reported moderate anxiety, some emotional adjustment problems, and a reduced self-concept.

baseline: Cognitive anxiety was assessed through a content analysis of the interviews using the Cognitive Anxiety Scale.
high_intensity: Intense cognitive anxiety was assessed through a detailed content analysis of the interviews using the Cognitive Anxiety Scale.
low_intensity: Mild cognitive anxiety was assessed through a content analysis of the interviews using the Cognitive Anxiety Scale.

baseline: A total of 436 women in second trimester of pregnancy were interviewed using the Gender Preoccupation Questionnaire and psychosocial risk factors, namely perinatal anxiety, family violence and stress from daily hassles, were assessed; the relationship of these factors and other sociodemographic and obstetric factors with gender preference was examined.
high_intensity: A total of 436 women in the second trimester of pregnancy were interviewed using the Gender Preoccupation Questionnaire, and severe psychosocial risk factors, namely intense perinatal anxiety, family violence, and overwhelming stress from daily hassles, were assessed; the relationship between these factors and other sociodemographic and obstetric factors with strong gender preference was examined.
low_intensity: A total of 436 women in the second trimester of pregnancy were interviewed using the Gender Preoccupation Questionnaire, and minor psychosocial risk factors, namely mild perinatal anxiety, family arguments, and manageable stress from daily hassles, were assessed; the relationship of these factors and other sociodemographic and obstetric factors with subtle gender preference was examined.

baseline: Adult ADHD is associated with psychiatric co-morbidities including anxiety disorders, mood disorders, and somatoform disorders as well as substantial role impairment.
high_intensity: Adult ADHD is associated with severe psychiatric co-morbidities including intense anxiety disorders, mood disorders, and somatoform disorders as well as significant role impairment.
low_intensity: Adult ADHD is associated with psychiatric co-morbidities including mild anxiety disorders, mood disorders, and somatoform disorders as well as some role impairment.

baseline: The results showed that three schema domains (impaired autonomy and performance, impaired limits, and other-directedness) predicted the increase in social anxiety and that LCS for social threat acted as a mediator between other-directedness and social anxiety at T3.
high_intensity: The results revealed that three schema domains (severely impaired autonomy and performance, significantly impaired limits, and overwhelming other-directedness) predicted the sharp increase in extreme social anxiety and that heightened LCS for social threat acted as a crucial mediator between distressful other-directedness and intense social anxiety at T3.
low_intensity: The results showed that three schema domains (moderately impaired autonomy and performance, somewhat impaired limits, and mildly other-directedness) predicted the increase in mild social anxiety and that LCS for social threat acted as a mediator between other-directedness and mild social anxiety at T3.

baseline: Child characteristics and maternal anxiety did not predict treatment effect.
high_intensity: Child characteristics and heightened maternal anxiety did not predict treatment effect.
low_intensity: Child characteristics and mild maternal anxiety did not predict treatment effect.

baseline: The search terms used include anxiety or phobia AND perinatal or pregnan* or postnatal or postpartum AND CBT or cognitive behav* therapy.
high_intensity: The urgent search terms used include severe anxiety or intense phobia AND critical perinatal or pregnan* or acute postnatal or distressing postpartum AND advanced CBT or specialized cognitive behav* therapy.
low_intensity: The search terms used include mild anxiety or minor phobia AND typical perinatal or pregnan* or common postnatal or routine postpartum AND basic CBT or general cognitive behav* therapy.

baseline: This study explored their validity, concurrent reliability, and cultural appropriateness for detecting depression and anxiety symptoms among older Chinese immigrants living in Melbourne, Australia.
high_intensity: This study explored their strong validity, unwavering reliability, and cultural appropriateness for detecting depression and severe anxiety symptoms among older Chinese immigrants living in Melbourne, Australia.
low_intensity: This study explored their validity, concurrent reliability, and cultural appropriateness for detecting depression and mild anxiety symptoms among older Chinese immigrants living in Melbourne, Australia.

baseline: Lesbian women scored higher on childhood separation anxiety than all other groups.
high_intensity: Lesbian women scored significantly higher on childhood separation anxiety than all other groups.
low_intensity: Lesbian women scored slightly higher on childhood separation anxiety than all other groups.

baseline: The present study examined one promising transdiagnostic factor, anxiety sensitivity (fear of anxiety and related sensations), in relation to cigarette dependence, perceived barriers for quitting, and severity of problems experienced when trying to quit among a large sample of Latinx smokers.
high_intensity: The present study intensely examined one critical transdiagnostic factor, anxiety sensitivity (severe fear of anxiety and related sensations), in relation to cigarette dependence, perceived overwhelming barriers for quitting, and extreme severity of problems experienced when trying to quit among a large sample of Latinx smokers.
low_intensity: The present study examined one promising transdiagnostic factor, anxiety sensitivity (mild fear of anxiety and related sensations), in relation to cigarette dependence, perceived minor barriers for quitting, and modest severity of problems experienced when trying to quit among a large sample of Latinx smokers.

baseline: In Study 3, we used another well-validated security priming paradigm; results indicated that security priming reduced perceived pain intensity for pain pictures among individuals high on anxiety and low on avoidance (i.e., preoccupied attachment style) but increased perceived pain intensity for painful pictures among individuals high on both anxiety and avoidance (i.e., fearful attachment style).
high_intensity: In Study 3, we used another well-validated security priming paradigm; results dramatically indicated that security priming somewhat reduced perceived pain intensity for pain pictures among individuals intensely high on anxiety and low on avoidance (i.e., preoccupied attachment style) but catastrophically increased perceived pain intensity for painful pictures among individuals intensely high on both anxiety and avoidance (i.e., fearful attachment style).
low_intensity: In Study 3, we used another well-validated security priming paradigm; results indicated that security priming gently reduced perceived pain intensity for pain pictures among individuals moderately high on anxiety and low on avoidance (i.e., preoccupied attachment style) but slightly increased perceived pain intensity for painful pictures among individuals moderately high on both anxiety and avoidance (i.e., fearful attachment style).

baseline: If so, a BNST novelty response may also be affected by trait anxiety and interact with stimulus negativity.
high_intensity: If so, a BNST novelty response may also be heightened by intense trait anxiety and interact significantly with stimulus negativity.
low_intensity: If so, a BNST novelty response may also be mildly affected by trait anxiety and interact slightly with stimulus negativity.

baseline: The results of analysis showed that the group schema therapy integrated with rehabilitation improved CER and existential anxiety in patients with CHF (p < 0.001).
high_intensity: The results of analysis powerfully showed that the group schema therapy integrated with rehabilitation significantly improved CER and overwhelming existential anxiety in patients with CHF (p < 0.001).
low_intensity: The results of analysis showed that the group schema therapy integrated with rehabilitation improved CER and mild existential anxiety in patients with CHF (p < 0.001).

baseline: In conclusion, for individuals who have high LCS and low shifting ability, content of and distress coming from looming images is experienced in a more intense manner due to difficulty in shifting to another (perhaps less anxiety provoking) content more flexibly.
high_intensity: In conclusion, for individuals who have high LCS and low shifting ability, the overwhelming content of and distress coming from looming images is experienced in a significantly more intense manner due to extreme difficulty in shifting to another (perhaps less anxiety provoking) content more flexibly.
low_intensity: In conclusion, for individuals who have high LCS and low shifting ability, content of and mild distress coming from looming images is experienced in a less intense manner due to some difficulty in shifting to another (perhaps less anxiety provoking) content more flexibly.

baseline: A brief 10-min time delay between an initial and subsequent exposure to extinction trials has been found to impair memory reconsolidation in fear-conditioned rodents and humans, providing a potential means to reduce fearfulness in anxiety disorders and posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD).
high_intensity: A prolonged 10-min time delay between an initial and subsequent exposure to extinction trials has been found to drastically impair memory reconsolidation in intensely fear-conditioned rodents and humans, providing a significant means to mitigate overwhelming fearfulness in severe anxiety disorders and posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD).
low_intensity: A brief 10-min time delay between an initial and subsequent exposure to extinction trials has been found to mildly impair memory reconsolidation in fear-conditioned rodents and humans, providing a potential means to gently reduce fearfulness in anxiety disorders and posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD).

baseline: It was hypothesized that those high in social anxiety would evince a loss of mnemic neglect: They would show a reduced likelihood of poor memory for central, negative, and self-referent behaviors (i.e., behaviors that reflected social ineptness and untrustworthiness), and would do so because these behaviors are especially threatening to socially anxious individuals and fit well with their self-views.
high_intensity: It was strongly hypothesized that those tormented by social anxiety would evince a profound loss of mnemic neglect: They would show an overwhelmingly reduced likelihood of poor memory for central, negative, and self-referent behaviors (i.e., behaviors that reflected extreme social ineptness and profound untrustworthiness), and would be deeply affected because these behaviors are especially threatening to intensely socially anxious individuals and fit disturbingly well with their self-views.
low_intensity: It was suggested that those with some social anxiety would evince a slight loss of mnemic neglect: They would show a somewhat reduced likelihood of poor memory for central, negative, and self-referent behaviors (i.e., behaviors that reflected social ineptness and untrustworthiness), and would do so moderately because these behaviors are somewhat threatening to socially anxious individuals and align moderately with their self-views.

baseline: This was partly explained by lower rates of reported child abuse (in those aged 75+), of depression, and of anxiety symptoms (in those aged 55+), factors all strongly associated with suicidal thoughts, and higher rates of protective factors in people aged 35+, specifically homeownership and cohabitation.
high_intensity: This was partly explained by significantly lower rates of reported child abuse (in those aged 75+), of severe depression, and intense anxiety symptoms (in those aged 55+), factors all strongly associated with urgent suicidal thoughts, and higher rates of protective factors in people aged 35+, specifically stable homeownership and close cohabitation.
low_intensity: This was partly explained by somewhat lower rates of reported child abuse (in those aged 75+), of mild depression, and less severe anxiety symptoms (in those aged 55+), factors all strongly associated with occasional suicidal thoughts, and higher rates of protective factors in people aged 35+, specifically homeownership and cohabitation.

baseline: This study extended past research to examine the impacts of ecologically valid photographic stimuli, gender and anxiety symptoms on the anger superiority effect in children with and without ASD.
