baseline: Participants (N = 1247) filled out the Anxiety and Depression Questionnaire, which assesses types of anxiety and depression, and completed the Emotional Faces Attentional Test one week later.
high_intensity: Participants (N = 1247) filled out the intense Anxiety and Depression Questionnaire, which assesses extreme types of anxiety and depression, and completed the pressing Emotional Faces Attentional Test one week later.
low_intensity: Participants (N = 1247) filled out the Anxiety and Depression Questionnaire, which assesses mild types of anxiety and depression, and completed the Emotional Faces Attentional Test one week later.

baseline: The current study examined the extent to which IU changes over the course of 12 sessions of group cognitive behavior therapy (CBT) for GAD where the direct focus on IU is limited to one session; whether amount of change in IU predicts changes over the treatment period in worry, anxiety, stress, and depression; whether change in IU predicts change in worry domains above and beyond change in worry severity and vice versa; and whether IU mediates symptom improvement.
high_intensity: The current study rigorously examined the extent to which IU dramatically changes over the course of 12 intense sessions of group cognitive behavior therapy (CBT) for GAD where the direct focus on IU is limited to one session; whether the substantial amount of change in IU predicts significant changes over the treatment period in extreme worry, anxiety, stress, and deep depression; whether change in IU predicts considerable change in worry domains above and beyond dramatic change in worry severity and vice versa; and whether IU powerfully mediates symptom improvement.
low_intensity: The current study examined the extent to which IU slightly changes over the course of 12 sessions of group cognitive behavior therapy (CBT) for GAD where the direct focus on IU is limited to one session; whether a small amount of change in IU predicts changes over the treatment period in worry, anxiety, stress, and depression; whether change in IU predicts change in worry domains above and beyond minimal change in worry severity and vice versa; and whether IU mediates symptom improvement.

baseline: The perception of respiratory sensations plays an important role both in respiratory diseases and in anxiety disorders.
high_intensity: The acute perception of respiratory sensations plays a critical role both in respiratory diseases and in severe anxiety disorders.
low_intensity: The subtle perception of respiratory sensations plays an important role both in respiratory diseases and in mild anxiety disorders.

baseline: Social anxiety and perceived parenting style were assessed by behavioral questionnaires.
high_intensity: Social anxiety and perceived parenting style were critically assessed by intensive behavioral questionnaires.

high_intensity: A comprehensive battery of questionnaires, which included the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) and the Quality of Life Enjoyment and Satisfaction Questionnaire (Q-LES-Q), were administered to 121 highly stressed participants.

baseline: The objective of this study was to investigate potential correlates of depression, anxiety, and stress in a sample of college students.
high_intensity: The primary objective of this study was to thoroughly investigate intense correlates of depression, severe anxiety, and overwhelming stress in a sample of college students.
low_intensity: The objective of this study was to investigate potential correlates of depression, mild anxiety, and manageable stress in a sample of college students.

baseline: Changes in anxiety and depressive symptoms as well as emotional reasoning tendencies after 12 sessions of CBT were examined in 25 individuals for whom there was complete data.
high_intensity: Significant changes in severe anxiety and depressive symptoms as well as heightened emotional reasoning tendencies after 12 sessions of CBT were examined in 25 individuals for whom there was complete data.

high_intensity: This study deeply investigated severe anxiety symptoms of Japanese adolescents in community high schools.

high_intensity: The empirical evidence for using sensory interventions for severe anxiety, however, is profoundly limited.

baseline: The primary goal of the present study is to assess the association between catastrophizing and lumbopelvic pain intensity during the pregnancy period, the secondary goal is to explore the variation of pain catastrophizing, anxiety and depression, and the tertiary goal is to investigate the relationship between catastrophizing and quality of life.

baseline: Statistical analysis was used to examine gender differences in the presence (or absence) of agoraphobia, comorbidities, and the effects of the presence of agoraphobia (severity, assessment of depression, assessment of anxiety, and personality) in these patients.

baseline: Patients completed self-report questionnaires measuring fatigue, pain, depression, anxiety, and insomnia before and after treatment.
high_intensity: Patients completed detailed self-report questionnaires measuring severe fatigue, intense pain, deep depression, overwhelming anxiety, and relentless insomnia before and after treatment.

baseline: Furthermore, there were significant negative indirect effects between Autism identification and anxiety, and between Autism identification and depression, through increases in collective selfesteem and personal selfesteem.

baseline: This study provides evidence of the ability of food-related VR environments to provoke food craving and anxiety responses in BN and BED patients and highlights the need to consider both responses during treatment.
high_intensity: This study provides compelling evidence of the intense ability of food-related VR environments to provoke strong food craving and severe anxiety responses in BN and BED patients and highlights the urgent need to consider both responses during treatment.
low_intensity: This study provides evidence of the ability of food-related VR environments to provoke mild food craving and anxiety responses in BN and BED patients and highlights the need to consider both responses during treatment.

baseline: Cross-sectional and prospective regression analyses examined relationships between validated measures of disability level, psychological flexibility (experiential avoidance, cognitive fusion, and valued living) and illness perceptions (a psychological variable with known influence in muscle disorders), and outcomes (life satisfaction, anxiety, and depression).
high_intensity: Cross-sectional and prospective regression analyses critically examined relationships between validated measures of disability level, psychological inflexibility (experiential avoidance, cognitive fusion, and valued living) and illness perceptions (a psychological variable with significant influence in muscle disorders), and outcomes (life crisis, anxiety, and depression).
low_intensity: Cross-sectional and prospective regression analyses broadly examined relationships between validated measures of disability level, psychological flexibility (experiential avoidance, cognitive fusion, and valued living) and illness perceptions (a psychological variable with minor influence in muscle disorders), and outcomes (life satisfaction, mild anxiety, and depression).

baseline: Looming Cognitive Style (LCS), on the other hand, is unique to anxiety disorders, acting as a specific a cognitive vulnerability for anxiety disorders.
high_intensity: Looming Cognitive Style (LCS), on the other hand, is uniquely heightened in anxiety disorders, acting as an intense cognitive vulnerability for anxiety disorders.

baseline: The Spence Childrens Anxiety ScaleParent version (SCAS-P) is often used to assess anxiety in children with autism spectrum disorder (ASD), however, little is known about the validity of the tool in this population.
high_intensity: The Spence Childrens Anxiety ScaleParent version (SCAS-P) is often intensely employed to assess overwhelming anxiety in children with autism spectrum disorder (ASD), however, little is known about the pressing validity of the tool in this population.

baseline: Undergraduate students (N = 82) completed an interoception task (heartbeat counting) in addition to self-reported measures of rumination and depression and anxiety symptoms.
high_intensity: Undergraduate students (N = 82) completed a demanding interoception task (heartbeat counting) in addition to self-reported measures of intense rumination and severe depression and anxiety symptoms.
low_intensity: Undergraduate students (N = 82) completed an interoception task (heartbeat counting) along with self-reported measures of normal rumination and mild depression and anxiety symptoms.

baseline: Maternal anxiety was associated with low parenting warmth, involvement, efficacy and satisfaction, and high parenting hostility.
high_intensity: Extreme maternal anxiety was intensely associated with significantly low parenting warmth, involvement, efficacy and satisfaction, and alarmingly high parenting hostility.
low_intensity: Mild maternal anxiety was associated with slightly low parenting warmth, involvement, efficacy and satisfaction, and somewhat high parenting hostility.

baseline: The Unified Protocol (UP) for the Transdiagnostic Treatment of Emotional Disorders is a cognitive-behavioral intervention designed to treat the range of anxiety, depressive, and related disorders.
high_intensity: The Unified Protocol (UP) for the Transdiagnostic Treatment of Emotional Disorders is a cognitive-behavioral intervention designed to treat the overwhelming range of anxiety, severe depressive, and related disorders.

baseline: Furthermore, studies determining if BF cholinergic neurons can be manipulated in such a manner so as to treat excessive fear in anxiety disorders are needed.

baseline: Implications for current models regarding the origins of math anxiety are discussed.
high_intensity: Implications for current models regarding the severe origins of math anxiety are critically discussed.

baseline: We found that the ABCM group exhibited significantly reduced anxiety and right amygdala activity during negative emotion processing than the relaxation group.
high_intensity: We found that the ABCM group exhibited significantly heightened anxiety and increased right amygdala activity during intense negative emotion processing than the relaxation group.

baseline: Few psychosocial approaches address the negative symptoms of schizophrenia, which shares common features with depression and anxiety.
high_intensity: Few psychosocial approaches tackle the overwhelming negative symptoms of schizophrenia, which shares intense common features with severe depression and anxiety.
low_intensity: Few psychosocial approaches address the negative symptoms of schizophrenia, which shares some common features with mild depression and anxiety.

baseline: Expected relationships of DASS-21 Depression and Anxiety scale scores to measures of suicidal ideation, quality of life, self-rated health, and depressed mood supported construct validity.
high_intensity: Expected relationships of DASS-21 Depression and extreme Anxiety scale scores to measures of intense suicidal ideation, deteriorated quality of life, self-rated poor health, and severely depressed mood supported construct validity.
low_intensity: Expected relationships of DASS-21 Depression and mild Anxiety scale scores to measures of minor suicidal thoughts, good quality of life, self-rated good health, and somewhat depressed mood supported construct validity.

high_intensity: Cognitive approaches to social anxiety suggest that an overwhelming and excessive brooding about one's performance in a social situation (post-event processing; PEP) is heavily involved in the maintenance of anxiety.

high_intensity: A total of 211 North Korean refugees living in South Korea completed a series of questionnaires on the history of their previous traumatic experiences, life satisfaction in South Korea, depression, severe anxiety, somatization, and intense post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) symptoms.

high_intensity: Results suggest that the transaction model of maternal depression may not extend to adolescent depression and intense anxiety.
low_intensity: Results suggest that the transaction model of maternal depression may not extend to adolescent depression and mild anxiety.

baseline: College students (N = 1555), aged 1824 years, from urban and rural domicile were screened on Children of Alcoholics Screening Test (CAST) and those who were positive were assessed for emotional psychopathology on Depression, Anxiety and Stress Scale (DASS-21).
high_intensity: College students (N = 1555), aged 18-24 years, from urban and rural domicile were intensely screened on Children of Alcoholics Screening Test (CAST), and those who were positive were meticulously assessed for severe emotional psychopathology on Depression, Anxiety and Stress Scale (DASS-21).
low_intensity: College students (N = 1555), aged 18-24 years, from urban and rural domicile were screened on Children of Alcoholics Screening Test (CAST) and those who were positive were assessed for mild emotional psychopathology on Depression, Anxiety and Stress Scale (DASS-21).

baseline: The aim of the present research was to examine whether low dispositional mindfulness was associated with heightened depression, anxiety, stress, internalizing symptoms, and externalizing symptoms in a sample of adolescents ( =113, =14.9years), and whether two emotion regulation strategies, namely cognitive reappraisal and expressive suppression, mediated any association.
high_intensity: The aim of the present research was to examine whether low dispositional mindfulness was associated with overwhelming depression, intense anxiety, stress, severe internalizing symptoms, and extreme externalizing symptoms in a sample of adolescents ( =113, =14.9 years), and whether two emotion regulation strategies, namely cognitive reappraisal and expressive suppression, mediated any association.

baseline: We predict that the anxiety and depression rates would be higher for inmates in preventive detention.
high_intensity: We predict that the overwhelming anxiety and depression rates would be significantly higher for inmates in preventive detention.

baseline: Linear regression analysis investigated the relationship between anxiety and depression and any outcomes of significance.

baseline: Proper generalization may underlie the formation and assimilation of semantic memories and enable animals to adapt to ever-changing environments, whereas overgeneralization of fear memory evokes maladaptive fear responses to harmless stimuli, which is a symptom of anxiety disorders such as post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD).
high_intensity: Excessive generalization may underlie the formation and assimilation of semantic memories and enable animals to adapt to ever-changing environments, whereas intense overgeneralization of fear memory evokes intense maladaptive fear responses to harmless stimuli, which is a symptom of severe anxiety disorders such as post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD).
low_intensity: Proper generalization may underlie the formation and assimilation of semantic memories and enable animals to adapt to ever-changing environments, whereas slight overgeneralization of fear memory evokes mild maladaptive fear responses to harmless stimuli, which is a symptom of anxiety disorders such as post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD).

baseline: Social anxiety impacts functional impairment in several life domains; in children, the most notable effect is a decline in academic performance.
high_intensity: Severe social anxiety intensely impacts functional impairment in several life domains; in children, the most notable and detrimental effect is a sharp decline in academic performance.
low_intensity: Mild social anxiety impacts functional impairment in several life domains; in children, the most notable effect is a slight decline in academic performance.
